This temple is devoted to lord Krishna. The area covered by the temple is huge but it is very beautiful. If you reach on time you may see the morning or evening prayers performed by the priests there. they sing and dance to various Krishna songs and is a absolute delight to see it.
Its a wonderful temple located in west bangalore. Very popular among tourists and localites alike. Very peaceful temple.
We visited this temple and i mist say the temple is located in an awesome surrounding and the place is really calm and one can sit and look at the krishna and chant ..loved this temple
Very good holly place in Bangalore. Crowded place in weekends and holidays. Well maintained place and you can get many more items inside related to Lord Krishna.

This place is very well connected and within the city towards north of Bangalore
A good place to visit and enjoy the peace and charm of this temple. A very nice arrangement of healthy and pure food for visitors
richness of culture, richness of architecture, cleanliness to the core, kriishna in magnificence, a following very strong

Stayed at ISKCON guest house on 08 Dec and had Darshan twice morning and evening. Very beautiful statues of Lord Krishna and others. Serene peaceful and wonderful experience. Very big premises with continuous Hare Krishna chants. Loved it. Hare Krishna.
A well-run and maintained temple for a religious visit while in Bangalore. Variety of prasadam items.
Very nice temple.This is must go place for us whenever someone visit us we take them to this place . Every one like the calmness and peace of this place.
Such a fantastic temple located in centre of the city. Wonderful place for meditation who feels their happiness in their form of god .

If you go there are things you need to know - you have to wear long pants or they will make you wear and wraparound that is hard to walk in; and you will need to take your shoes and socks off for the entire tour process. No big deal, but you have to put them in a sack at the entrance to the grounds, they give you a numbered chip that you will need to get your shoes and socks back. Also you have the choice of "Donating" at the beginning (just before you take off your shoes) to move ahead of the lines and have the opportunity for personal prayers. I do recommend this and although you may donate as much as you want, 300R (~$4) gets you all the additional benefits. The lines can be really long; the day I was there, there were several schools attending and the lines were long.

Once inside the Temple, the monks (?) will pray for you several times. This makes it a very personal experience and is the key reason for the donation. The monks I was with were very kind and accommodating, I enjoyed the experience (even though I am a Christian).

I have always wanted to this temple and got the chance beautiful Temple with lovely location and huge spacious grounds,the inside of the temple the Murtis and the Srinagar of Radha- Krishna did not wanted to move from there Beautiful,the best part is performing the Arti amazing every one seems to be in a different world.
Ita a really good temple were temple is very cleaned and maintained the place of water is too good and food over there is good and the prasada is very nice

I visited Bangalore several times in past but never got the right opportunity to make a trip to this temple. So, this time when I visited, I made it a point that I must give this is a visit. And believe me, I feel so pleased and satisfied that I did not miss it this time. It is located a bit outskirt of Bangalore city center but easily connected by all modes of transportation, be it on your own or public transport. The passageway of entrance till up to the main temple is well managed to easily handle the peak load in a disciplined and queued manner. For devotees of Lord Krishna it is one of the destination. For others, it could be a recommended visit due to its spiritual flavor and the organized approach of allowing people to bestow their worship or offerings to the Lord Krishna. Besides the spiritual or religious aspect, this could still be considered as the lace where you could spend some quality time sitting idle and regrouping yourself internally gaining some peace of mind. Photography inside is strictly prohibited and it allows you time to spend without being distracted too much. I missed the evening Aarti due to time crunch, however, feel so pleased to visit this temple. There are plenty of food options available in the canteen at quite reasonable price. The bookshop has a rich collection of religious books in several languages including English. The souvenir shop has a plenty of options to buy decorative or gift items. It is highly recommended to visit early hours of the day to bypass the crowd of the mid-day, specially in case you are making a plan for a visit over the weekends or holidays.

The temple is located next to the Narayana Nethralaya on West of Chord Road. The nearest metro station is MAHALAXMI. The temple is on a hill and one has to climb the stairs to reach a place where one can leave their footwear and get a token for the same. Then, one continues up the steps and goes through the main entrance, a favourite spot for selfies! Inside the main entrance is an open space where you may sit for a while. Then, the one enters the small temple and exits to climb the stairs to the main hall. The hall is very peaceful and the ceiling is very high. However, the sounds of prayers reverbate throughout the hall. Once one finishes praying before the deities, one may sit in the hall's designated sitting area and get immersed in the thoughts of the almighty.
After one finishes their prayer, one exits via another set of steps. All the entrances and exits are clearly marked by signposts. And, there are temple employees and volunteers to help if any information is required.
As one walks down the steps, one encounters various stalls of sweets, holy books and artifacts. If one wishes to purchase any item one can do so.
Now, people who come by vehicles have a separate entrance which takes them all the way up to the temple. And, for disabled people the temple offers assistance and lifts are available. Now, I cannot comment on how good the facilities are for disabled people as I did not see one being used by a disabled person. However, I did see a signpost for a disabled person toilet and some wheel chairs near the entrance.
This is one temple where architecture is pretty similar to other ISKON temples.Parking takes time on weekends and dont miss the aarthi here
The place is very good and filled with divine ambiance. The elevation of mandir also helps to enjoy cool breeze in evenings. A must visit.
Not so much to see. Also at the entrance desk some guys select people to pay for the entrance while the others can pass without pay, very strange.

Well structured and organized temple. One of a kind visiting experience. Apart from the main temple, there is plenty of stalls and other options for temple related shopping and knowledge experience. Books, idols and many gifts options are spread across many stalls. Refreshments are also available. You need not to worry about your footwear and bags too, as it all can be safely kept at the entrance at a very small charge.
Such a fantastic temple located in centre of the city. Wonderful place for meditation who feels their happiness in their form of god .

Had a leisurely darshan and partook divine prasad bhojana at ISKCON Bengaluru. Piousness touched both stomach and soul.
Well maintained and beautiful temple among the Hare Krishna Hare Rama temples. We had a good darshan when we visited here in this November 2018.

I really like the place very much and environment
And I liked the restriction on the dress code. which is really required in every other temples as well I appreciate the management for this
Feels Like heaven, Go in the evening during the Aarti time, its full of devotees, singing the aarti and awaiting Darshan of Shree Krishna and Radha.

I m visiting this place from past 20 years. It is great place for peace and tranquility.
I enjoy the Bajan and Discourses given by guru ji's. The hill consist of other gods shrines.

Krishna is described as the source of all the avatars of God thus ISKCON devotees worship Krishna as the highest form of God, svayam bhagavan, and often refer to him as "the Supreme Personality of Godhead" in writing, which was a phrase coined by Prabhupada in his books on the subjectTo devotees, Radharepresents Krishna's divine female counterpart, the original spiritual potency, and the embodiment of divine love. The individual soul is an eternal personal identity which does not ultimately merge into any formless light or void as suggested by the monistic (Advaita) schools of Hinduism.

Very well maintained temple, it has a peaceful vibe inside with all the chanting thats going on at low volume. well organise din terms of the crowd it receives and very clean. loved seeing the deepotasava pooja during navratri month

One of the Best and must visit places in Bangalore. Best maintained. Very peaceful. Beautiful temple. Marvellous structures. One has to claim the steps to reach Krishna temple. Meanwhile you will come across shopping and food places. From top one can view the Bangalore city. Car parking available.

A nice monument. Extravagant building and decor. The good part os that it is airy and well lit compared to conventional temples. There is good parking space and provision to store footwear. It has some store to buy goodies and souvenirs if you want.
They do have a convention hall on the campus that can be rented out. Not meant to be a religious place for worship in my opinion, it's mainly a place of tourist attraction. Worth visiting to appreciate the structure and opulent interior.

We were very lucky because visting this temple we got the chance to assist to a special ceremony. I can't say if it is a regular one. It was a Friday evening. If you have opportinity to see if it will give you a peacefull feeling.

Really loved the place.it is one of my favorite place whenever you want to relax and devot your self you can go to this place as I m fan if lord Krishna so I loved this place
Jai shree Krishna

One of the architecturally and aesthetically beautiful Krishna temples I have visited so far and you get positive vibes once you are there at the temple. After darshan, one can have ‚Äòprasadam' either at the sale counters or free prasadam (full meal) which is served in the afternoon time. Lord Krishna, the presiding deity, attracts even a non believer of God, once he/she is there! We keep visiting this temple quite frequently. Recently, we participated in ‚ÄòDeepostava Celebrations' on one of the evenings of ‚ÄòKarthika' (November) month.

Krishna is Supreme Personality of godhead. Like that only this temple built by ISKCON. and i felt very blessed. Every month when i felt down i will go to this Temple and Felt Blessed. Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
the iskon temple is very beautiful and instantly one feels the spirituality on entering the temple and is a must visit

The temple is situated on a hillock and as tod to me is the largest ISKCON temple in the world.
The temple is quite majestic and leads to devotional feeling and calm and peace in mind.
The Prasad served was also very good.
Will again visit the temple.

Best time to go is early morning as its more peaceful
during that time. After Darshan , there's a great cafe to enjoy some good food.
I have visited many ISKCON temples in India. While this may not be amongst the best temples out there but it is still worth a visit.
Must visit place in Bengaluru. This is the new signature place where every visitor would want to visit to see the beautifully decorated idols of lord Krishna & Balarama.
Visited this beautiful temple with my family. Nicely built temple with a lot of open space. Very calm and peaceful. The food was also good.
When you go in the temple it gives a lot of positive emerge.. you should visit if one going to Bangalore and have a time

The rathyatra celebration is always a must-see in all ISKCON temples across the world. I was fortunate to visit the temple during the last Rath.
Bangalore ISKCON temple is specifically interesting because of it's unique hilltop location providing the visitors a fantastic bird's eye view of Rajajinagar and surrounding l9ocations.
During monsoon, it is really picturesque.
You can participate in the Rangoli and decoration work alongwith other devotees whether you are a first timer or regular.
The temple has a sprawling campus and the prasadam served is very tasty.

The entrance made us feel devotional.The way hikes up slowly leading inside.lord Narasimha and venkateshwara are seen before entering into main temple.The environment is so pleasant.The place is well maintained.No photography is allowed inside the temple premises.The architecture is quite awesome.The exit is lead by a group of stores where you can get Krishna idols ,flutes,tshirts,etc.,This place is near to Orion mall so you can visit this temple and reach out the mall to spend some more time.
Lovely welcoming people! Choose a donation level at the beginning to skip queues and receive a blessing and some literature. Very beautiful, moving.
Place is beauty. The place is intricately designed with marble on the walls telling the story of Lord Krishna. The idol is adorned with flowers and jewelry. Place is secure and clean.
ISKCON - International Society for Krishna Consciousness, is located in Rajaji Nagar. One of the beautiful and peaceful temples in Bangalore.

A huge temple complex dedicated to Lord Krishna located in the Rajajinagar area of Bengaluru and is one of the largest ISKON temples in the world. The architecture, craftsmanship and the planning of this temple is just amazing. You will have to climb up to reach the top to have a magnificent view of the idols of Radha and Krishna which is truly mesmerizing. Lots of greenery surrounding the temple and the food here is pretty good. Mark this place as one of the places to visit if you are in Bengaluru.

Saw very few HK's during the visit, which is run like entering a stadium for sports event with bag and shoe leaving and then barriers and queues, but quite fast, and then glimpses of statues covered in bling, and the story of HK and their last man. They give free food at end in leaf containers. You can buy sweets, but the rest of the stuff on sale is tacty cheap and even the incense smells like cheap hooker perfume.
When I came to Bangalore my 1st visit here only such a big temple so nice beautiful very clean I nice I really happy to see

It's in center of the hustle and bustle of the city, I must say city has spread around the temple though. Still it's serene inside. Volunteer are helpful and they guide well.
Food court inside has lots of options.

It is absolutely spectacular work of art
fine craftsmanship and architecture all the way through
Its a must-see when visiting Bangalore
We visited ISCON early morning at 7:00 AM. It was very serein and peaceful. The prayers were very intriguing and we were fully engrossed. the rush was very limited and we could do peaceful darshans.
One of the biggest Among the other ISKCON and idol here looks beautifully. Weekends it will be crowded.
Lord Krishna temple. It is one of the best places to visit in Bangalore on a weekend with your family and friends.

This is an imposing temple on hilltop with rich architecture. Professionally managed, clean and lively temple.
Palki Utasav in the evening is a unique and provides great darshan.
Akshaya Patra is a project undertaken by temple to provide meals to children, in a radius of 70 kms daily. The kitchen where the food is cooked is a pleasant surprise -clean,orderly .

I recently visited twice recently. I found this place very clean and well managed. There is provision for elderly person to use the lift to reach the place of worship without much trouble. The pooja hall is well maintained and beautiful. You can sit and meditate.

Plenty of options to eat also.

Well maintained temple where you can find more than thousands of devotees and visitors. Need to climb. There are 108 steps on each side of the mantapa and at every single step devotees chant the Hare Krishna mantra once. There may be provision for aged and specially challenged devotees. Calm and peaceful, you can relax your brain and meditate. Once seeing Krishna and Radha idols, you will find way to food stalls, books and creative arts.
One of the famous and must visit tourist place in Bengaluru.
It is definitely one of the best places to visit in Bangalore on a weekend with your family and friends.

I visited this in Sept 18 as this was on pending list for sometime.. It was worth it.. There was big queue early in the morning itself.. but around 30mts it took to reach the main sanctum. On the way you will see Lord Narasimha & Venkateshwara statues ..pray and proceed further when you will enter a huge hall with beautiful ceiling paintings depicting life of Krishna. The gold statues are beautiful. There will be some bhajans always which is very soothing to ears. If you happen to visit on special days/ festival days, prepare for serpentine queues. The complex is huge with various sections and also there is a section where the free meals (akshaya pathra) is prepared and delivered free to all govt school children. You can donate for this noble cause there itself or online. Prasadam they give is delicious.. You can also buy photos/souvenirs and also sweets from the shops there. Parking is adequate but on special days, better to hire a taxi /auto instead of your own vehicle. Metro station is just 100 mts away.. better take metro (green line).
Visited there many times. Very well kept. The crowd and the long winding route are distracting. The staff also needs better grooming.

It is absolutely spectacular work of art
fine craftsmanship and architecture all the way through
Its a must-see when visiting Bangalore
We visited ISCON early morning at 7:00 AM. It was very serein and peaceful. The prayers were very intriguing and we were fully engrossed. the rush was very limited and we could do peaceful darshans.
One of the biggest Among the other ISKCON and idol here looks beautifully. Weekends it will be crowded.

ISKCON Bangalore has a wonderful guest house with variety of well maintained rooms. Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner Prasadams are served and at economical rates. Tea/Coffee/Milk service is available in the room from 6.15 AM in morning until 7PM in night.
In case of life-membership, one can avail three days of free stay along with free Prasadam Breakfast/lunch/dinner.

We've always wanted to visit the Isckon temple Bangalore as we've heard quite a bit about it. The temple sits on a hill and is by far one of the largest temples I've ever visited. It is well organised. We walked up the stairs through a few smaller shrines before we got to the main temple.
We don't have photos inside of the temple as no photography is allowed inside.
Overall it was a pleasant experience.
A must see place. I think the largest ISKON temple in India. It is really beautiful and a must visit place. Located in the heart of the city.
Large temple with organised queues. Preferably go early in the morning to avoid crowds. They have a good vegetarian restaurant with very reasonably priced food.
Nice place to visit in weekend. Can have nice prasadam. Can buy iskcon products like The Gita or any others.

Iskcon temples everywhere are organized unlike well known old school temples. So you can pray peacefully without being harassed to conduct paid worship. This place is no exception. The food counters at the end of the journey offer delightful veg snacks which you take away or eat on the spot.
U can spend atleast 5-6 hours. Immerse in the tranquil atmosphere. If u need to skip the long queues on the weekend, take the fast track pass.
ISKCON temple Lord Krishna. Haray Rama Haray Krishna... They proving prasadam also in the temple. Must visit if you are in Bangalore.
Beautiful temple ,gives real peace of mind.Excellent food preparation Prasad. .must visit if your are in Bangalore
Feel the power of spirituality and lose yourself in the devotion of Lord Krishna. Words cant describe how feels to be there. Haray Krishna, Haray Rama, Rama Rama Hray Hray

ISKCON is a beautiful temple with mesmerizing paintings on its ceiling depicting the playful Krishna and Gopis. The morning Aarti is divine with the music and foot-tapping by the devotees to honor the benevolent Lord Krishna. The statues have a calm expression that seeps into your soul.
You can feel the Divine power and peace here. Good place in city to have some inner peace and connect to lord Krishna

I visited a week back to this place. Well organized and very much clean temple. The place is a destination for God Krishna's devotee. I really appreciate the way it is being managed. You should have prasadam, whenever you visit.
This is a very beautiful temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. I like going there to just relax and peacefulness. Nice architecture and beautiful idols and pictures of God Krishna.
A peaceful temple and best located. Nice scenery location. A place of must visit. Please avoid janmashtami time, because of huge crowd.
Since there is nothing much to do in Bengaluru one may go. But it's not really clean and one can Skipp going here.
I would like to go there every weekend days .its really peaceful and relaxing and silent. Please anyone can go and pray for his family.

I regularly visit this temple to spend some peace time and have Darshan. You have parking, food and enough place to sit down for a while in temple.
It is better to go in morning time to avoid rush, crowd and have Darshan peacefully.
They also regularly organise various events on auspicious days. However, with children it is hectic to attend such functions because parking would be full and temple would be crowded.

Beautiful and very peaceful atmosphere. Amazing views. I liked the temple architecture. Felt inner peace, rejuvenation and spiritual.

My younger kids wanted to know when the Krishna Lila theme park will be completed?
Thank you.

The location and entry point in well connected. For old age people walking is little higher. From entry to first Darshan it takes around 5 to 7min walk with some stairs in between.
The idols are like the south Indian idols to keep the southern spirit. The mail hall is the most beautiful compared to rest of the Iskon temples of India. Specially the deeps hanging on upper floors makes it like ancient sculpture.
Golden color enhances the over all spirit of temple. The idols are also golden which is something different compared to rest.

The views at night is just awesome with fountains.
Liked the calm and spiritual atmosphere..
The Darshan line push you to chant the mahamantra.

Over all awesome place,well maintained spiritual Temple.

a must visit to anybody in the city across age group. chanting hare rama hare krishna gets you closer to a spiritual level you will dicover after your visit
hare rama hare krishnahare rama hare krishnahare rama hare krishnahare rama hare krishnahare rama hare krishnahare rama hare krishna

The temple has been built very smartly and it looks very majestic. The place offers tranquility and also a great view from the top. There is another hanuman temple close-by which is a must-visit place if you are here.

Peaceful temple. Must visit if you are Lord Krishna devotee. There is enough parking, rest rooms and even good restaurants inside the temple.
There is also a store for shopping for books, artifacts etc.
We visited this temple on the day of Janmashtami. It was just amazing. The temple is huge and beautiful. Though the stalls were as usual expensive.
Nyc place but maybe avoided during rains as the long walkway gets slippery . The temple closes at 8.30PM and hence confirm the timing before going.
It's a great temple I like it most....Isko is one of the great temple entire universe....Jai shri krishna....

ISKCON Temple is must visit place for every devotional soul, you feel calm , unplugged from Tension and stressful life.
seating in main hall..watching Krishna Radha idols and listening devotional music is uncomparable.

ISKCON Bangalore, located off Rajajinagar, in the Northern peripheries of the city, is an imposing structure, well maintained. The temple is located atop a small hillock, has multiple levels, including one with a large Balaji sanctum, Radhe-Krishna, Jagannath sanctum et al.
To reach the temple, one needs to pass through the holy 108 steps chnating Hare Rama....
The cafeteria provides a range of options, complete with Sathvik food.

Visit this place, during the twilight time and feel the awesome environment. The temple has good parking facilities as well.

Almost in the centre of the city with ease of connectivity to any point. Added attraction is Mateo station and a mall and Mysore Sandel soap factory nearby making you to earmark a full day for the visit. Main shrine is peaceful with rich decoration to the idols and the surrounding area has become highly commercial with variety of souvenirs tempting you to buy. Yet it is worth it. Be watchful on a rainy day as the marble floor would be slippery and you have to walk a long distance inside.
Lets take a view of Iskcon temple lord Krishna located in Main Hall & the idol is really beautiful, but one thing which is sad part is that its become totally commercial centre, too much of crowd,
Very good and well maintained temple. Very calm and gives peace to mind and soul. Well organised and easy for Dharshan.

Bangalore's modern Krishna temple is wonderful, temple combining both ancient Hindu architecture and modern design . Built on a hill. Beautiful place. Must visit for every person who appreciate Krishna.
This is very nice place and for me it was different experience.It's very organised and well managed temple by the board.
This is a very good temple of Lord Krishna. What an amazing ride from the main gate to the temple premises. I loved it.

Amazingly quiet and clean.A good sanctum to meditate and reflect
The cool environment is a place to not be missed.Once one is seated and when you look up at the granduer of the dieties,one wishes to be in nothing but just simple comfory and keep looking at the beauty of it and let your mind free .

This was an interesting experience overall, as we ventured through the path of this temple. At first it seemed less busy but before we knew it, there were loads of people behind us. It took some skill and patience to ensure that we made it through the tight and narrow channels, which made it quote an experience.

The architecture and prayer area was great, with loads of items for purchase in the stores. The food was good and a unique taste overall.

It's really a great and awesome place. One of the best Radhey-Krishna temple in entire country, the designing of temple is so awesome that can't defined in words, it is a great view of architecture, here everything is fully Furnished and disciplined as place for keep your shoes/sleeper and your bags. It is the prayers that answer to our happiness. Please visit that temple in the heart of Bangalore. Entry to temple is open to all and do make sure to spread joy to others to visit that temple
Good to visit ISKCON in Bangalore. The environment inside this temple was soothing to the body soul. Not much crowded when I visited this temple.
It's a beautiful huge temple.very peaceful..located in city centre ..can spend an hour or so in peace here.

first of all the temple is so huge. though is in between the city the place is very peaceful.
it's a worth visiting if you are in Bangalore.

Located almost in the center of the city on a hill had a good time with the kids had some good jain food too was delicious and cheap

Only drawback is they close at 8.30 pm which is too soon for bangalore time considering traffic and work schedule

Worth visiting. A nice holy place for everyone... young or old. The temple is huge yet beautiful. Very systematically arranged.... so no problem arise even a large number of people used to visit every day. We were lucky to see the evening prayer... and it is wonderful!!!!

It was an overnight workshop starting from Saturday evening to Sunday afternoon. Had sessions on self management, diet, relationships, karma, benefits of mantras and ofcourse yoga. All the sessions were based on the principles of bhagvat gita. That's not all, you get to witness every single arti. What more? Accommodation and 3 time tasty satvik meals eveything for just ‚Çπ100. It was a great experience.

The Iskon temple in Bengaluru is a place worth visiting. It is a big temple. From an architectural point of view, it is beautifully constructed. The interior of the main mandir is ornamentally decorated. The pandal (simhasan) on which the deities are worshiped is made of silver. I think, the upper portion of the pandal are gold plated, though I have not clarified about it. There was a large number of visitors/ devotees visiting the temple, but the crowd was being managed very well. The devotional songs/ bhajans sung inside the temple was making the whole atmosphere devotional and peaceful to the soul. The Prasad was tasty. On the whole, the ambience was very good and peaceful. If I come to Bengaluru again, I will definitely visit the temple again.

This organisation is doing a great job to the community. Apart from trying to inculcate values in children and teens, they are providing free meals to school children. Its a very peaceful place, with great food/prasadam.
You don't really feel bhakti after going there given the crowd and the very expensive articles for sale.
Nice place I really enjoy that area .I will suggest to everyone to go that area and enjoy the full day.
Nicely build and a must visit when you happen to visit Bangalore. It's very well connected with the Metro as well.
Beautiful plce and near by from Royal orchid staff told me about this better and fell relaxed after cmng here
Awesome temple very nice looking me and my friend first time visiting l hope every moment bless fully,hare Krishna hare Krishna Krishna Krishna hare hare hare Rama hare Rama Rama Rama hare hare.
Maintain Very Well Sleeper Stands for devotees and Provide Fee food for every who visits the temple and nice and very peaceful place to visit
I often visit the temple at 6-8pm time when they do the aarti and mesmerizing holistic performance. It just takes you in new holy world.

ISKCON sri radha krishna temple is in Bengaluru and inaugrated in the year 1997. It is not just a temple even it is a cultural complex housing the temples dedicated to the deities of Sri Sri Krishna Balrama.It is well organized and planned management. You should come here early morning to feel the divine.
This is a must visit temple in bangalore. What we love about this temple is the greenery, the area on which it is constructed, and the canteen food is so finger licking good

Well organised and planned management. Early mornings you can feel the divine. More crowd, more noise. Long queue
Lot of walking and usage of stairs required.
After 10am it will be very hot to walk on the stairs (esp. during summer time)
There are lot of art/ craft shops and lot of eateries available.

You will feel calmness and peace when you visit this place. You have to do lot of walking to reach the main portion of the temple. But when you enter the main portion, you will really fell inner happiness.

As are the other ISCON Temples in Vrindavan and Mumbai the one at Bengaluru is really Artistic and Grand. Temples can't be categorised as they are purely related to the religious belief of people but definitely you feel good and at peace other than the Howering traffic around the Entry gates.There is an Art Gallery too inside and you can get religious idols of Lord Krishna and other related things.

If you are a tourist, planning to visit Bengaluru & listing out which are the must see places, you need to visit, when you are in Bengaluru, this Temple should & must be there, in your list, among top five.

Situated on the western part of Bengaluru, on one of the Ridges of the City wherein, the view of the City, from this Temple premises is fantastic.

The Temple premises has been maintained neat & clean and whenever you need any sort of help, there are fleet of volunteers, who are ready to assist you, with a smiling face.

After finishing the Darshan, one can quench their hunger, in any one of the food courts, which are situated in the very premises of the Temple wherein, one can taste varieties food items. Apart from the above there is also a well maintained restroom within the Temple premises.

Finally, when you are planning to visit Bengaluru, you program your tour itinerary in such a way that, you try to visit this Temple in the evening wherein, you can spend around two memorable hours in Bengaluru.

very neat and clean temple with many shopping options with very systematic queue system.
photography is not allowed so stay away from clicking photos.

No visit to Bangalore can be completed without visiting the famous ISKON Temple. Like the other ISKON Temples the deity is Krishna and similarly the sculpture is very beautiful. The place is usually crowded by the tourists and few locals too. As tourist you may end up spending a few hours to visit the temple. I strongly suggest to pay extra and go for Express Darshan" to reduce the time but if you are free and want to have the total authentic experience, you can go by the regular route, where in one has to chant Lord Krishna's name at reach steps with total 108 times. One step at a time. They have very decent pure vegetarian, Satvic for served in a restaurant just behind the temple: "Higher taste".
Its very well maintained, neat and clean place. You will feel peace here. There is a scope for some shopping too :-) also you can test some food items. Their Mysore pak was too good.

This is a Krishna temple.. one of the biggest Krishna temple in Bangalore... There are lord Balaji, Narasimha and lord Krishna... We get many Pooja items in this temple.. Very nice snacks are also available

Awesome temple with elegant sculptures and awesome prasad and food items.
Loved being there as part of aarti too

It is a nice temple but as we went on Janmashtami it was very crowded and we had to wait in queues for more than 2 hours
Praise the lord, Hare Rama hare Rama, rama rama hare hare. Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna hare hare. This is what all chant. This is the best temple I have ever seen personally
The place has a nice ambiance, sanity and well maintained a spiritual presence of all the entities .............................

Its a beautiful ISCKON temple in Bengaluru. Conveniently located on the main road. Parking is available.

Difficult to climb the stairs for elderly and people with babies as there are many.

But once you reach the top you feel worth. The aura of the place is mesmerising. We visited during evening aarti time and the way bhakts were dancing to the krishna songs was amazing.

The food court at the temple serves delicious savouries at reasonable prices. So after darshan one can actually feast at the food arena.
I was very impressed of this temple. Also the ticket you paye are used to pay food for people at scool that could not for them. I realy appreciate this.

Entrance to the temple is free. I would certainly recommend taking a metro train to get to the temple and the temple only a quick 5mnts. walk from the ‚ÄòMahalakshmi' Metro station. The temple does not allow cameras inside but can store these in a secured place. You will need to remove your footwear before entering the premises and the temple arranges to stow them away within bags in a secured place. Once you go through the passageways, you enter the main part of the temple that has an attractive gold plated altar in which Krishna and Radha deities are installed. Keep an eye out for the huge and awesome painting on the ceiling. I visited the temple on a weekday and there was not much crowd. But allow an hour to complete the Darshan if you are taking the general line. After the Darshan is completed, you are allowed to walk down the steps leading to a areas that sell handicrafts, pastries and other bakery products.
The temple also offers free lunch services after the Darshan is completed. Overall, a great temple to visit.
Good to visit in Bangalore, less crowded on weekdays. Bit of difficult to reach temple due to heavy traffic
Gives me peaceful and joyful life when I visit this temple outsiders of bangalore must visit this temple

Interesting experience, and it is an ‚Äú experience‚Äù. For travelers/ tourists, pay the 500 rupees for the upgraded experience. This is a religious experience, and, while not of our religion, it is interesting to see the worshippers and to understand the significance for them.

The temple itself is quite nice, interesting to see, and is very well maintained and kept very clean.

This Hindu temple is an example where you see giving everywhere. This temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna, but you will get a chance to offer prayers to the other deities too. Just a wonderful, calming experience.

The temple sits on some very expensive real estate and tries to generate money desperately needed to keep it going. The food sold in the temple is plain fantastic. I could eat here every day.

I would recommend a visit this temple. Don't miss the opportunity to buy and sample the sweets in the temple.
Cleanest Temple , doesn't weeks like a temple too clean. Weekends are bit rush but moving Q, no need to wait for long
Awesome temple with great Divinity. beautiful architecture.there are lot of stalls selling religious books, gifts,toys handicrafts etc.food stalls.tasty prashad is offered for all devotees

Its a joy to see the tall 'gopura' from the street. One should feel the consciousness of bliss in the 'prakara' .
Dont miss the 'prasad'

multifloored building with temple.
Really nice to visit. May be crowded in the weekends.
Pleasant and nice place to pass time.
Many shops are there with yummy food stuff.
very organize and clean, nice temple and easy to go around. You must follow the indications. At the end you can buy some books and items.
ISKON temple banglore is famous for its divinity and peacefulness. Statue of lord krishna is just awesome in the temple
Iscon temple is very good temple and systematic management ..,.. I really suggest people who are not visited this temple please visit once
Its a massive complex built of Hare Krishna. I had an wonderful experience. The architecture is very good and grand

We visited this place couple of months back with family. It's a good place to take a family. They will enjoy a lot. Place is very well maintained and organised also it's very silent. But some will feel like it's commercial place by the way the temple is designed. You will get many things as like shopping mall. But still it's worth a visit to get darshan of lord Krishna and Radha..
Happy Visiting

The complex is fairly large, and there are a few smaller mandir before you reach the main hall. The car parks can be full - so, do alight at the main entrance - its easiest that way to retrieve slippers etc later. The main hall is really grand - with 3-4 kilos of gold adorning the pillars etc where the statues are kept. We went on a weekday, so the place was not hugely crowded, and we got decent darshan in a very short period of time (did not need to pay for the VIP passes). The snacks are good :) (and so are the restaurants, even though we did not eat there this time).

How crowded and the rush the place is, you feel solace with the chants of Hare Krishna when you enter the mandir.

If you feel low and you need some beautiful energy, ISCKON is the best remedy to visit.
Such a wonderful view with pleasant wind . The place is very cool and we just enjoyed it. We can also go to Orion mall nearby !!

Very nicely located at the hill top Hera Krishna temple in a very ideally located place nearer to key location near Rajajinagar ,Bangalore.Attracts all types of tourists providing organized Que system to accommodate with out much delay for their darshan.and good prsadam arrangements throughout the day. One should not miss this land mark as the same is included the local tourism trip list of varies Important sight seeing places of Bangalore.Tempie authorities also provides very good catering facilities and good shopping mall of various temple utenciles,Paintings Puja items and variety of deepas with electric connection.

You will get both experience in the same location. Starts of with spirituality and as soon as you come out of the temple after offfering prayers you will get to pass by lots of kiosk specific to ISKCON group as well as from some small vendors which is worth watching and most of the time buying some collectables.
This temple is maintaining the neatness from staring to end giving a clear instructions like leave foot wear not to throw things and even the ambience is awesome and serving food is so hygienic
A nice place with a completely spiritual aura. One can spend the entire day here. Must visit in Bangalore.

Iskcon temple is very neat and clean. Rules for not taking photographs is strictly followed. Prasadam is very tasty. But the place where it is located is crowdy. Totally we will go there and relax our mind peacefully
It was quick visit and I felt everage being there. Too much walk inside railing but found proper arrangements to handle big crowd and easy to view lord krishna's murti nerby distance.

Its a temple of Lord Krishna.
Gets crowded most of the time.
Ok place to take your parents.
Avoid rush hours. Well maintained.

I was excited to get to see the ISKCON temple, as I had seen an old temple out in the countryside and wanted to compare. Expect to remove your shoes, as is customary in Hindu temples. Wear long pants or a long skirt and make sure elbows are covered. They would not let me bring in my camera, which they found during a search of my bag; I explained that I would not be taking the camera out for use but they were steadfast. Our guide was able to take my bag to our vehicle; I didn't feel good about this, but did not want to leave it in the shoe-checking area. Interestingly, people inside the temple were snapping photos left and right with their cell phones, so I'm not sure why my camera would have been offensive. The temple has the dieties of Radha and Krishna, and is one of the largest ISKON temples in the world. They charge everyone to enter, even Hindus. A huge and ornate gold-plated altar area is the focal point once one has navigated through the passageways to enter the main part of the temple. On the way in, a Hindu chant to Hare Krishna is repeated 107 times. I want to be clear that all of this was fascinating. My issue is that there is apparently no limit on the number of people who may be admitted at once. This resulted in beyond sardine-like conditions for the 45 minutes it took to get inside. Surely this is a hazard in case of fire or other emergency. I am not used to having NO personal space whatsoever. To be crowded and mashed up next to strangers was disconcerting, to say the least. Everyone was orderly during this progression. When things turned for the worse was after a few minutes in the main section of the temple - people began to push, shove, and force their way to the exits. It was the most frightening experience of my life. If I had fallen down, I would have been crushed. This detracted from the experience for me and I cannot therefore recommend it to anyone. It was simply too dangerous.

All those who plan to visit Bangalore, a visit is a must to ISKON, with the beautiful surroundings, malls and metro around. a place of visit to spend a beautiful evening.
You can also donate and become a member, yearly once they call you for a pooja, birthday or anniversary, and also with food.

The temple is walking distance of about 15 minutes from Orion mall/Sheraton Bangalore.
It took about 30-40 minutes to walk through the temple (it was non crowd morning). The main hall is very beautiful, i think it will look better in the evening as the might light up all the oil lamps in the evening. If you are a Krishna follower you definitely need to visit this temple and there are lot of Krishna based souvenirs. A must visit if you are going to Bangalore.

It is very well organised and within Bangalore. It has planned well and kept as per the standards.
Structure of temple helps to understand that it has been as same as other ISKON Temple.

1. It is modern clean temple.
2. As is the case with most of the modern temples, it lacks spirituality. Any day, even not-so-clean ancient temples are far better.
3. There is chaos in parking. There is none to control it. People known to temple authorities violate parking rules. 6 tourist buses blocked the traffic for more than 20 minutes at the top of the hill; after 20 minutes, other vehicles were diverted to a different route. We were stuck in the temple and our driver had to drive to the main street. I was forced to walk down the hill in gravel road with injured toes.
4. Restaurant scene is equally chaotic.

It would be a wise decision to skip this temple during your Bangalore visit.
This temple is maintaining the neatness from staring to end giving a clear instructions like leave foot wear not to throw things and even the ambience is awesome and serving food is so hygienic
A nice place with a completely spiritual aura. One can spend the entire day here. Must visit in Bangalore.

Iskcon temple is very neat and clean. Rules for not taking photographs is strictly followed. Prasadam is very tasty. But the place where it is located is crowdy. Totally we will go there and relax our mind peacefully
It was quick visit and I felt everage being there. Too much walk inside railing but found proper arrangements to handle big crowd and easy to view lord krishna's murti nerby distance.

Its a temple of Lord Krishna.
Gets crowded most of the time.
Ok place to take your parents.
Avoid rush hours. Well maintained.

Very nice and maintained very well. We went with family and enjoyed the experience. The Prasadam is very nice too.
It is a seriously good temple... Inside in it there is small small temples are there . And they also have a small mini market inside the temple.

I have been visiting this temple since my entry into Bangalore city, that is in 2001...this place really gives peace...one has to walk a lot before reaching the main temple...what I like the most in this temple are the 108 stones...u have to step on those stones and chant hare Rama hare Rama ...Rama Rama hare hare....one just forgets all the worries...then the idols in the main temple are so beautiful...once attended their kirtans which made me forget everything...the one thing which I don't like is little bit of commercialization..it's compulsory to walk thru the halls where they have lots of shops...they also give prasadams in different forms...all the sweets and chat items u can see here...
Also in the premises, u have annakuta restaurant and also a fine dining restaurant called the higher taste..which is very good for the families...it serves both ala carte and buffet...
So, according to me it's worth visiting ...to relieve ur self from the hectic life of Bangalore

The visit was quite beautiful. The complex is huge and all the facilities are easily available, at no cost. Be it keeping the shoes, wearing dhoti, eating prasadam, etc. It is a soothing experience. Even the management is very good. Must visit for all.
Quaint little place near the hustle and bustle of the busy city that is Bangalore. Located atop a hill. Provides serenity and peacefulness.

Its their Vegetarian Lunch & Dinner Buffet in their Restaurant that is the USP on this place. And during particular Hindu festivals the Menu caters to the cuisine theme wrt that Hindu festival.
The Starters and Main are good. Their Dessert section leaves a lot to be desired .

I have heard several advices to go visit this temple atleast once.So, I finally decided to visit this temple two sunday's ago. I went with my family. First thing first, the shoe collection center is well maintained. From there, you have to take multiple steps to reach the main campus of the temple. There are several other gods to bow down to before reaching to the main God. I have to say - you can see the effort with which these gods are decorated. Beautiful !!

When you reach the main building, there is a sitting area for the people in the center and devotees have to walk beside them to come to the front to see the Radhe-Krishna , sitting in a gold-claded- temple like structure. There are donation boxes , here and there, if anyone is willing to.

The queue moves forward with ups and downs along with staircases with prasad shops, then, wooden artifacts, then varities of paintings, then clothes shops and then finally there is also an arrangement to have some decent amount of snacks - samosas,poliyogre, puffs, sweets, bhajjis etc.Drinking water is also available in bottles as well as in water containers. You move further ahead, you will get the prasad- we got khichdi. And, finally you come to the shoe center.

Please dont mind me saying - I was hoping much of a temple marvel like we have meenakshi temple of madurai, konark temple of orrissa etc. The reason being- I have heard alot about Iskcon temple.The temple is itself was restricted to very less space and the commercial shops occupied the most of spaces.

I am trying to portray what I felt about this temple visit. You should visit this temple atleast once if you are in Bangalore.

It is one of the huge white marble Radha Krishna temple built in 3 stages. Hare Krishna mantra is chanted all along. There are volunteers to help , share the details of the ongoing programs. There are pure veg food stalls also.
Bustling with people, this is one of the most visited ISKON temple in Bangalore. Do not miss dinning at the restaurant, it is pure vegetarian, economical and the food is delicious.
Nice place to visit, but very crowded. Parking is a issue due to crowed. Costly but good restaurant at the back forgot the name but it has both buffet and a la carte.

One of the best place to visit in Bangalore.
Very calm, peacefull and clean place and very well planned and managed.
It is one of the largest ISKCON temple in the world.
Special bhajans held in the evening every sunday with free entry, also they have a film show for children which cost ‚Çπ50.
Complete staff is very respectful and prasad with other food and snacks are quite tasty and good.
If you are in Bangalore, please go to this Temple and you will get that feel good factor.
One of the biggest Krishna temple in Bangalore constructed on a hill. It also has a restaurant and a mini market.
It feels like, or perhaps it is, a Hare Krishna theme park with a huge maze of souvenir stalls. There is no insight to learn about culture or history. Wouldn't come here again.

Must visit this place!!! This is one of the largest ISKCON temples in the world. It stands on Hare Krishna Hill. There is a dress code and strictly no half pants or short skirts. Not to worry they do provide dhothi (long skirt) for Rs.520 and Rs.500 is refundable once you return it. Main temple is lord Krishna but inside there are three more temples. After visiting temples, you will lead to shops inside.They have a good collection of spiritual books, idols and food.
It really felt too shantii inside the temple. Lord krishna statues were too good. Pics were not allowed. So didnt took.

One of the best tourist spot in Bangalore. Meticulously maintained with beautiful landscape.Lord Krishna temple at the top in a pleasant atmosphere, ideal place for meditation.variety of prasadams/eatables and shops selling Pooja articles adds tourist attraction. Toilets and other facilities worth mentioning.Wish all to have darshan and blessings of Lord Krishna.

Must visit this place. They do have a dress code and strictly no half pants. But not to worry they do provide dhothi for Rs.520 and Rs.500 is refundable once you return dhothi. Main temple is lord Krishna but inside three more temples are there. Anytime, any season queue will be huge but Its a slow moving. So enjoy the place. Queue system is so well organized that you won't miss anything in the temple. After visiting god, you will lead to shops inside.They have a good collection of spiritual books, kurthas, idols etc. My favorite place after visiting god is their food stalls. You get best food there. Once you come out of the temple, you will get pongal prasadam. Whenever I visited this temple I got pongal so I really don't know whether they give any other prasadam. They also provide lunch as prasadam. Other than this this temple has a huge car parking( need to pay though), guest house and hotels. You can also reach this place through metro

This is one of the most famous and most visited landmark in Bangalore. ISCKON has temples all over world and mostly in all Indian metro cities. It is one of the most visited places by tourists. Good for a one time visit. You get to know the ISCKON way of things. Well managed. Good crowd management. Has parking as well. A mall is nearby and a metro station is nearby as well. Good connectivity.

I don't call this as a temple, because of its appearance and highly commercial attitude in everything. It is a beautiful tourist place with wonderful food. A place which is immaculately clean, superb management of everything, right from parking to directions to queue system to darshan to book stall to everything. A highly professional team is managing all activities flawlessly.
There are two auditoriums for mid size marriage and reception functions.

We have been recently at Bangalore ISKCON temple... But it's not like earlier temple which we have visited on 2011...

Noticed It's became more commercial... In entry gate INR 300/- for direct Darshan without Q.. ( Which is not at all require for Darshan).

And inside the temple we could see maximum area covered by shop's selling all stuffs ( Lord Krishna related).

And external view is completely changed due to top story building and metro..

Now there is no wow factor about temple.. Except main temple inside the where is main statue of lord Krishna..

It's my opinion...

Amazing place of worship

View of Hanuman Temple is very good.

Chanting 108 time is soul touching

God at the Best

It is an amazing place where you can attain spirituality. You can just sit there in the main temple forever listening to the bhajans. Do not miss the govinda swami temple on the way before reaching the main temple. They have lot of books like the Bhagavad Gita which are good.

One of the best places for worship in Bengaluru. Went along with my family and had a wondeful experience. The grandeur architecture as well beautiful idols of lord Krishna can be seen. The decorations in the interior are so rich and majestic that it will leave us awestruck. Glad that we went when the crowd was less and had a wonderful feel. The calmness made our minds so relieved, while we recieved the blessing of god. Food/snacks stalls are also available where tasty vegetarian food can be bought. There are also souvenir stores where one can buy things for their family/friends. I would recommend this as a must visit temple in Bengaluru.
The architecture is wonderful. They have good maintenance of premises and crowds are well managed. The cafeteria servers very good food. Its near to Metro station.
It s a spiritual place....very soul comforting...big lake there...sight seeing also there..gud places for taking selfies and photos...one of must see places..very very famous

Visited this grand krishna temple on my visit to Bangalore,

It is a must visit when you in the city.

The temple
has huge campus
very good arrangements for devotees, (though many people visit it)
nice darshan, the god in such a beautiful clothes and accessories
Lot of shopping options, artistic decor, book etc
Food stalls inside temples serves you delicious varieties at reasonable cost
Not to miss this location as the temple is maintained very well. Lot of visitors during peak hours. Nice feeling while visiting.

This is a must visit attraction in Bangalore for all tourists. Lot of prasadam varieties and wide range of books to choose from. Some may feel it is commercial. Hare Rama hare Rama, Rama Rama hare hare;hare Krishna hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna hare hare chanting gives lot of peacefulness.
Temple is extremely well maintained... A bhajan will be running in background. Marble idols of god and goddess could be seen. Darshan goes good because of systematic queue.
Bengaluru Iskon temple is must visit place you just get inner peace and see the beautiful temple with some gold carving. Good shopping and food stores as well inside
highly spiritual,very clean and good temple. have to climb and go to the main temple,elderly people should kindly look into this. overall great experience and a great spiritual environment

The temple is very peaceful and system are very systematic there is no push ups as usually happens in all the temples one can enjoy there darshan of god and peaceful envoirment lovely food and drinks and holy literature Nd things galleries and lot more
I am usually not a temple person but ISCKON temple is a landmark in Bangalore. The best part its very clean and they just let you be and not much botheration from priests or other people around.

Beautiful and very awesome experience.
Even we may visit this place as a break on weekends or holidays.
Its very beautiful place, awesome view from the top of this place.
Must visit !!!!

We were at the ISCON Bengaluru in June 2018. The celebrations went off well. The wedding lunch was very good with a sumptuous well cooked meal and catered well.The rooms were simple but very clean, and well maintained

Visited Isckon temple in the first week of July.If you are visiting Bengaluru, you must visit this well maintained and beautiful temple, preferably forenoon and on non- holidays/weekend to avail more time for "darshan" without waiting much.
It is a very calm, quiet & peaceful temple. Walkable distance from sandal soap factory metro station. Very cleanly maintained.
As in other cities, Iskon Blore is also cleanly maintained. U can enjoy food especially sweets, which are very tasty.
Beautiful temple to visit. Located on a hill has a good view. Huge temple premise, clean and beautiful. Inside the temple will feel very calm and nice.

This temple is one of the beautiful Iskcon temples in India. It has various floors so if one needs to visit then choose to visit all sections in this temple. One can refer to their website for prayer timings. Wheel chair is available too and is recommended for people who cannot walk much.
The temple looks boring from outside. It is completly white unlike other smaller temples in the city. The main hall is very nice though. It is very decorated and colorfull.

I thought it was great. We arrived at 6pm so the light was beginning to fade and the place began to shine. The chanting is hypnotic as you'd expect and even with the many many concession stands selling goods inside, you are left with a strangely serene feeling. Beware, no toilets until the end of the visit, near the exit. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 in all conscience. Also I could have bought tons at the stalls, very cheap prices.
Swamy Prapubatha Aim to feed the Poor and Feed Piet of Hare Rama Hare Krishna is a Cynosure.Blissful prayers Pujas & Dance !

The architecture is really beautiful. girls will have to wear traditional dresses over here if u don't have one u can get one for rent at cheap price but you will have to pay 500 rs security . Just go for worship and don't fall in trap of pandits (dakshina). and also don't buy gifts or sweats from shops inside temple they are way too expensive

We visited this temple on a Sunday and it was busy but not crowded. The temple is very beautiful and relatively new, built in the late 1990's. Because it is an active temple, you must dress respectfully which mean covered shoulders for women and no shorts for men. If you are only coming for sightseeing, you really only need to buy the 300 INR ticket. Higher priced tickets include other things like books. There was surprisingly quite a bit of commercial enterprise going on as you walk through the different parts of the complex.

This temple is basically a commercial zone attacking people on the name of God for its own benefits . However upto certain extent religion is also taken care of with chanting of Vasudevaya Mantra and Prasadam distribution , Well a lot of improvement is required for religious sentiments of people there are other places for commercial needs for shopping or business , here almost every thing is sold , a temple like this must need to ensure the same and not to disappoint religious devotees
more business oriented than temple. needs more cleanliness n to be charitable. things need to be improved a lot
Temple is good but the thing which i dint like was commercialism of this place. they have kind of market to sell everything including prasad.

Beautiful temple. more inviting and informational for tourists than other temples. you're guided on how to move through in case you don't know which is nice. their are people on the inside that also communicate with you what is going on and teach you the mantra. they souvenirs area is a bit too much. Also, like the area that shows you the evolution of how this temple came to be and its purpose. Good temple to start out with first.
The iskon temple in Bangalore is worth seeing.more devotional and each stepeu enter into temple u chant the vedic mantra. Peace of mind available here.

It is one of the largest ISKCON temples in the world. Hare Krishna Hill is the hillock on which this temple is situated. During weekends and public holidays, Temple timings are 4:15 a.m. to 5:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. without any break in the afternoon.
The evening arati starts at 7:00 p.m. where devotees sing kirtan. In the main temple, the arati is performed by three priests. This arati is followed again by kirtan where devotees can be seen dancing to the rhythm of "Hare Krishna Hare Rama". The exit way after the Darshan from the main temple leads through a series of shops that offer books on Sri Krishna in all the possible Indian languages.

Crowded but very beautiful to see the god, a surprise for new comers. Commuting is very difficult unless you have your own vehicle. Good time to visit is at sunset if they own the east door you can sun rises inside the temple, I went so many times for that view but only twice able to see it.

If you are going by bangalore metro get down at soap factory station its near-by you can also cover Orion mall which in walkable distance its also very good scenic place sit out area is very good.

ISKCON temple in Rajajinagar Bangalore is a must to visit place for all travellers. The temple is located in the west part of Banglaore and is accessable through taxis, buses and autos. There is a Metro Station just opposite the temple which is an added advantage. There is plenty of parking which is a boon in horrible Bangalore Traffic. The temple has a very good resturant which serves sathvik food and other delicacies.
The temple is lit with colourful lights in the evening and this is a treat to the eyes!

The architecture of the temple is very good you will impress with that and garden area is very clean and attractive and you will get some holly books also for sale inside the temple, they wont allow camera inside the temple be careful with that.

Situated to the western of Chord Road on the hill lock known as 'Hare Krishna Hill', Iskcon Temple is known not only for its religious significance but also for its architectural beauty. Also known as Hare Krishna this temple has been built in the Neo-Classical style, presenting a beautiful fusion of ultra-contemporary and traditional style and is equipped with all kinds of modern amenities. Like various other Iskcon temples which are spread all across the world, this temple of Bangalore is also dedicated to the Lord Krishna and Radha.
A gold-plated pillar named as dhvaja-sthamba (56 ft tall) is located at the entrance of the temple. Hari-nam mantapa, the place where people chant the name of Lord Krishna for the purification of mind, soul and world peace is located near the sthamba. There are 108 steps on each side of the mantapa and at every single step devotees chant the Hare Krishna mantra once. The steps will lead the visitors to the temple of Prahlada Narasimha which is guarded by Jaya and Vijaya, the two door-keepers of the Lord. Next mandir is of Sri Srinivasa Govinda and then comes the main temple where the deities of Sri Sri Radha Krishnachandra, Sri Sri Krishna Balarama and Sri Sri Nitai Gauranga are worshipped.

At the exit of the temple, there are various stalls which sell religious artifacts. Visitors can watch an episode of the Little Krishna Animation Movie (around 20 min. duration) in the Animation Theatre. At the Gita counter, one can have a look at the display of books written by Srila Prabhupada (the founder of ISKCON Bangalore) which is available in English and most of the Indian languages. The delicious Sri Krishna prasadam is distributed freely to all the visitors during the darshan hours. Other places worth visiting includes:

Dakshinakrti (the handicraft section),
Dharani (the organic food outlet),
The Higher Taste food court (which offers varieties of delicious sattvik food) and
Annakuta Restaurant.

Situated in a very big area.... this ISKON temple is one of must visit @ Bangalore.....Woy may feel divine experience with lots of peace in main hall area.... to reach main hall area will take time due to crowd... Holy chants and bhajans will retreat your inner soul.
Its a blissful experience to be there. Its a beautiful place with a beautiful view of the city and lord Krishna
A divine treat, full of good vibes. Exclusive darshans by payment. Holy chants and bhajans to treat your soul. No photography. Chant Hare Rama Hare Krishna to lift your soul.

I went with my friend to the temple, huge crowds, too much restrictions on camera and the security handled my camera very badly. Also the sanctum is a total show off, not at all a place of inner peace which temples are meant to be. Near the fountains the view was good and a comparatively better place, "prasad" was free and tasty. Another thing i disliked is the souvenirs shops (numerous ones) inside the temple complex which gives the feeling of a market-place and not of a temple.

When you think of a temple, you think of a peaceful place. My experience at ISKCON Bangalore was not at all like that.
Though I would like to mention at the start itself that the temple is really beautiful, especially the main complex. Its a spacious hall with a ceiling covered in paintings depicting scenes from the life of God Krishna. God statues are surrounded by a panelling done in gold. Its quite spectacular.

The area is roped and divisions are created in such a way that you get to visit the complete complex without missing out on any space. However, when we got to ISKCON, there was a huge huge crowd. This meant that we had to go through the complete complex in line, waiting behind this crowd, with sun beating down on us. Sometimes this line goes through places that you may want to skip on (like areas where goods are being sold), but have to visit anyhow.

Also, what I felt did not belong in a temple or maybe in a separate area/complex, was the over commercialised selling of everything you can think of!
From laptop bags, books, clothes, samosas, puffs and what not! I felt it takes away from the "non-materialistic" vibes that people come to Temples for.

I would not go there again. May as well meditate or pray at home.

This is one of the staple place in Bangalore for visiting business expats trying to catch a glimpse of Indian culture during their busy schedule at the IT capital. The temple is situated on top of a small hill. So there is this little climb from the entrance to it's sanctum sanctorum. On the way one can visit a few other smaller shrines and deities. In the main hall the Indian Hindu divine figures of Lord Krishna and Goddess Radha adorn in different forms. There are live prayers / bhajans (divine songs) offered from time to time.

On way out, one must pass through the food court and merchandise area should one wants to indulge in little bit shopping or eating. At the exit the temple staff offers prasadam (a delicious dollop of rice and lentils, or the khichri).

At the entrance (which comes also at the exit), one must deposit his/her footwear, to be collected while leaving. The early morning and evenings the surroundings create a great vibes for someone to spend some peaceful time.

The temple is now easily approachable via metro route.

This is one of the biggest ISKCON temples in India. Best organised right from entry till exit. For elders, it'd be a long walk and climb up a hill. I say hill as it's constructed over a hill , remains of which can be seen from a particular point.
The entry is to keep your shoes/sandles . Then you get along the way which is strictly a single person line till entrance of temple. The temple door is huge and view at evening is amazing . You can't click photos anywhere after this point. If you try to do so, be ready for a shout from the security guard. ;)
Then comes nrusinhma temple on the way. The main temple is HUGE! the lights , ornaments and the Chandanam(sandal) smell will be in the atmosphere. There are murtis of Lord Krishna, Lord balram and poojas are carried out at specific times.
The hall in front is very big and some bhajans will be presented by devotee groups there.
After darshan, there is book stall where you can purchase books related to philosophy, religion etc.
There are presentation hall and shops afterwards on a separate floor to purchase different things. Food stalls are everywhere on the way. They are bit expensive but tasty.
At the end, you get prasadam and then exit .
Must visit place while you're in Bengaluru. Go in evening time or early morning !
