The ISKCON Temple at Bengaluru is probably one of the grandest Krishna temples in India, if not in the world. It is a relatively modern temple whose construction was started in 1990 and completed in 1997. It was built by the International Society for Krishna Consciousness founded by the spiritual teacher Srila Prabhupada.

We visited the temple one weekday evening and had to wait till 4.15 pm when the temple opens for evening worship. We had to wait in a long queue after depositing our footwear at the counter and paying a fee of Rs.2 per pair. The queue was orderly even though everyone was eager to enter the sanctum. There are wash basins to wash your hands and face, as well as water sprays on the steps so that your feet also get washed before entering. The steps were lined with steel railings all the way to the sanctum sanctorum.

As we went up we first entered two smaller temples dedicated to Hanuman and Garuda and Narasimha, and the next one to Sri Srinavasa Govinda. The presiding deities in the sanctum were Sri Radha Krishnachandra, Sri Krishna Balarama and Sri Nitai Gauranga. The sanctum is very well decorated and brightly lit, with the pujas and aartis being performed by a dedicated team of priests. There was enough space in the hall for devotees to sit for a while and soak in the spirituality. We paid our respects and moved ahead.

The next few rooms had some life-like statues of Srila Prabhupada, and some exhibits from spiritual life. There was one exhibit showing the various stages in a person's life from birth to death and how the cycle is completed. After this were many rooms displaying various items for sales starting from prasadam, incense sticks, pictures and idols of deities, and going on to decorative notebooks, artefacts and snack foods. At the final exit we received free hot prasadam in a dry leaf cup.

On weekdays the temple is open for devotees from 7.15 am to 1 pm and 4.15 pm to 8.20 pm. On weekends and public holidays it is open from 7.15 am to 8.30 pm, but keep in mind that it is bound to be more crowded on these days, as well as some festival days. One should be dressed modestly, befitting a place of worship. Besides a small purse, you are not permitted to carry anything else inside; and lockers are available to deposit your stuff.

Special passes are available for a fee, if you do not have the time and patience to wait in the general queue. Parking space is available inside the temple compound.

It is definitely worth a visit for everyone, whether you are a Lord Krishna devotee or not. You may even become a believer if you are borderline agnostic, and start following the teachings of Lord Krishna and the Bhagavad-Gita.
I loved the temple,very hygiene and sometimes there will be long queue but worth waiting!Even the Prasada was awesome and tasty!

This is located near Metro Railway Station. Ususally on Festivals this temple will be crowded. The temple has three levels each level one avatara. the Last one has krishna, balaram. There is also canteen inside and parking facility available.

Located on a hill very close to Orion mall, very peaceful surroundings despite being in the middle of the city. It's better to go in the evening as there is a bit of bare foot walking and decent clothes.

Hare Krishna Hill is the hillock on which this temple is situated. ISKCON Bangalore is a charitable society with the objective of propagating Krishna Consciousness all over the world, as explained by Srila Prabhupada, whose teachings are based on Bhagavad-gita and Srimad Bhagavatam.

very vast and decent place. glamorous style with golden covered inner main temple of Shri Radha Krishna , Krishna - Balaram and Nitai Swamy. When you enter the main temple lobby , you get a divine feeling and aroma spread there is very different from the general one. One must visit at least once if happen to be in Bangalore.

Visited during my stay in Bangalore and it was a gorgeous temple. Please note: do not wear shorts/short skirts or sleeveless tops as you will need to rent something to cover up. Also you will walk barefoot so be prepared.

visited the temple with family in april 2018 .. lovely architecture and well maintained temple .. there are steps to be climbed with smaller temples in between before reaching the main temple location which has 3 sections - krishna balaram , radha krishna & nitya gaurang .. for those who cant climb the steps, there is a lift which takes you straight to the main temple location .. also, a sitting statue of the founder of isckon temples is seen at the main temple location at the top .. on the roof dome, images & depictions of the life of lord krishna are seen .. the pictorial depiction of lord krishna are seen at many locations in the temple .. there are sweet stalls at different location of the temple .. also different souvenirs could be purchased at very reasonable rates .. these include images and idols of lord krishna, religious books relating mainly to lord krishna, agarbatties, garlands, kurtas, shirts, T-shirts, bags, toys for children , etc. from 1130 hrs the free meals scheme begins .. there is also an alternate canteen where food could be purchased .. in the main temple location one could sit and meditate for some time .. chants of lord krishna are played by musicians at the location .. there's a pond at the temple which looks beautiful and is well maintained .. overall its an awesome atmosphere ..

This is one of the best temples in South India.
Just be careful with many people around trying to get your money.
Best thing to do is do with some locals if you know one.
Do not accept any help or free stuff because at the end to the visit they will charge you too much for those items.
Nice places just be careful when you are there.

A temple sit royally on a hill top and constructed with neorich architecture of gothic + Aagama blend shines the shrine face in royal. A system of chanting 108 times of RAMA KRISHNA MANTHRA by default after crossing 108 foot pedestals is a memorable experience. Highly descipliend volunteers,hygiene serene ambient and devotioanl atmosphere are positive attributes of this place. Sanctum sanctorum mesmerizes every body with the virtue of its high top ceilings and over roof paintings.Reasonably priced various items for souvenirs, mini screen exibits KALIYA MARDANA animated film, vedic coffee taste of restaurant are to be experienced. I have visited ISKCON temples of Mayapur (WB), Kolkata, Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad (both Abids / Secbad) Pune (both camp& Kothrud) and Ahemdabad. But this banglore temple looks with some commercial business touch like special darshan rs 300/- , rituals ranging from 500-1500 etc are self explanatory

This is not a traditional temple, it is a tad bit different. In case you are looking for a divine and self-exploring journey then take time out and visit this temple for a great experience. Bhajans are the best because the feeling is quite unexplanatory in a good way.
Visit with family for a really blessed experience and feel great while walking out of this place.

If u want a traditional visit to a temple with the priest performing an arathi and then giving u the prasadam, then this is not the temple for u!!
ISKCON is more of a centre for education and training in KRSNA consciousness. It's beautiful architecture, paintings and idols are a treat for the eyes. The 'prasad' here varies from laddoos to pizzas and burgers!!
There is a large collection of books on matters philosophical and theological.
The priests here are all highly educated (graduates of IIT and IIM!) former members of the fast paced, 'happening' society, who have abandoned that life in search of purpose and meaning.
There are a variety of courses one can join and can also stay at the premises of the temple and join in their daily routine and be exposed to the lifestyle and habits of the monks and priests who love and work there.
A visit to ISKCON is highly recommended on your to Bangalore.
Hari Krishna. What a nice temple. It is absolutely a must do. Be proper dressed or they dress you - long pants and shoulders covered.
Went today with my friend, system arranged was very disturbing, unnecessary big lines because of system. They need to look for that.
Found this place is really holly place. Being Christian I have really liked it. Located near Rajajinagar and it was my first visit
Its basicalky radhakrishnz temple . Nice and big temple on top of a small hill. Huge csmpus . Theg have big parking facility. They serve bhog . They have a inhouse bookstall as well.
Fantastic spiritual journey, always nice visiting the Hare Krishna temples. Always worth the visit to these temples!
Absolutely need to visit this magnificent temple. A big touristy for sure but incontournable. They have a big international bookstore plus a very extensive sale of sweets
Visited here with my family and it was an amazing experience. The best about here that it's location in Yeswanthpur. A huge place with bunch of scenario.

Situated at a Hill Top on a sprawling area, this temple is regarded as one of the most visited modern Radha Krishna Temple.
Most ably maintained, this Temple is managed meticulously for the huge number of devotees that regularly throng the pious precincts.
The Temple is built in the traditional South Indian style. Khichhri Prasad is offered free to all the devotees.
There is neat parking space very close to the Temple.
What a beauty indeed. Me and my wife were amazed to see the beautiful place. Such a place were we spent quality time and enjoyed the massive place. I did not pray much but enjoyed its sheer beauty.
Although temple is very nicely maintained but people taking care r too arrogant..... Poor staff...they need lot of improvement in their behaviour

This a very famous temple in Bangalore and its the best place to visit with family during weekends and holidays.
Such a beautiful place.
hare rama hare krishna . a clam place but once the festival season starts or weekends this place is crowded by disciple and followers. its a famous place in Bangalore and a must visit place.

Words cannot describe this place. I have never seen such a clean, huge, neatly maintained temple in my lifetime. The temple is constructed in a hill and the landscaping is done in such a way that you visit a row of shrines in every upper stage to reach the Radha Krishna shrine. The moment you enter the Chamber of Radha and Krishna, you will forget all your worries and immerse in the divinity. Its not only a temple, but a Shopping centre. You can get everything from bags to Krishna merchandise to cakes to whatever you name to eat here. Never ever miss this place when you are Bangalore. Go Enjoy have fun shop eat and be blessed.

The temple doesn't seem religious or sacred at all but rather just a place to sell you things. They make you go through shops and restaurants just to leave the temple. Paid admission does give you free sweets and a book though. Be sure to cover your shoulders and legs! Otherwise you'll have to pay for a dirty longi to cover you. You also have to pay to store your shoes and the entry...
A very beautiful Temple. The Gold Idols are a real treat, as is the architecture. Lots of steps to climb, but there is an elevator for the aged and needy

With the arrival of metro train between byapanhalli and sandal factory station, visiting ISKCON was a feasible dream. The temple on the hillock view was lovely. Arrangements to keep footwear and bag is very systematic. Only purse was allowed. With a special ticket in hand we could sit very close to the main sanctorum. Was very peaceful. Kids dis lose patience sitting for 30 mins.
The food court served great food without onion garlic. Each one enjoyed it.
Overall lovely place for family.

"Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna hare hare, hare Rama hare Rama Rama Rama hare hare". Most beautiful place. Enjoyed so much chanting Krishna. My son enjoyed very much. Must visit, metro is available and it is walkable from metro station.
Good to visit a temple tho crowded but yet is worth a visit.... Good structure n environment.... Lot of place around.... Can spend time around....

One of the famous temples in Bangalore. Must visit place. It has ample parking space and is situated in big area. Very spiritual environment and you can chant 'Hare Krishna' maha-mantra while in the temple. Make sure to attend evening Arti. There are shops outside temple for books and religious things. Also there are snacks to enjoyed in numerous stalls in the exit area and a vegetarian restaurant.

You can visit here and enjoy seeing the temple premises with your family. The prasad provided here is pongal. which tastes yumm. Also the food inside is really good. lemon rice,kesaribath everything tastes amazing. Meditating here gives so much of peace
Very peaceful and calm temple. With good ambience. Pls try to attend evening aarti. Too good to watch and enjoy. Feel connected to God.

It is a huge complex and well maintained. As you enter the temple chants of Lord Krishna ''Hare Krishna Hare Krishna.. Krishna Krishna Hare Hare........'' could be heard. People there are very courteous and ready to explain about evolution of ISKCON. One should visit the temple when in Bangalore.
Area was good and net and clean ...a lot people over their but good...mind blowing temple ....I enjoy here very much
This temple has a beautiful sculpures, and the best part is that the temple is not crowded and well maintained.
It is nice but nothing extraordinary. Many shops there more than spiritual corners. Big hall to pray and meditate. Lot of food a a great rasmalai dessert there .
This temple is one of famous temples in Banglore for lord Krishna. One gets inner peace after seeing the statues in temple. But looks a little bit commercial. Otherwise very fine temple. Must visit.

First of all very very neat and clean and second most important thing is no partiality for rich and poor people every one is equal and get the chance to worship. Delicious prshada and beautiful infrastructure.

Recently had a visit to the Iskon temple - a very serene place of worship , with extremely clean environment and organized procedures - Quite large place for the worship of the main deity Radha Krishna and also the Balaji temple-
Good arrangements for food -

All in all, a very nice experience

Very good temple. Hare Krishna Mantra is filled everywhere. People who wish to just think of god through chants can choose this destination. Beauty with Bliss is the feature of this temple. Lord Krishna is simply beautiful. Plenty of parking space, good prasadam and a restaurant inside the temple premises.
It's a devotional place, m not a much devotional person..!! Didn't enjoy much but still property is huge and well maintained..!!
Very beautiful temple, i felt very peaceful. Well organized and i loved the divine supplies available for shopping and the khicdi prasad.
Iskcon temple in Bangalore is very beautiful and famous temple in lot of eccirs the lord radha Krishna is looking awesome

We visited twice and found it to be an incredible place. The temple is set over a large area. Very organised. The deities are beautiful and the main temple room has painting on the ceiling like the sixteenth chapel. There lots of food on offer and we bought a beautiful painting. Its a good day out, don't miss it if you are visiting Bangalore.
Peace full place I visited ambience is superb I am happy to been here since I have short time for Bangalore
It is a large and beautiful temple. Must visit. Bangalore metros are a fast and easy way to reach. Lots of shops inside.
It is a temple . Here Lord radha Krishna get worship. The temple run by the organization of Iskon board.

In week-days it is closed from 12 to 4 pm, but open full day on weekend and holidays.
Wheelchair facility is also there.
Normal Prasad is available till 2 pm, other options also available.

Good temple, four friends went to temple, it is awesome experience, and good location and looking. Accommodation and transportation is available. It is good for family and friends. Metro is available here. near by biggest Orion mall is available. Inside the temple so many things is there to buy. Prasadam is very nice. We will get peace of mind here.
Peaceful place, view of Bangalore from the temple. Cool breeze in the evening Important bhajan and hare Krishna chanting. Good to visit.

Highly sophisticated temple. Grand building. Bhajans, Keertanas and chantings of Hare Krishna everywhere. Lord Krishna and Radha are the main deities here. Lots of eating and shopping activities below the temple shrine.

Visited this temple a few months back. The temple is located very near to the Metro line and also accessible by Road/Public Transport.
I liked the way everything is laid out.
Proper line and a place to Keep Shoes and then the baggage.
After doing this, you get into a queue into the first temple.
I think there were 2 small temples and then the main hall.
You need to climb a lot of stairs to reach the main hall.
Photography is not Prohibited.
The main hall is massive and I guess i saw Lift facility also available for those in need.

After taking dharshan in the main hall, we proceeded to the Lower halls where we found some Items for sale.
There was a hall for food stalls also.

Over all, you need 1-2 hours to see the entire place.

Parking is Available at Cost.
Washrooms available

One Visit was good for me.

The temple is very famous by the movement spread nationally and internationally. The architecture and serenity of main temple is marvellous.

Arrangements for visitors is impressive, though you will be bogged by the number of religious salesmen trying to sell you one thing or the other in the mall like shops spread everywhere. And yes, they are overpriced to the brim.

I started to suspect that indian people might be very miserly to be reminded everywhere to find money and drop in some blind hundi, or some transparent box with a display of ego. Or are they just the opposite!

Enjoy the place with great views and nice architecture. The peace and stuti chants are the attractions.

I have been going to Bangalore Iskon since 15 years and last visited two months back. I have also visited other Iskon temples in India at Vrindavan, Delhi, Mumbai, Pune, etc and found that the idols and their decoration is quite different in Bangalore. Must visit for Krishna bhakts.
Peace full place I visited ambience is superb I am happy to been here since I have short time for Bangalore

Fantastic marvellous place ,situated in heart of Bengluru.Very good reception from the people and very neat and clean place. The ambience is great.
The temple is beautiful. It has a very peaceful and harmonious vibe. Satwik food at the higher taste is something to look forward to. This place should be visited while at Bangalore.

Reached here by metro with family. A short walk from there. The location is quite picturesque, located on a elevated hill. One has to walk inside the temple a bit though, which might be an issue for old people. Apart from this, you'll feel so peaceful up until one crosses the Lord Krishna's shrine in the main mandir. Post that there are a lot of stalls (books/food/decorative items etc..), which feels a bit out of place.
Its very good temples with neat and clean. Big space to seat. Very calm and positive vibe place. You will also get prasad, and there are lots of eating place inside the temples
Believe this place can get very busy on the weekend. Go during week and have an easy time for 1-2 hours.

Wow, what a moving spiritual place. One of the highlights of our trip to Bangalore! The ceremony and chanting, the vibe of pure devotion, the shrine - It doesn't matter what your religious beliefs, this is a beautiful and peaceful place

I enjoyed the visit to this temple and learned alot. Now I have a better appreciation for Hare Krishna...my memory is hearing and seeing them at the Los Angeles airport decades ago. Be prepared to take your shoes off.. you can wear socks unless you don't mind walking on the floor with everyone else's bare feet.

Before I start detailed review I must say I am surprised & equally sad üòûüò° that lord Jagannath is not placed in this Iskon. We have visited many other Iskon in different cities this is different only here. However excellent place for a family time in this Hindu temple where you mind peace with Hare Krishna Hare Ram chant all around. Young old kids all dancing with the drum sound. We started around 4 pm on Sunday with decent traffic and had a good time spent in the evening. New car drivers to be little careful to take the car to the top as it very steep hill. You get lot to eat all varieties of snacks right inside the temple. Enjoy samosa, rasmalai, dhokla, donuts, variety of sweets. You get multiple spiritual books and accessories.. though it could be little expensive. Not sure why photography is prohibited in such a beautiful looking place. There after we went to Orion Mall which is right next to it. Open space in the mall is a nice place for some good time. We had dinner there and back home. Thanks for reading .. happy traveling üòä

iskcon temple is one of the most beautiful temple I have visited recently .Iskcon temple I have visited in Bangalore is one of the biggest temple in the world.i have visited this temple my self.it was full of lighting at night most beautiful temple
The maintenance is very good and prasadam is very tasty.You can buy lots of tasty sweets here and some devotional items too.Must visit for Lord krishna devotees.

This was my first visit to ISKON Bengaluru. The place is huge and the architecture beautiful. Everything there has a southern touch!
You are not allowed to take camera/bag/shoes inside the premises. But they have good facility of keeping your stuff safe. They only charge Rs.2/- for that. You can take your phone but you're not allowed to take pictures inside the premises.
You can buy lots of goodies from the merchandise store on the exit path. They have books, accessories, food products which are really great.
The only bad thing were the washroom, very bad condition.

The 4* I gave is all for the beauty of this place. Other then this I can't say any positive things. You cannot take a proper picture of the temple, unless you ask your driver to stop across the road which could be almost impossible. Inside the temple, there are few things you can picture. Of course you can and should admire the beauty inside.
A few advises: be prepared and have some trousers in your bag because you can't enter in shorts. If you have not, then they will provide a lungi which they help you to dress it. But be prepared to feel uncomfortable with it; it works like a circuit, once you proceed to the next point, you shouldn't come back.
Very nice and tidy temple. We visited in the afternoon. Had to wait in a long queue. But it's really beautiful.
I went with my friends visited Sri Krishna Temple they made inside amazing interiors I like the place .. thanks

Bangalore is one of the main attractions such as ISKCON Temple, where many modern amenities and multi-vision cinema theater, computer assisted presentation, theater, and library etc.

Vedic library and didactic. See flashes of this beautiful temple is made attractive.

The atmosphere was of Polish water gold statues of Radha Krishna, and circles around on the roof of the main hall of the temple, the temple at really amazing visual displays. Where hordes of tourists are thronging.

Temple is very clean . Morning 10 is the best time to visit.. it takes 90min to visit. Snacks and sweets are available. Lagguage and footwear can be stored. Wear the traditional dress for ladies is suggestable.

Very nice place to do to.
Beautiful place, timing is important to look at.
this place can get really crowed a times, festive times.
Nice place to visit.place was clean and well marked.parking of vehicles was no problem.there was no rush at the temple.chanting of mantra was very nice.
The atmosphere is ver cool and worshippers enjoy the place and also they have many cultural activities running all year
Temple on hill is having very good appearance in evening under lighting . The Iskcon temple is having very clean ,peaceful place Allowing to perform meditation in the premises is very nice.
It is a nice palce to visit. But little commercialized.It is clean and neat. The charges are also reasonable.
I went with my parents. I have been to Iskcon in vrindavan, Delhi also. This temple is quite big and beautiful. A place of serenity, and must visit.

This place is very good in all season. it is very clean and well maintained place. I love to visit this place. There is krishana temple , where all day aarti and puja going on. you can join in any time. Also easily reachable place by bus / metro.

It is situated on a small hillock in Raj in agar Bangalore.it is founded by the ISKON movement.It is a nice temple and a picnic spot for family,with stalls .it also has a marriage hall to conduct marriages which is given at discounted rates for ISKON members.since the followers of Lord Krishna are few in the south this is the only one in Bangalore.you can spend one evening on the Hillock.
Extremely well organised, absolutely clean, in the middle of a busy street but still a bliss inside.
It's quite peaceful most of the time.. it's perfect visit during aarthi time.. in kartheeka maasa, the temple is lit with 1000 lamps which is a beautiful sight..

It is a great place to visit. One of the Iconic place in bangalore. Also I hope this is the biggest or second biggest temple in the india. To reach here you have lot of transportation is available which includes metro as well.

I honestly didn't like the place at all. It might be beautiful but it was not at all like a temple. They have converted the place into business and everywhere there was the statue of the person who had opened Iskcon. Overall I didn't like the place, as there was no peace.
Bangalore has many places for travelers to see and enjoy and one such place is ISKCON - Krishna Temple.
Just a picnic spot..And.a restaurant..If you are looking for some device blessing, walk into your neighbouring temple

Best place to visit, when you want some peace, want to think do swot analysis.
Good connection with metro. Food is awesome.
One of the best places if you are looking for some spiritual peace. ISKON also has some of the best paintings painted on the ceilings.

So,here it is,one of my favourite place to visit whenever feels little worn out and escon in Bangalore, what else you want...home away from home.
You should definitely visit this place,especially in the evening
Must visit on my tabüëç

Interesting experience. There is a shoe station where you leave your shoes before entering the temple. Beautiful place, pity that cameras are not allowed. Well worth a visit to see the ceremony in the evening.
Its a very beautiful and peaceful place. Kept very clean by the staff. loved it! Must visit for everyone!

The food serve over here takes you to a different world..Combination of all colours and flavors of our country combined together. Heavenly Indeed. They also serves delicious theme food based on various festivals like Diwali, Holi.
Very nice temple. Not to miss. Peaceful and relaxing place. Looks beautiful in the evenings when lights are on.

Truly an amazing place to witness the beauty and to park yourself for some peace. The temple looks really great with beautiful interiors and modern architecture.
Stalls here are well maintained and the food court offers several delicious food. The prasadam was of great taste.

Me and my wife visited This Temple in evening hours, the Arti time is 7 pm . The entry is free , special Darshan from front row is Rs 300/- . You need approximately one hour for Temple Visit. There are lots of prasad and food and souvenirs stalls in premises. The Shayan Arti time is 8 pm .

This temple is one of the best I have been to, so very well maintained, although little crowded due to it being popular but worth visiting.
It has connectivity with metro and other transportation services, located in the nice location, and it takes 2-3 hours to see the temple...
good place to relax in the busy place in the city, the place has everything in it. only plsce for parent to visit in the city
Peaceful place and enchantment of hare rama hare krishna makes the atmosphere blissful. Every part of the temple is mesmerizing. Enjoy!
Amidst the hustle of the city, fine a place a serenity. All you have to do is go and sit, rest everything will be taken care of.

Iskcon Banglore is one of the finest krishna temples in India. Get inside, Have a glimpse of God.. Sit before him for while, enjoy the ambience and Come out refreshed. Sr.Citizens, Specially Challenged can use lift services. Kids have 3D Theatre and Other amusements. Families have a lot of items to purchase and If you are a foodie... Keep you stomach empty before visit. Very near to Mahalaxmi and Sandalwood Factory metro stations.

The ISKCON Temple, is a sprawling temple build on and around the Hare Krishna Hill. After the Darshan, the exit leads you to the Gift Shops, shops selling religious books and stalls selling snacks. Free Lunch (Prasadam) is provided to devotees from 12:00 to about 1:30 PM or 2 PM. There is also a restaurant in the premises, called the Higher Taste Restaurant, even though I didn't try it. The place has a Guest House which is free for Life Patrons. The temple is within walking distance from the Mahalaxmi Metro Station. The Metro system was not completed when I visited. If completed, the temple can be reached within minutes from the city hubs like MG Road.

In the February month I visited iskcon temple for my business. Iskcon temple was very well here many tourist visited for capturing wonderful insight of this place this is very good temple for tourist . This temple is quiet and amazing

A beautiful modern temple, but find of looks a bit like the older Hindu ones. Interesting architecture.

It was nice to see so many people involved with the religion there.

There was lots of places to buy small souvenirs, and a free meal was provided (although I didn't try it).

We went in late afternoon, so by the time we came out, it was night time and beautiful all lit up and with the water features as well.

Visited on recommendations from many people we met so went along - beautiful building and obviously a big commercial enterprise ! We had no idea what we were doing and seemed to be permanently separated from everyone else there !!! But went with the flow and hare krishnaaaed W when needed to . We felt that some explanations would have been helpful as felt we were part of something without any understanding of it - sometimes quite useful to just enjoy but this time would have liked to know and as for the ‚Äúparty bag ‚Äú on leaving we'll surely that money to provide that could be used elsewhere ? Have visited many other temples with better ambience but was an interesting experience .

It's a beautifully designed and well maintained Iskcon temple. The crowd is managed superbly. Great place for Krishna devotees. Photography not allowed in d main hall.lot of stalls and memorabilia to collect from the halls after the main hall visit. Good quality snacks are available on paid basis in the eatables section. Must try d Prasadam given just before the exit from the temple
A religious place in the heart of Bengalureans. Located near to the Rajaji Nagar. A perfect destination for religious people.

The housekeeping staff at (hotel name) have truly made my experience an easy and satisfying one. They tended to each and every one of my needs in a timely and gracious manner. I would have to also mention the great service provided by one of their staff Dharama and house keeping supervisor Rali and other staff also. It's been a great stay here. This is the review only for house keeping Department.
Thanks.

It's a nice temple ...no archeological Marvel, but huge temple for worship and peace . Unfortunately the atmosphere is completely spoilt by vendors selling all sorts of knick knacks , feng shui items , home decoration items with tag of religion , etc and too much space given to eateries. Just too many Commercial activities for a spiritual place .
For peace and spirituality I would rather visit any small temple nearby .

Great place for Krishna devotees. Photography not allowed in d main hall.lot of stalls and memorabilia to collect from the halls after the main hall visit. Good quality snacks are available on paid basis in the eatables section. Must try d Prasadam given just before the exit from the temple

It's a beautifully designed and well maintained Iskcon temple. The crowd is managed superbly. The gift shop offers widest varieties of artifacts. The restaurant is also very nice & serve decent variety of foods. The whole place is maintained hygienically.

A stunning hari Krishna temple just outside of the city of Bangalore.
As it gets hot and you have to take your shoes off to enter I would ensure you have cream for afterwards as the floor burnt my feet walking up to the temple. You can't take any photos inside the temple but can get a good view once you come out. You will receive a free offering of food on your way out. There are lots of gift shops and food stalls on the way out too which are reasonably priced. I would recommend it for a visit if you are in the area. The only thing I didn't like was the fact there were charges to get closer to the main part of the temple. The more you paid the closer you could get. We didn't pay and stayed in the queue and walked past.

Have been here several times and every time the experience has been wonderful.A very peaceful place with the chants of Hare Rama ! Hare Krishna! uplifts your mind.This place should never be missed if you visit Bangalore.Very well maintained .They serve delecious prasad :).The Akshaypatra foundation does a commendable job of feeding the school kids.Have taken part in the kitchen activity through my company's CSR initiative and it was an enriching experience.A spiritual and blissful place :)

We a family of four adults visited the temple in the forenoon on a Sunday. There were hundreds of visitors but our movement was free from any kind of obstruction. Its a beautifully built, well-planned and efficiently managed modern day temple. Food served as Prasad was very good. Parking of vehicle by payment inside the temple campus was also easy. Unfortunately, photography was not allowed.
So peaceful calm place. Well organised as well as maintained. well connected by metro.Hare rama hare krishna
A modern day temple, with modern facilities. Well planned, built and maintained. excellent visitor facility management. Temple is calm and vibrates with Hare Krishna , Hare Rama mantra.

I have visited this temple recently in Bangalore. It is located near to Rajajinagar, banagalore or near to Orion mall. This is a lord Krishna temple and uniqueness of the temple is its beauty. You will get a good view from the temple. If you are in Bangalore then please do visit this temple.
Temple surroundings are calm and serene. The food options available are tasty, but too much commercialisation of place like temple bothered me. Otherwise good place to visit with family on weekend.
1st visit to this temple wonderful place love the temple creative' in side the temple its awswome it like gold .. you will fel peace.
One of the most peaceful and devotees place I saw in Bangalore which is located near yasvantpura railway station.
travelled couple of time with visitors. Nice place and well organized. A must for al tourists and also who believe in hare rama hare krishna
We went here on a weekend and the place was fully packed. To get the real joy and calmness, I will suggest to go on a weekday as it is packed during weekends and during big festivals.

This place is unlike any other temple in India. Spotlessly clean!!!
However this is fully commercialized with krishna merchandise, 3D movie, lots of souvenir etc.The prasad (offering) that they serve is very tasty

This an iconic building and I have been a visitor over the last 15 years, and have not been disappointed.

The temple atmosphere is electric, the spiritual aura magnificent and vibrations positive.

The breakfast, is very good indeed.

Simply brilliant!
A divine experience. Its a big temple so needs some walking, but totally worth it. A must visit temple if you are in Banglore. Hare Krishna.

Its a beautiful built temple.
Yes Crowded on occasion Days
Located very close to Metro Station.

Place for Meditation
Lots of books available....

Prasad full and Free Lunch in noon is served..
.
Kitchen and Food is very hygiene...

Must visit....
too many people. the line takes very long to get to the shrine. Even there, people are not allowed to stand for more than a few minutes

We visited here on our weekend and it was such A beautiful temple. We bought a package which enabled us to walk straight through rather than queue.

The temple is tranquil and it was lovely to learn about the culture.

I would definitely recommend a visit.

It was interesting to read about the founder's background and the expansion of Hare Krishna from a small sect to the world movement it is today. The main hall was attractive, but still, less than 70 years old... also more items and areas focused on selling than "for see." Overall, not my cup of tea.

It is located very near to Metro station so very easy to reach. Sometimes it very much crowded with devotees. It has a place to sit and meditate in the huge hall. Books are available inside the temple. There is canteen inside it from which we can buy food.

Good time to spend and very nice to get relaxed with a lot of peaceful views at this place. Very good to bring kids, adults, old people and all are Praying here without any differences. Lord Sri Krishna is always with you at every stage, placing the faith and trust will help you achieve your goals and objectives with confidence and expertise. People will be able to get meditated peacefully and the food available here is very hygiene and is very good for health too, Peace place for Family

Inaugurated in 1997, it is one of the largest iskon temple in the world. We had visited on a weekday and the entire layout right from putting your shoes inside a bag to walking up the stairs for darshan to buying books accesories, food etc. The line is well managed. At the end of the line they offer free prasad to all devotees (optional).
It was one of many visits, its a place that I visit on a regular basis. A must visit place at least once.
#NAME?

It's maintained well.Good policy /rules, calmly anyone can visit, Good facility for out of station devotees as well as.
Very neat and clean temple.
Evenings in ISKCON gets very messy. too many people. the line takes very long to get to the shrine. Even there, people are not allowed to stand for more than a few minutes.

I was totally depressed. So went to Simon temple for peace. But really I want to say you that I got peace inside of the temple. I just went insuse and say for whole and prayed for god to give peace. In the meantime I don't get but later I felt so fresh and relaxed. So really nice place.
When ever if you wanna have some peaceful time this is the place. Indulge in the calm and soothing chants of hare ram hare krishna.

Crowd management is good and the place is very clean and well maintained. Also being on a hillock, the surrounding view is quite refreshing.
One has to walk quite a bit which may be difficult for the elderly.
Eating area had many veg choices along with onions, unlike a traditional temple.
It is the famous god Krishna temple in Karnataka. A parking facility is also available. We will get best devotional feeling here. This is the best place for vacation.
I have went this temple with my friend enjoyed a lot,,very well maintained ,very peaceful.nice service they are providing eatables are also they are providing...

ISKCON Temple is visited by many devotees everyday. It is very well managed and a peaceful Darshan is assured in this Temple. Once inside the quarters one can hear rhythmic rhymes and charms which makes it so calming. If in Bangalore do make a plan to pay your respect to the Lord in this Temple.

Very neatly maintained temple with lots of divine energy. Lots of care put to instill positivity and high value Hare Rama Hare Krishna chant goes on in the evening with everyone joining in. This place has a book stall painting stall also

There are 2 Iskcon temples in Bangalore one in Rajajinagar and another in Kanakapura Road. Both are on the hill and is Grand with krishna and rukmani as the main God. After visit to temple one can have good prasadam also. Parking space is adequate. Must visit place.
Awesome experience. Pay to skip the line. well worth it. pictures are not allowed and you must remove your shoes.
must when visiting the city, gives a calm and soothing touch to the spirit and soul ...one can sit for hours and meditate and stay connected
Best Hindu temple in Bangalore. Before entering you have to leave outside the shoes (to a so called wardrobe)

Go early this place gets really busy. You need to take your shoes off and leave them with an attendant but the system works well and cost nothing.
There is no entry fee but there are plenty of places to make donations so do this instead.
You will not be allowed to take a camera in and you cannot use your cell phone camera either.
They form an orderly line to get people through the inside of the temple so basically you get to walk around the shrine inside. It is huge and gold plated.
Once you leave the shrine area you walk through to where you can buy merchandise and book on Krishna and then there is a cafeteria where you can buy food.
There are toilets available once you leave the temple area.
Well worth a visit, we spent about 40 minutes here as there was no que, but I imagine when busy the wait to get in would be longer.

The first time I entered this place, I felt I was entering some shopping mall with God at the centre. Honestly speaking, I didn't enjoy the place and the concept of ISCON temple just did not make sense to me.

This is good place located on the West of Chord Road walkable from Metro station / Orion mall... like anyother ISCON temple this one is grand too...

while coming out from temple there are so many stalls where people sale books , papers and typical stuff related to God but looking at extreme commercialisation sometime it feels like purpose of temple getting defeated because their you get all kind of sweets , chats and even almost burger stuff

I went in the evening and the place was lit up and was looking amazing. There are stairs to reach the main temple but once inside you get enlightened with the light and the bhajans and is unexplainable the feeling of having God near you.

What can one say about the temple. It amazing. Nice environment. Located in top. Memorising "Hare Krishna, hare Krishna, " on the foot for 108 times. Gives you more peace.

One has to visit.

After they finished constructing the new premises, ISKCON has become one of the most popular places for tourists in the city. The atmosphere is very calm, management makes sure order is maintained. The temple is also very clean. It also has a few good places to eat. All in all, must visit this temple at least once.

Really wonderful place, I had visited in middle of busy schedules, my mind got free and the paintings inside are amazing. The Prasadam they provided will blow ur taste buds the farthest. Really recommend this site for a unconditional soothing mind.

Located on top of Hill on Chord Road, the ISKCON temple has beautiful idols of Lord Rama and Lord Krishna and mesmerizing floral decoration of the sanctum area. Many devotees and tourists visit the temple to get a darshan of the Hare Krishna Hare Rama.

ISKCON Temple is a landmark of Bengaluru for people from all walks of life with a spiritual bent of mind & wanting to understand the Indian Culture. It has a fine blend of religion with modern management & lot of learning about Krishna & the epics of India. A must see place in Bengaluru for all tourists from India & abroad.

ISKCON is not just a place of worship but is full of lessons. This is such a peaceful place and must visit for all those searching for inner peace. Definitely a get away from the hectic life. Best part about this place is the food! üôà
The temple is built on a hillock and is a typical ISKON temple. Early morning is best time to visit aa it is less crowded and you can witness the aarti
ISKCON Temple Bangalore is very posh Krisha temple, very nice and decorated with color full lighting. we need more time visit. It is located at prime location.

the temple is modern yet maintains the sanity of the place. I have visited almost all the time of the day.
the temple. prasadam and everything is very beautiful...
I would call it a place to visit
It is a good place for worship of Lord Krishna, which is situated on rocks. It's one of the most cleaned and well kept temples in bangalore.

Bangalore: you would experience that the city is all about running around; everyone seems to be mindlessly going about their business. In the middle of all this is the Hare Krishna Hill. ISKCON Temple is one place to visit to feed your Soul. It is serenity in the midst of chaos. The place is a marvel and a grand one at that, one cannot help but admire at the beauty of temple. It does not matter what your faith is, a visit to ISKCON is sure to be a very calming and enriching experience.
ISKCON also has a lot of "purifying" food for the body, right from the "prasadam" offered to each visitor. There are organic products and a very good Satvik restaurant to nourish body after a a filling experience for your inner self.

They say vibration matters ...you feel something even before you are face to face with it .That is how I feel.when I get near to.tbis temple. All calm...rejuvenated...full of high energy and full of hope.its a heavenly place where art speaks to you in hushed tones...and the dieties seem to look at you so lovingly . For me it's very personal . I get the feel of what it would be like in an another realm. What being in heaven would seem like ...where the sound of bells ...the kirtans...the beat of instruments in the background would give you an insight into that cosmic realm.Such is the aura that greets me upon visiting this ISKCON temple in Bangalore.
The plus point I get to buy beautiful incense sticks on the way out... eat Prasad and feel invigorated and blessed .

I went there all alone in bus. I had to change bus twice and hald to walk from the metro station. The temple staffs are very helpful. One has to submit the camera and footwear at the counter. You are not allowed to take the camera inside the temple. Thought they say photography is not allowed, i could see people taking photos from their mobile phone. They have different temples inside and the priest ask if you want special aarti. The architecture of the temple is great. One can go alone and never feel bored.
The temple is rested on top of a hillock with great architecture giving a serene feeling. The view outside is great.

Though commercialized, this is a very beautiful temple. People are selling all sorts of items from food to photos. However, the idols of Krishna and Radha is very beautiful, and can easily spend a couple of hours in this temple.
Nice place to visit to connect to thou spiritual self but after the temple visit the exit is through the place which reminds you that may be thou ate visiting a mall or an exhibition

I am visiting this temple from almost 15years. The temple hall is very good with traditional ceremonies held. Evening 8pm Aarti is very good to see.
But once we come out of the temple hall the commercial operation starts with a big restaurant which is busier than the temple. This makes the ppl having a feel that they are not in a temple.
Finally Prasad distributed is very hot and tasty.

This is a great place to go - spiritually. The temple premises are wonderfully clean and quiet and you can have a good darshan with or without tickets.

There is a lot of vegetarian food options - from the really budget variety to the luxurious.

temple built on a hill having great 3 Stepped architecture. View form top is good. Inside temple 3 main shrines are having gold plated domes but chants to Hare Rama hare Krishna gives peace of mind..!
On way out... you feel as if you are in food street.. having all sorts of food items from jalebi to Pizza available :).
I have been to so many iskon temples and this is one of the best Hare Krishna Temple and there are so many activities going around, with a nice foodcourt where you can enjoy lot of savouries!!!

ISKCON is a beautiful, modern temple. It is often busy, but worth it. As other reviewers have said, there is a restaurant and mini-mall type bazaar at the exit, but these things should not discourage a visit. Also, there is a decent selection of very reasonably priced books, available in many languages.

Pleasant temple staffed by volunteers surrounded by a ‚Äú city ‚Äú of hundreds if not a few thousands flats in high rise buildings

Food in ‚Äú exclusive ‚Äú restaurant fair but not fantastic, and is expensive

Try the experience?
Very nice temple and must visit place in Bangalore. Entry starts with chanting and queue moves pleasantly, devotional way. Apart from temple, it's huge commercial place

Very big and well managed temple it will take 2 to 3 hours to visit and see this temple
Pooja is very nice I request people to don't miss arathi or pooja timings
The place looks fabulous during night and bhajans are a must for a religious person ! try and take your family, if possible.

I have been a fan of ISKCON temples all throughout and I keep visiting them wherever get a chance to. The one in Bangalore is decently built an yes clean as the other ones but I could not find anything too special about this place.

Just for some peaceful time, you can visit this place, just be in the decorum.

cheers...

One of the most attracting and devine places in Bangalore, one must really give a visit. Situated about less than 1km from Mahalakshmi metro stop near to ORION Mall.. No transportation problem.. Nice prasadha too..

This a beautiful temple in Bangalore (All Iskcon temples I have been to are beautiful). This is not an ancient temple and has none of those histories that many old temples do.

There is generally ample parking at reasonable price (I am member so I don't have to pay parking, but it's either Rs 30 per hour or Rs. 30 for the entire visit, not sure which one).
The campus is kept extremely clean and Hygienic (including public facilities). The darshan process goes through 2-3 small temples each a few steps higher than other so you slowly get to the main temple without having to climb too many steps at a time (good for elderly). The darshan is through a regular (free) line and a paid fast line (includes prasad and personalized puja). Lifetime members can go through fast lane complimentary. Fast lane also brings you a little closer to the idols compared to regular lane.

There are 2 restaurants on site + a small food court and all serve decent food (not great) for a reasonable price.

Note: Shorts are not allowed in temple premises so make sure to wear long pants.

We had heard so much about the ISKCON temple in Bangalore and wanted to check it out. While the temple is clean and well maintained, we were very disappointed by the level of commercialization...... When you finish visiting the mandir, you are routed through what looks like a fair or mall with lots of items related to Indian and Hindu culture made from cheap plastics in China. It felt like you being forced to walk through a cheap version of a gift shop (10 times bigger than a normal gift shop) at the end of a museum visit. Sad....
At entrance you have chance to pray like Hindus . in the place you can see lots of traditions and praying ceremony.
Really beautiful temple and one of the biggest Iskcon temples I have visited. You can spend the whole day there. So beautiful.
ISKCON temple is one of the must visit religious tourist place in Bengaluru. It has got a positive vibe and also has a great food court.
What a good place as a temple. Well built infrastructure with restrooms, restaurants, guest rooms. The god is fabulous
A very big temple but is very well managed very beautiful and the views are just amazing ought to go here

Enjoyed my visit here - modern Hindu temple with a cheap cafeteria at the end- tasty local Indian food.
Very interesting interior to the temple. I enjoyed the visit

Visited the temple with a friend of mine it was the only place we had actually planned as there no plane of any sorts for the rest of the day. The sheer hugeness of the temple right in middle of city amazed me and the people there are so well mannered and really good in communication even if u don't know the local language they are pretty good with English.

Overall a really good way to start your day or a place to run to if you want to just relax and get your mind free from all the hustle and bustle of the city.

One more important thing you can't hear any car honks or sounds once your inside the temple.

You can explore this place as hangout place, to buy some puja related/spiritual stuffs or with a pure devotional mindset. whatever is your objective, this place has all of it. If you want to go as a devotee, then i would recommend, be there during the Arti (morning or evening). I love that time, you can be a part of the arti and start Chanting and dancing. For some time at least you will be in a different world. The entry to the temple is pretty long. If you leave your foot wears in the car itself, it might be better, else you need to walk long just to keep your chappals/shoes. The exit from the temple is through a shopping place and eating place (you cant avoid that). And interestingly you will find more people in this area especially at the food place. They will give you free prasadam while exiting, If you prefer not to take your car metro could also be a good option. Get down at Mahalxmi or Sandal Soap Factory station and then you can walk. They have a canteen with all sort of veg food choice (north/south Indian). The interior of the main temple is marvelous. In the evening, temple looks beautiful with lighting.
Highly recommend visiting ISKCON. Leave yourself 45minutes atleast to take it in and enjoy its beauty.

I visited Saturday evening on non-festival day so avoided the long queue. Temple campus is huge though main temple isn't so big. Deities are also okay though ambience isn't serene. If you add whole experience of walking around, listening to bhajan (only one they sing, you know that), and attending Aarti then it's worth the visit. They have few eateries and a cheap canteen too for quick bite.

I really enjoyed an hour walking and admiring the wonder inside. It is definite visit if in Bangalore. However, the crowd over weekends can get a bit daunting. Ensure to not wear expensive shoes or foot wear. As you have to leave it outside for a fee..can be collected later.
Respect the prayers and ensure to keep your mobile on silent.
That was an amazing visiting. Was my first templo, so my experience was fantastic! Don' miss it, but go on a comfort shoes, cause you have to take it out.

I visited this Premises on 7th Jan evening around 5 pm.

1. To start with this review, there are 2 categories of people who visit this Premises.

One with devotion looking for Peace and getting a feel of God - To those category this is not the place.

For the category of people who would like to spend some time , like on a picnic with family, taking selfies, eating food/snacks -Yes this is the place. I felt Eight out of Ten People visiting here belong to this category.

2. I do not understand why devotees are first asked to climb quite a long distance to deposit mere slippers and the queue management all the way to the main Sanctum Sanctorum is decided to create a serpentine queue in mind deliberately rather than otherwise since we can see the side gates deliberately closed.

3. Inside the main temple in Sanctum Sanctorum, the deities are beautiful and decorated well as is always with ISKCON Temples around India . There starts and ends the feel of the Lord and that is his boundary.

However further to that from the Sanctum, there are markets of Books,sweet stalls, restaurants,chaat shops,Tea/Coffee Shops forcing people walking out to get clogged in unnessary blocks and queues.I dont understand how Ice Creams, Samosa's,Bread, Pastry and Chaat items are termed Prasadam's in the coupons and sold inside temple premises.

4. If the intention is to run in a restaurant manner, need to run the same in appropriate professional fitting manner with tables,chairs and people to serve rather than club it within the temple premise and pollute the devotion.

5. On the exit passage , there was a ISKCON staff issuing small Photos to people in the queue and when my daughter aged 5 years streched her hand to get a small photo the staff in a ill-mannered tone said 'GO GO - THESE ARE NOT FOR CHILDREN'. Certainly if these are not for children it should be told in a tone which is acceptable and not in this manner. Felt like returning the small ISKCON Krishna photo to him back which he gave to me before my daughter streched my hand but felt there would be no difference between him and me if I return it back to him. My daughter suprisingly kept the Krishna photo all throughout the journey back home and refused to give it back to anyone else.

The Management should realise that Marketing/Commercialization should not hold upper hand over devotion.Temples are the places where the Lord Resides and these should be run for Lord Krishna and should not be created and maintained with the contention and mindset to generate income for Maintenance ,water , electricity ,house keeping staff and security people.

I am sure that this review would never even bother the management as a feedback for them as I do see a many of this nature in this forum but this review is intended for the category of people who intend to visit this 'Premises'.

I would never return to visit this ISKCON Temple anymore.

It is a big establishment and well maintained. Prefer visiting on weekdays for less crowd and more peaceful experience. There is a decent food court inside the temple area. You can also carry your own food and eat here (if you wish).
Hare Krishna! A place to visit and highly recommended. Usually, the Sundays are crowded. Other near by attraction is the Orion Mall.

Iskcon in Bangalore is really beautiful and being a large temple there one can expect a at least 30 mins to see the Krishna idol at the main sanctum sanctorum where there are 3 main idols.

What i did not like about the temple is the way they are try to sell the their products.. right next to the main temple they are selling gita copies, then once you go down again you pass through multiple places to buy things and the price for food is also higher... a samosa inside the temple costs 30 INR....
This is a bigger Iskcon Temple than in many other places. After darshan you can have good quality food at affordable rates.

Being from Delhi, I have seen Iskcon Temple of Delhi & Mathura also. So my view of Iskcon Bangalore is based on the comparison with these two.

Iskcon temple Bangalore was very much overcrowded on sunday when we went there, cleanliness was also not upto the mark and finishing work was not that good as compared to delhi.

After you pass through the area where people worship Lord Krishna you enter in a big passage of market when you will so many stalls selling verity of things related to Krishna, so many food stalls are also there.

You end up wondering weather I am in a temple to get some peace or I am visiting any market. Sincerely I was very much disappointed with Cleanliness and Market type setup since till I visited Isckon Bangalore I had always associated Iskcon as temple where you will fall in love with Lord Krishna.

It is a beautiful place but lacks the feeling of spirituality that a temple should have.
You can really enjoy beautiful architecture and mesmerizing idols of Lord Krishna.
Good place for darshan of Lord Krishna and as we walk thru the temple premises it reminds us the divine history of India. Peaceful place to spend
Beautiful Temple. Must Visit. You would like to avoid public Holiday if you want to avoid Crowd. Nice Food.

Very clean and neat..one of the best temple for worshippers of God Krishna in Bangalore ample parking place...great ambience, good collection of books on God Krishna..ISKCON doing a great job in providing mid day meal to Govt school children..
Beautiful temple in Bangalore with good artitac. Nothing more to say , I will say only todos every where........
This is the biggest iskcon temple after the Mayapur that i have visited. Nice temple though quite commercial
A very nice temple. Good lighting at night. Ambience is great. Clean and well maintained. Woth visiting

The ISKCON temple is a must visit religious and tourist destination in Bangalore. The temple is excellently Maintained and extremely neat and clean. The inside of the sanctum is serene, with the soothing chants of Lord Krishna. Outside of the temple sanctum presents commercial aspect with lots of stalls selling food and other products. Visiting during early hours is recommended to avoid the rush.

We have visited Isckon several times and it is always a great experience. The temple itself is beautiful and being on height it offers great view of surrounding city area and sunset in evening.

There is also free lunch served on Sunday. But since this place being very popular it is always crowded, my guess would be morning a good time for quiet experience. Definitely avoid evenings on weekends.
Great experience, peaceful, wonderful location. The temple is serene, clean. Makes you want to visit it again

It's such a beautiful sight to behold as you enter the temple :) Also you'll need quite a few hours to explore the temple properly.
What I didn't appreciate however was the blatant commercialization of the complex interested in ensuring product sales
Not like other tourist places. Do visit their evening rituals as the holy chant will amaze you with serenity. Crowded on weekend.
neat and clean temple with great ambient and environment. i visited with my friend and had great time
Visited this place with my family and friends. The day we went the place was very busy due to holiday season but it was a nice experience. Must visit spot in bengaluru.
Nice place to visit with family and friends . Many things to see and can spend time. Want to have great time

Been here a couple of times. It is well organized in terms of the queue system. You will not experience any pushing or pulling while waiting in the queue. Have heard that the evening aarti is beautiful. There are many food counters behind the temple and there are a couple of vegetarian restaurants as well, a few handicrafts store, religious book stalls etc. Honestly, I did not find anything special about the temple. It is a good place to take your parents and relatives who would like to visit a temple in Bangalore

Nice and peaceful environment....Well maintained temple...Spend about a hour plus and its worth visiting it...Too good peace and calm....Over weekend it may be rush so plan accordingly....Little far from main city....But a must to visit if you in Bangalore...Then for sure you should explore...It's part of local site seeing tours as well..Otherwise you can hire a cab or auto very easily to visit this place if you are a tourist...

This is a nice Krishna temple and is well organized. It is very clean as well. The inside of the temple is extremely well done, especially the murals. The paintings on the roof are gorgeous. I did not try the food in the temple. The 108 Hare Krishna chants were very nice. Recommend everyone to do that. The bazaar set up post temple was overdone though. It is fine to have 4-5 shops selling relevant merchandise. But to have an entire market set up seemed way over the top. Overall, good visit and experience.
Situated on quite a height. Tiring to climb so many stairs . More emphasis is on commercial sale which occupies nearly 60% of the temple area.

This one of the Well maintained temple of Bangalore, this place pulls good amount of crowd in weekends. Temple has good attractive book stalls, restaurants, a small movie hall. There will be frequent speeches happening in this premises. The prasad that's given after darshan would be amazingly tasteful. The management also taking care of social welfare programs, if you need to be part of that, the volunteers would guide you there. If you want to have a peaceful Darshan and enjoy the beauty of this place, visit at your earliest possible, you could avoid rush.

Located on a mountain. One of the finest and cleanest Temple in Bengaluru. It attracts crowd from all over the world. It has an amazing architecture and great views. It has ample parking place, hotels, marriage halls. They also prepare food under Akshayapathra scheme to feed the underprivileged school children...

my sister had come and we went there with family..it is a nice temple but was very crowded since holiday. had to walk.a lot but inner sanctum was great. after darshan it was bit commercial with lots of food stall . overall nice visit but not recommended on public holidays

ISKCON is a prominent Icon in this IT Capital's Desktop. The peaceful serene atmosphere inside the temple shifts your mood completely. I closed my eyes and sta for a while. Was simply listening to the chantings there and had a divine experience.A must visit if you are coming to Bangalore.

They have very good murals painted at the main temple depiciting - Leelas of Krishna. There is a dedicated shop selling paintings and other art works. This place delights you if you are an art lover.

This temple is well connected to most parts of Bangalore with Metro train. From anywhere you can reach to Majestic Metro station and then change to Green lines and get down @ Mahalakshmi station, from which the temple is a five minutes walk / Rs. 50 in Uber.
The Temple is located in Rajaji nagar. A very quite place, always try to visit in morning as there will be less rush.

I was impressed with the level of organization at this temple given that there are literally tens of thousands of people who come here daily. The systemised queuing with shoe and baggage storage made it very easy to flow through in and out.
I wish to visit this place quite often, as my wishes fulfill on visiting this place. The food and prasadam is also tasty.
A perfect devotional place and located in one of the best place of the city, people should visit and relax
A landmark in Bangalore and must visit for events like Vikunta ekadasi. Traffic is a problem but there is parking available. Bit commercialized with it wedding halls, food stalls and merchandise.

The temple is maintaining its charm after many years and even when the surroundings have become concrete jungle. Kids like this place for the structure and chanting of hare Krishna mantra , paintings and gold plated inner sanctum , food stalls after darsanam, and hot anna prasadam !! Would suggest to go for evening harathi..that's a very nice experience!
ISKCON temple is such a beautiful temple in Bangalore, very neat and clean, lovely temple. Visited over there with my wife.

Iskcon temple is located in Malleswaram. It's a very relaxing place. We always found paying for a Seva to be much better than getting in the general queue. This allows Darsan from close quarters without facing huge crowd. The kids really like books and CDs available from their shops (located on the way out). There is a car park close to temple, but the entrance is hidden.

The temple is amazingly beautiful. The gold touch on the statues is worth adds to the grandness of this place. You walk through all these walkways up to the main temple. There are many rows of devotees From India and the world. As it is a holy traditional place, it's advised that you wear modest clothing. They don't appreciate too revealing outfits. We attended the Pooja. I really loved that there is Balram Statue In this temple. Balram is lord Krishna's older brother. You can buy spiritual items, malas,books, scarfs. At the end of the course of temple, you are offered Prasadam, khichdi and ladders. I was delighted to see a life size statue of Swami Prabhupad ji in seated in a Guru seat in a big hall. He appears to be very much present as living holy being. My gratitude to Swami Ji for having the foresight to allow devotees to have Darshan of Krishna. We had a special lunch buffet at their restaurant. It's very clean, modern, with delicious sattwic food. You should plan your meal there when you visit the Iskon Temple.

Excellent place for anyone from any religion to appreciate hinduism. If you are devout Hindu you can freely and peacefully worship and get immersed with spirituality. If not you can enjoy being Hindu with absolute freedom of religion and belief. If you are non hindu and curious then enjoy and learn about this great religion. Well decorated temple of Krishna (main deity), Rama, Narasimha etc.. Loads of spiritual books in all languages. Pray and dance and sing feel free. Experience the divinity. Also umpteen choice of vegetarian satvik food. Endless things to enjoy.

As a South American, I am not used to see in a temple the
concentration, and physical devotion that one perceives in the temple.
It is very moving.
ISKCON Temple Bangalore is one of the cleanest ISKCON temple of India. You can spend peaceful hours at this place

We travelled along with a group of senior citizens.
The management was very cooperative and ensured that maximum distance covered by the vehicle to avoid walking.

This is a cult temple in North West Bangalore. Has a display of how many meals have been donated, has multiple courses running for happiness, peace etc. Has a dress code to enter and separate lines for premium and non-premium followers. Isckon devotees have a special way of dance and they hard sell temple books. Found the showmanship very distracting to actually achieve peace and calm in this temple.
Nice n peacefull place to visit. One the must to see when you are in Bangalore. The spirituality is in the air of this place.

Visited this temple with my family on Dec'17. The place is easy to find and we reached there in a cab. Need to walk a few distance before reaching the main temple. The place is neat and clean. It has a covered pathway so we always walk in shade throughout the temple. They have a souvenir shop just after visiting the main prayer hall. They have lot many varieties to choose from but i would suggest to skip this and go towards the exit where you get these for lesser price. It ranges from children's story books, color books, magnets,key-chains,photo frames and so on. Similarly they have an in house food court with limited varieties of dishes but that should be good for a quick bite ranging from Puliodharai, lemon rice, curd vada, chilli baji,dokhla, badam milk, julabjamoon at a reasonable price. Also they have a restaurant near the exit I did not get a chance to taste there. Overall we had a good time at ISKCON as it was not crowded and will visit again if I visit Bangalore again.

Excellently maintained temple premises peaceful place for a nice weekend for
tense free time

Not merely a pretty building to look at and admire, to a Hindu the temple is the center of intellectual, artistic, spirituals, educational, and social elements of daily life.

The architecture attempts to dissolve the boundaries between human beings and the divine, seeking to stress the unification with the divine as the ultimate aim.

I believe in Lord Krishna, that's the main reason me along with my family visited Iskcon. It s the best place that I know in Bangalore. Ur mind soul will relax with all the pains that u hv in heart. We really had a good time by visiting to the temple.

The temple is very beautiful and captures the 10 Avatars in lovely images and dedicated mini-temples. Its kept clean and very orderly.
Worth a visit.
Just leave all your worries and stress on the shoe rack of ISKON temple and enter into the world of spiritual peace. Don't forget to participate in evening AARTI.
Its quite easily accessible from all the places in the city. there are several programs conducted regulary where you get to learn about culture and religion and life.

I got introduced through FOLK program, it was a wonderful experience nice lecture, accomodation, Prasad, Aarthi etc. But after 3 years of being a part of their community realized that they have deviated from the original Vedic philosophy of following the Guru-Shishya Parampara. They have their own speculations and arguments.
So except of their philosophy everything else is good, nice tourist place, can take your guests, family members for different temple experience.

Devine visit to a holy place. We are fond of iscon temples, not a dedicated follower though. Its a nice place to visit at Bangalore. Bit congested though. I found chennai iscon temple little better than this place. Too commercialised. People are forced to visit their shops for purchasing food, book.

visit the place any day around 4 or 5 o clock ,no need to book any tickets.therer is hardly any Q.
In case u want to do puja buy the stuff and give it pujari.

Don't miss to try the food court its awesome.

After darshan u can sit in front of mandir and relax for hours
Nice n peacefull place to visit. One the must to see when you are in Bangalore. The spirituality is in the air of this place.

Worth the visit while @ Bangalore. Metro connectivity is closeby so helps get over the nightmare of traffic in the city.

It was great experience with the temple at a height and going through process to enter this temple. Overall it was calm and quite and feel good factor within the premises. Good place to visit if you are one of those who are from north India and looking for a temple as a close match to your expectations.
If you are a Krishna devotee this temple is a must visit. This place is nice and calm and pretty big. Deities in this temple are also unique compared to other temples.

There were a long cue to get in. The temple was nice. All the commerce on the way out - well...
The thing you should not miss (according to me) is the restaurant "Higher Taste". You don't have to go into the temple to enjoy the restaurant.
Remember not to wear shorts or you will have to hire a lungisheet from them (30rs+500rs dep).
Good to visit once if you are in Bangalore for longer duration. Very nice ambience and filled with visitors during weekend/s. All can visit, Couples, Family with young n teen and with friends too.
this temple is very excellent condition with good place to visiting place Also and many visitors to visit this place and big temple also
Most peacfukk and satisfying atmosphere and wonderfull kirtans and bhajans. Must place to visit if you are in Bengaluru

We spent three nights at ISKCON temple guest house and it was great visiting the temple for the evening aarthi. We were treated to simple breakfast, lunch and dinner that just served our purpose. No wastage of time in choosing food and catered to our need perfectly.

A calm and peaceful place to spend time. The place gives good vibes thanks to Hare Krishna music. Good place to visit in groups or with family. Elderly may find it hard due to steps to climb. Also try out the attached restaurant, it has exquisite food.

It is so beautifully constructed temple with serenity and calmness everywhere. Proper arrangements to keep your shoes. Visit in the evening is recommended. They provide Pongal as prasadam, which is so tasty. When you come back, there are enough shops and eateries by ISCKON.

Very nice temple...awesome..clean temple
Temple opes at 4.15 pm...lot of que is there.. must visit once...try steam corn inside templr

There are many reviews of this temple and i wont get into how beautiful the temple is.

My only problem is with the commercialization of the temple. There are many good things which the ISKCON foundation does. I have no doubt about that. But collecting money to get a special darshan? I found this funny. There are too many shops below the temple floor and I did not like how the temple feel was lost due to many shops being there. I would like to visit a temple for the feel of a temple and not because i would like to eat something.

The temple though is beautiful and the decoration, the ambiance inside the temple if lovely though.

We ate Break Fast, Lunch, Tiffin, Dinner for 2 days during a marriage ceremony and reception hosted in the premises.
The sincerity of the services, and genuine taste are unimaginably true.
Seeing and tasting is believing.
Being a strong non-vegetarian I could not understand how I managed to forget non-veg and remained completely satisfied with only vegetarian food.
Iskcon sri radha krishna temple is inaugrated in the year of 1997. Very generous people with no pleasure. People can easily spend around 30 to 60 minutes here..

A lot of restaurants and very good transportation options around the hotel. The staff consisting of Imad, Arvind and manager Sumoy went out of their way to make our 16 day stay a pleasant one. Thanks to them for their professionalism and all the help.
Really interesting temple where you easily spend 30-60 minutes and experience a whole range of different activities. Very generous people with no pressure.

I visited the temple early morning and ethereal experience , you need to do it to understand and enjoy.
Don't miss this

If you visit this place during morning hours it will give you a peaceful experience.
Very huge temple elegant ally decorated
The main attraction is the main hall.
The iscon is a iconic temple in Bengaluru it's connected to all major part of cities through metro ..good.

I felt It is just another temple but commercialized. Stalls are not priced much. Iskcon temples are beautiful wherever they are. A big number of stairs to climb. Heard that wheel chair lifts are available and I could see cars going upstairs directly. There are special darshan tickets, but not sure what is the use when all people can break into the special darshan queue. At the end of exit there is a restaurant and big stall which have all variety of food items.
