This is beautiful temple located in the heart of the city; Very clean and well organised; It is well managed and methodical. mainly hindus visit the temple, but we noticed tourists from other countries too.

Everything else than Hinduism; you need to walk for 30 minutes - especially when trying to get out - to go through an extreme amount of places selling "relics", books, DVD's, CD's, food etc etc. The temple itself is "ok" but there are many more beautiful smaller temples around in Bangalore, but this is nothing but a greedy money machine. Scam when worst and nothing to do with Hinduism ("Virtue entails following societal roles and performing selfless acts, but immoral acts are ones of greed and hatred.")
Best place to visit for some peace mind and fresh air with gods blessings and the view of temple is very good

What a shame they won't allow you to take photos inside the temple. The interior is amazing. So much gold! This must be a very wealthy organisation, for they are building an even bigger temple on the outskirts of Bangalore. There are lots of things to spend your money on, as you leave, but sadly no images of the interior of the temple.
Mind fresh and blessed and very gud place for old age guys and enjoy able place to .i usually visit it

Very nice temple and not to be missed. Visited at the time of arthi and not much crowded during week days. Very well maintained and clean. Good food served as annadhanam and not to be missed. Also sell variety of food and quite cheap price. Overall good experience.
Recently visited Iskcon Bengaluru, overall very nice experience. Just like any other Iskcon, it is peaceful and well maintained.
One of the best temples I have visited ever and a must visit spot to anyone who visits to Bangalore. Like the way the outside areas are designed to control the flow of crowd

Friday morning 17th November and we visited this sacred Temple which stands majestically among the tower blocks and new skyscrapers of Bangalore.

Sorry there are no photographs to show the grandeur and magnificence of the Temple, photography is not permitted, so only photos of the grand entrance.

Once through security checks we proceeded to the ticket office where there was a variety of ticket prices, which was determined by what parts of the Temple visited. Our ticket was 300 Rupees, the option with the least access but was for up to 6 people.

There is a strict dress code here, it is not permitted to wear shorts, however we were able to hire a Dhoti, a length of fabric tied around the waist and coved the legs. We each had to pay a 500 Rupees deposit and 20 RS laundry costs.

We also had to remove our shoes and leave them in the storage area there was a charge of 2 RS for each pair of shoes, which we collected when exiting the Temple.

We followed the signs and started climbing up the steps, we soon arrived and the first small Temple and Shrine. We continued upwards to the next slightly larger and a bit grander and ornate Temple. The third Temple at the top of the stairway was incredible, it was so ornate and colourful, stunning, unable to adequately describe this holy place. We mingled with other visitors and worshippers 

Before standing in front of the main shrine, our hands were washed by a Monk, then laid on sacred flowers and were blessed these were presented later before the Grand Master. After our visit to the Shrine we were presented with a bag of Prasadam food, this is food that is eaten after prayer. 

We were also presented with a gift of a book and literature about Hare Krishna.

The exit route took us through a large area that was dedicated to the sale of religious items and souvenirs.
Must visit place for people of all background to make you understand the diversity of this nation...

Fabulous Temple.
ISCKON krishna Temple is the best krishna Temple I ‚Äòve ever visited.
Very clean , disciplined and spiritual.
We have visitied iskcon temple few months back. This is one of the most peaceful place is Bangalore.

Sri Radha Krishna Temple ( Kannada - ‡≤∂‡≥ç‡≤∞‡≥Ä ‡≤∞‡≤æ‡≤ß‡≤æ ‡≤ï‡≥É‡≤∑‡≥ç‡≤£ ‡≤Æ‡≤Ç‡≤¶‡≤ø‡≤∞ ) has deities of Radha and Krishna located at Rajajinagar, in North Bangalore, Karnataka, India. It is one of the largest ISKCON ritvik temples in the world.[3] The temple is a huge cultural complex that was inaugurated in 1997 by Shankar Dayal Sharma. The project was conceived and executed by Madhu Pandit Dasa.
Around 1976, devotees from different parts of India and the world had initiated activities of ISKCON in different parts of South India like Bangalore, Hubli, Madras, etc. Sankirtans in the streets, enrolling Life Members, arranging programs in the houses, and arranging large public programs in pandals were being conducted. The society was registered in the year 1978 under the Karnataka Societies Registration Act, 1960. The objects of the society are derived from the Seven Purposes of ISKCON as stated by Srila Prabhupada. In May 1997, Bangalore ISKCON Temple was inaugurated by the ninth president of India - Shankar Dayal Sharma.[2]

Features of the temple Edit
There is a gold-plated dhwaja-stambha (flag post) 17 m (56 ft) high and a gold plated kalash shikara 8.5 m (28 ft) high. There is free distribution of Sri Krishna prasadam to all visitors during the darshana hours.[4]

Shrines (altars) Edit
ISKCON Bangalore has six shrines:

Main shrine is of Radha-Krishna.
Krishna Balrama.
Nitai Gauranga (Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and Nityananda).
Srinivasa Govinda ( also known as Venkateswara ).
Prahlada Narasimha.
Srila Prabhupada.[5]

This temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna. Modern architecture style with glass facde and has in-house snacks, sweets outlet. Nice flower decoration of God's idol and the Morning aarti (prayers) are really worth a visit.

Visited the Hare Krishna temple during my time in Bangalore. The chanting music throughout the temple was uplifting. When we got to the main temple, we were greeted by one of the priests who asked us our names and added us to his prayers. He then gave us a blessed flower, a bag of sweets and a book on yoga.
En route out you can get a rice dinner if you're hungry at no cost.
There's an abundance of gift shops and cake stalls on the way out too. ISKON was a very different temple experience which I really enjoyed.

The ISKCON temple in Bangalore is dedicated to Lord Krishna and is one of the largest in the world. The idols of Radha and Krishna as well as the floral decoration is outstanding. ISKCON manages many charitable activities including Akshaya Patra which feeds 1.3 million children across India.
I have visited many ISKCON temple in India. I am highly influenced by the people staying there. The interior of this temple was amazing. I forgot all my worries here. Great place to go.

One of the biggest ISKCON temple I have visited so far. It's all divine feeling. Ample parking space is available. There are darshan tickets available which are actually SEWA tickets. For those SEWA tickets, you get some special darshan where you can spend some time to see God from close distance. Each ticket has some prasad which is given after darshan. There are many stalls for books, religious items, photos, and clothes. If you are hungry, there are multiple stalls for food items like, samosa, chat, dhokla, lemon rice, fried rice, gulab jamun, rasgulla, juices, and many more. I keep visiting this temple, and if you ever come to Bangalore, please must visit this temple and receive grace of Lord Krishna.
ISKCON Temple is a beautiful temple in Bangalore.The temple has some activities in special days like vaikunta ekadashi etc.The temple has magnificent architectural style.
The visit to this temple was awesome.the temple is in light blue colour.not much crowded.electronic gadgets are not allowed into the temple.

Fabulous Temple.
ISCKON krishna Temple is the best krishna Temple I ‚Äòve ever visited.
Very clean , disciplined and spiritual.
We have visitied iskcon temple few months back. This is one of the most peaceful place is Bangalore.

ISKCON Temple is a beautiful temple in Bangalore.The temple has some activities in special days like vaikunta ekadashi etc.The temple has magnificent architectural style.
The visit to this temple was awesome.the temple is in light blue colour.not much crowded.electronic gadgets are not allowed into the temple.

We visited this temple during the Diwali vacations. ISKCON is truly a divine and spiritual place. This place gives one a peace of mind. After taking the darshana of deity, Prasad in the form of "Khichadi" is served to every devotee. If you don't wish to eat it using hands, then suggest to carry spoons with you. The mahaprasad (full fledged meal) is served in their dining area. Both Khichladi as well as Mahaprasad are really tasty. The buttermilk is served directly in the plate at the end of Mahaprasad. They don't serve it in the glass. So one may carry his/her own glass.
Overall a must visit place in Bengaluru.
Iskon Temple is a must visit place for Hindu followers of Lord Krishna - where one would be lost in devotion of God .
Nice and beautiful Place, Perfect place for having a calm and mind refreshing place, If you are devotional and really are interested in Indian Culture the you must visit
wonderful experience. the khichdi as prasad available while returning back stepping down the stairs was really awesome.

really wonderful experience.
the khichdi as prasad available while returning back stepping down the stairs was really awesome.
the big size laddus and the library too really good.

best among all is the time you can spend during the prayers and watching the krishna devotees sings and dance.
really a great feeling

The temple infrastructure is breathtaking, calm, serene and you get awesome peace of mind. The temple is located very close to Orion mall and you can simply connect with your inner being or head out to the sweets corner serving unlimited varieties of food. You can also shop for some lovely frames, calendars, clothes and many other things available there. A must visit for all.
From chanting the holy name to buying Krishna books to having Sattvic food, Its a good outing for young and old alike. Evening artis and courses help one get in a journey of self discovery

ISKCON is the HQ of the Hindu religion in Bangalore. There are a few branches in the world. Visitors are welcome to visit but they expect foreigners to chant walking up the temple. It sounds ridiculous. They also have vegetarian restaurant, food, books they sell there. No shoes, camera allowed and it is better to leave your shoes in the car. Too many pickpockets or someone stealing your shoes. It is better to go during the weekday to avoid the crowd.

Very well organised place. A treat to watch and go through the entire temple premises. The prasadam is very good. The food court or the restaurant inside serves delicious food. Great cafeteria. Books collection is great.
Lastly, the temple where deity resides is mesmerising. It offers a place to meditate

The temple had three stages of three different vishnu avatar. located near metro station for easy commuting to city. Night times the temple looks really fantastic. Avoid riding festival times as this will be more crowded.
its a beautiful and wonderful place to worship a god and we will get peace of mind .but all things are very costly to buy.

peaceful
pristine
prayers
you bring them .
extraordinary fantabulous temple.

temples in the south speaks volumes call it a stone rock or the biggest book of temples. I fell in love with radhakrishna again

This place is full of calmness, beautifully designed Radhe-Krishna temple.
Must visit for all the devotees.
It's very organised temple with all the routes and parking in place, there are so many staffs working day and night over here like guards, pujaris etc.. this place also has food counters which serves different indian cusinies like dahi vada, samosa, many types of sweets, lassi etc in the premises. Also has restrooms and small stores which sale devotional books, statues and many other items. It has a very large campus with thousands of pilgrims visiting each day..this place is especially decorated with all possible flowers during Krishna Jamashtmi.
A great place for tourist to visit. We will recommend ot to our friends and relatives. The place was relatively clean and had easy access parking and toilet facitiez
The famous ISKCON temple of bangalore. Good connectivity, thanks to Metro. Thronged by deities round the season.

I visited ISKCON temple Bengaluru on 29th of last month with my family.

The experience was awesome. The temple is maintained in top notch condition. All amenities for pilgrims are amazing.

The main prayer hall with its tall domed ceiling and ice cool marble floor give the place a surreal feel even if the place is crowded with pilgrims.

The temple kitchen prepares a huge variety of vegetarian delicacies which are a treat to eat.

Amazing temple... a must visit if you are in Bengaluru

Can get very crowded during holidays, especially during a religious holiday. There are a lot of steps to reach the top. Although you can take your car/cab almost to the top and can take a lift to the main temple. They also can provide wheel chair to people who are unable to walk.

Krishna bhakts would love this place. Krishna in all his roles look amazing. There is an area where you can sit in the main temple.
If you're looking for a divine place to be with great idols and ambient atmosphere to pray and get preached. This is the best place

Its a beautiful and superb temple of lord Krishna. very peaceful. Little extra rush on weekends. Huge campus and well maintained. Even food court is quite good and welll managed. Must visit for people, who loves to go temple.

Beautiful place, clean and tidy is the first thing that hits you. The alankar or adorning of the God's Idols are done very beautifully. Also feels very relaxing and soothing when you get there especially in the evenings with the cool breeze blowing across. You can also get very delicious vegetarian food.

Also feels very relaxing and soothing when you get there especially in the evenings with the cool breeze blowing across. You can also get very delicious vegetarian food.
This temple is not a run of mill kind of temple. Its a beautiful place, very different from our regular temples, peaceful and a good place to mediate to find your inner soul.
Its a beautiful and superb temple of lord Krishna. very peaceful. Heavy rush on weekends. huge campus. hygienic and well maintained food court. Should visit.

Unlike most ISKON temples,this one is bigger. Plenty of space for spiritual aspects and also spiritual artefacts.Prasadam is almost a wholesome meal and wonderful to see whole lot of children being encouraged to eat here.

Really a very divine and spiritual experience!! Temple is built beautifully, a wonderful place to worship Lord Krishna!! Reciting of bhajans makes the atmosphere very peaceful!! Must attend their evening Aarti!!
Gauranga!!
Hare Krishna!!
Extremely lavish, huge, peaceful. This place is dedicated to Lord Krishna. The iskcon committee manages this temple and have commercialized the temple premises with food and souvenirs to buy.

While ISKCON has a nice high vantage point from which to look over the city and some attractive features, it didn't strike me as a particularly spiritual place. It felt more like a mall. In part, that's because after you walk through the glitzy worship area you then move through countless places where the focus is on selling food, books, cheap plastic toys, and other merchandise. I struggled to understand how this was a place where people were taught and encouraged to let go of ego attachments or experience anything more divine than money being captured in multitudinous ways.
Excellent place to spend some time with your family. Well located with good scenic beauty. The chant of "Hare Rama Hare Krishna" gives a soothing, peaceful feeling. Must visit.....
extremely well maintained , beautiful architecture ..super prasadam , great view ..very serene and meaningful visit

ISKCON is always a good place to find peace and connect to a higher power. This location in Bangalore is no exception. It is situated a little out of the main city of Bangalore but is well connected with the Kempagowda bus stop. The place has different levels and you need to walk through some stairs to reach the final mandap. There are convenient racks and staffs to coordinate for leaving your slippers before entering. Photography is not permitted. The food stall of the temple is amazing. After food for your soul you can treat your body too.
There is a big mall at walking distance from the temple. After the darshan, shopping is an option.

The only tourist place I got time to visit in Bangalore. Its a beautiful temple. Very well organised and maintained. Maybe a bit too commercialised. But a good experience nevertheless. But the beauty of the place makes up for it.

A must visit place and also only a 1 time visit for a regular non religious guy. a Great place for a Krishna worshiper.

This vast Hare Krishna Temple was a complete eye opener for a novice like me.

I'm guessing I went during 'low season' judging by the impressive organisational infrastructure set up around it (taking shoes, taking bags) - to have gone when the place was packed would have been a very different experience.

After de-shoeing I followed the prescribed route upwards towards the temple and inadvertently found myself joining a snake of people chanting 108 Hare Krishnas. I say inadvertently, I think perhaps there was a way to get in without this, but I didn't see it, and I was glad to have done it - without question this was the most 'stick out like a sore thumb' I've ever been in my entire life.

The main temple is vast and peaceful, with live music playing. There was an unexpected book sale going on in the corner (I picked up the Hare Krishna Book of Vegetarian Cooking for 330 rupees - it looks promising) and some fairly helpful information boards about Srila Prabhupada, the founder of 108 Krishna temples worldwide.

Departing the temple takes way longer as you make your way past many, many stalls selling anything and everything Krishna-related.

The final step is being given a delicious bowl of lentils and rice 'Khichdi prasƒÅda'. The bowl was made of a dried leaf and the food just gorgeous.

I got there by the Metro (Mahalakshmi Station) - it's a 10 minute walk along a fairly busy road.

Wonderful place to spend some spiritual time with your family. the chants of Hare Krishna will give you great peace of mind.
The place is well maintained and will be a very good place to visit with your family when you are visiting Bengaluru.

We visited the temple on Saturday Morning around 10. I think it was the perfect time. It's our first visit. The temple is so clean. Well architectures. Calm and we'll Maintained atmosphere Given us a pleasent feeling. There are stalls inside for buying books, photos etc.. Nice place to visit. People with belief on lord Krishna will enjoy bit more. Worth to mention about the "prasadam"... It's simply fantastic.

It was interesting to follow the crowd to say the chants at each step before going to the main hall, yet the temple itself had lots of regulations, and if you want to walk closer to the Krishna statue, you need to pay extra. On your way to the exit, there are lots of shops, including food stalls, which make the place quite commercialized and like a market. Photo is strictly prohibited in the premise and the guard may ask you put cameras back in your car when they saw it.
It is an interesting experience, but it isn't a must if your schedule is packed.

ISKON is a place where one experiences peace of mind. If you just sit in the temple, you will experience Shanti. Excellent atmosphere to meditate and chant Hare Rama Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Hare Rama.
Attending morning pooja at 7am is a great experience. The decoration, the ambiance, the people chanting Hare Krishna mantra and the dance by the disciples all takes you to a different world.

Beautiful place for early morning prayers and late evening Aarti and ritual dances where monks and general public indulge in the celebration. Weekends are fairly busy so expect long queues and short darshan times. Good satvik restaurant attached to the temple
This is a place for children with a lot to discover and holy place for elders.Children enjoyed the cake Prasadam there,of course eggless.

The is a must visit place for Krishna devotees. Place is easy reachable by Metro, Buses or by car. There is ample space for parking inside the temple premises. Apart from being a devotional place, this can be a good weekend outing place. There is a restaurant inside which serves varieties of food. If you need to have a quick grab, again lots of snacks available. For kids there is Krishna movie being screened. Its a wholesome entertainment place apart from being a temple.
this is one the best maintained systematic temples in india,never miss the evening aarthi it is really superb

Very good temple built with modern architecture. Special mention about the dieties, they look very lively and are grandly decorated. If you are looking for a spiritual and peaceful visit do avoid weekends and holidays!

This is not a place you can visit in a hurry - given Bangalore's infamous traffic , one needs to set aside half a day for this trip . And then there is the queue, the mandatory chanting and the beautiful aarathi to experience . The dieties are divinely decorated, prasadam is excellent and there are a plethora of book stalls and food kiosks .Within the temple complex, there is a good vegetarian restaurant called Higher Taste - well worth a visit if you have worked up an appetite - over 50 dishes served buffet style . Make sure you remember where you deposit your footwear - the signages are a bit confusing , we had to walk around a bit after the darshan to located the footwear kiosk !
I love ISKCON temples in general and this place lives up to its name. Amazing architecture and pleasant atmosphere. Must visit when you are in Bangalore.

ISKCON Temple is situated on top of an hill, called Hare Krishna Hill. With its nicely sculptured GOPURAMs decorating its roof and main temple structure, the temple looks very much ornamental and gorgeous. Not only that, as I mentioned earlier since it is on hill top, the Temple Complex is visible from far away distance. In fact it has become a famous landmark in the vicinity of Chord Road, Mahalaxmi Layout, Rajajinagar and Yeshwanthpur, so to say for the whole of present day North Bangalore ISKCON Temple is an awesome landmark. The approach to the temple, parking facility are well taken care. One can visit the temple leisurely without much hassles. All types of public transportation are available to this place, viz: BMTC buses, Metro train. While traveling in METRO, one has to get down at Mahalaxmi station and the temple is at walk able distance. When you chart out a program to visit this place, please allot minimum half a day, if you are visiting from a nearby place,otherwise, it will become a full day program. Your are visiting this temple not only for devotion, there are are other attractions like amphitheater, shopping, vegetarian restaurants run by temple committee, here food is available at subsidized rates in good ambience, marriage halls are also there. It is a well managed LORD KRISHNA TEMPLE run by internationally acclaimed ISKCON. When you are in BENGALURU a must to visit place.

Mysore Soap factory is the metro rail station to get off to visit this temple. You will still need to walk some one-third kilometer to visit the temple. Remember you will need to walk some hundred steps from the roadside to climb up the temple for darshan. It is better for you to drive up the hill and park for a fee and then walk into the temple,especially if you are elderly or sick. The temple offers food in two restaurants. One is much less expensive in the middle of the temple complex offered as PRASAD. The other is, of course, another vegetarian restaurant of 3 Star category located on top of the hill. Both are good places to eat!

People who has minimum of 1 to 2 hours time has to visit this place, temple is good but after darshan, it is full commercial. You have to go through all the shops eventhough you dont like, there is no exit immediately after the darshan.

This place is inside the city. You can visit for any longer and any time of the day.

Now, this place is connected by metro. So, no hassle of driving to this place at busy Bangalore traffic.

I was driving to this place earlier. Recently during my last trip with family (a month ago), I went by Metro. I live at Bannerghatta road. So, I wanted to try the metro. Went to Yelachenahalli‚Ä† stop and took metro.

You can get down at "Mahalakshmi: stop. 10 minutes walk from this station.

A good part of the temple is ambience, spectacular look and beauty of Krishna. There are an amphitheatre and several attractions.You can have nice food. You have several options, as 30 to 40 varieties of food available.

So, plan for at least 3 to 5 hours with family.

Happy trip to Krishna Conciousness.
Not a place to worship only but an institution that inculcates service for the lord and the humble devotees

Right place to worship god. Calm environment. Hygienic and highly tasteful prasadam.
very well managed temple.

Must visit place for Lord Sri Krishna devotees in Bangalore. Superb architecture. Besides, Krishna temple, temple of Lord Venkateswara is also worth visiting and worshiping in the same complex. Very centrally located. Well connected with public transport including Metro service.. Very well maintained. No hassles. Krishna jayanty performed on large scale. Large crowd at that time visit the temple. Hare Krishna volunteers taking good care of the temple.Attahed with good restaurant. Their work of Akhayapatra feeding the school children is commendable an deserves support from every one for this noble social cause.

The temple is right besides Orion Mall and can be reached easily by metro. The place is really beautiful with fountain and lighting at the night. The place generally gets quite crowded on the weekends. Once inside, one can find a lot of stalls selling things like prasad, souvenirs etc. which makes it sort of a flea market/shopping mall. This is the only thing I do not like about the place. One goes to the temple to be at peace and experience the quaint atmosphere but it was nowhere to be found at ISKCON temple.
Very nice place for family and friends for the best architectural design and devotional experience in this place

One of the best iskcon temple ever i visited in india. Spread in a large area. Beautifully structured . Nice location. Near to a shopping mall . And connected to other prime areas . If you are going to bangalore once you must visit to feel spirituality.
very beautiful architecture and peaceful place if not visiting on weekends or on festival days...must visit if in Bangalore.
Amazing place....The chant of Govinda Govinda lets you forget everything in the world. Get so much peace every time I visit this place

If you really like aesthetically beautiful temples and different from what you are used to see over the years, or have the perceptions about Hindu temples, then this temple will change them. This is a modern, very different, very well designed & beautiful, clean and well organized (much better than the ancient temples). Barring the ISCKON's constant pursue of buying things, memberships of the society rest all are perfectly placed for a divine and holy place

Beautiful architecture very busy
Try not to go weekends - use the website to determine times of worship. Helpful devotees will assist.

Isckon temple is a temple built for devotion of Lord Krishna and has been built much recently compared to other conventional temples which were built centuries ago. It is a big temple with a very good maintenance and cleanliness. It is situated at a hill. So, people with knee problems and health issues may be prepared for it. It has a pond beside it which is a beautiful sight to watch. The chants of "Hare Krishna" brings peace to your mind. The temple is not that crowded as I expected it to be. The only thing I feel a bit off was that after darshan, they make you go through a plethora of shops which you may be uninterested in. I would expect a direct and short exit. Other than that, I would recommend that this is a must visit place in Bangalore irrespective of religion. Watch out for paintings on top of the wall inside temple.

It is the main Hindu temple in Honolulu. Pooja starts very early in the morning. It is a delight to watch. You will get a healthy and tasty vegetarian food as prasadam. I had breakfast. U can volunteer in kitchen to make food and/or join them for chanting and reading. There is a small library of Srila Prabhupada's collection of books. U can read or just walk around the temple. It is a divine experience. The priest of the temple called Sundar was very kind and I really appreciate his hospitality. Buses are available and there is ample parking space too.

It is the modern time's temple where you find most of the foreign tourists. The main deity here is Lord Krishna. They preach the teaching of Lord Krishna at Internation level.
ISKON is always one of the best temple good place to sit and relax, reading books and best part be a part of aarti which is kind of unique.

Respecting the Divine part and sharing the experience of being devotee only.
LOCATION: Its situated at one of the suburbs of Bangalore. Though now extremely well connected by means of METRO. Self driven may have challenges in getting parking inside during evenings of holidays.

TEMPLE: Like most ISKON, Circulation within the temple is absolutely controlled. There are many activities roped in before and after the "Darshan of Divine". Before the "Darshan" one is supposed to go through series of small shrines and serpentine ques as per the crowd. Based on one's frame of mind, one may think this as forced imposition or a preparation time to calm down before meeting the Divine. One can sit sometime in the big hall after darshan. The way out has many events like laddo and other sweet prasadm counter, intellectual discussions with one of the sadhus, audio visual show of about 10-15 minits, bazaar of ISKON merchandise (and this is well stocked), Elaborate (paid) food counters. At the end of exit trail, there is one casual (paid) dining area serving good veg food. Before the disbursement, however, all alike are given "prashadam" (mostly a khichadi kind of preparation). No one leaves ISKON empty stomach.

SPECIAL NOTE: Peace seekers shall look for non festival days. On working days and in morning hours the energy and peace in front of Divine is one experience of life. wear shoes which are easily removed and worn. Avoid carrying much and even bigger purses. Respect the security personnel as they are doing their important job. Keep the whole of half day.

The processes are so very organized and maintenance is very good in this temple. Spotlessly clean temple is located close to Yeshwantpur station. It's a white beautifully designed structure. Visit in morning or evening to be part of bhajans and aarti.
nice religious place to explore.It is one of the top most isckon temple in India.Its situated on a rock.You can feel the callm ness and nice architecture of temple.
ISKCON Temple in Hare Krishna Hill, Bangalore is one of the must visiting places that should be placed in every traveler's list.

Hi Reader, If you have not gone to Iscon temple, then you have wasted your time in Bangalore. This is a place for peaceful people, who like internal peace like peaceful mind. This place is a sureshot to go. I come here once in a month. To have a peaceful mind.
ISKCON temple is crowded with tourists and their guides. I don't know why guides always bring tourist straight here. Anyway the temple is very clean and beautifully built

Visited Isckon Temple In Bangalore. Its very beautiful, silent, hygienic and popular temple. Parking space available, Nicely built. Proper arrangements of drinking water and restrooms inside the temple. Guidance to visit the temple nicely so you will not miss any part of the temple. Food shops and restaurant are there, We spend long time enjoyed place.

Very clean..
Decor is NICE and very well maintained..
U feel serene in this place..
Overall a n8ce place to visit..
It is the modern time's temple where you find most of the foreign tourists. The main deity here is Lord Krishna. They preach the teaching of Lord Krishna at Internation level.
ISKON is always one of the best temple good place to sit and relax, reading books and best part be a part of aarti which is kind of unique.

Respecting the Divine part and sharing the experience of being devotee only.
LOCATION: Its situated at one of the suburbs of Bangalore. Though now extremely well connected by means of METRO. Self driven may have challenges in getting parking inside during evenings of holidays.

TEMPLE: Like most ISKON, Circulation within the temple is absolutely controlled. There are many activities roped in before and after the "Darshan of Divine". Before the "Darshan" one is supposed to go through series of small shrines and serpentine ques as per the crowd. Based on one's frame of mind, one may think this as forced imposition or a preparation time to calm down before meeting the Divine. One can sit sometime in the big hall after darshan. The way out has many events like laddo and other sweet prasadm counter, intellectual discussions with one of the sadhus, audio visual show of about 10-15 minits, bazaar of ISKON merchandise (and this is well stocked), Elaborate (paid) food counters. At the end of exit trail, there is one casual (paid) dining area serving good veg food. Before the disbursement, however, all alike are given "prashadam" (mostly a khichadi kind of preparation). No one leaves ISKON empty stomach.

SPECIAL NOTE: Peace seekers shall look for non festival days. On working days and in morning hours the energy and peace in front of Divine is one experience of life. wear shoes which are easily removed and worn. Avoid carrying much and even bigger purses. Respect the security personnel as they are doing their important job. Keep the whole of half day.

The processes are so very organized and maintenance is very good in this temple. Spotlessly clean temple is located close to Yeshwantpur station. It's a white beautifully designed structure. Visit in morning or evening to be part of bhajans and aarti.
nice religious place to explore.It is one of the top most isckon temple in India.Its situated on a rock.You can feel the callm ness and nice architecture of temple.
ISKCON Temple in Hare Krishna Hill, Bangalore is one of the must visiting places that should be placed in every traveler's list.

A must visit place on bangalore tour itneary. Cool and calm place for divine blessing. Have to be traditional wears and good north indian eateries available in campus

we went to the temple on the day of diwali, and it was awesome, with lights and pooja going on inside the temple, it was too busy and parking was difficult. but if you are in bangalore its a must visit place
The temple has multiple levels at which different idols are placed. The atmosphere is very serene and attendance at the morning aarti is highly recommended as a very satisfying experience.

ISKCON is one of the world famous, well organized and maintained temple.
The complete temple building is very very clean.

There is a lot of space available for Parking vehicles.
There are counters to deposit belongings (Bags, Shoes etc etc)
Cameras are not allowed, mobile phones are allowed inside.

There are some steps to climb before reaching the main temple.
On the way, you will be visiting 2 more temples.

The main temple has 3 idols of Lord Sri Krishna.
There is space to sit and seek the blessings.

Once you exit the main temple, you will be passing through some shopping outlets (Toys,Clothes,Idols,Food etc etc)

Must Must Visit place.
A place where people can take their parents to in Bangalore city, it is nice, peace. You can people from all around the country.
It is a good temple to have Bhagwan Shri Krishna Darshan. If we reach at meal time, we get full meal otherwise prasad is served always. Car parking can be a bit tedious.
The place without doubt is well built and well maintained. But the thing is, we don't get so much of a temple feeling. Its more of a commercialized place.

Built in 1997 this complex is a major landmark in Bengaluru. The architecture is contemporary ( glass for natural light etc...) . Since it is on a hill , one has to do quite a bit of climbing up and down. Special Darshan costs Rs.300 onwards. One passes through smaller temples before reaching the Radha Krishna temple on the summit. The main temple hall has a glorious tall ceiling. Diety idols are all in pristine white marble . After the Darshan you proceed through various stalls (books, artefacts,snacksetc..). A full fledged restaurant is inside the complex. The Vedic coffee is a must have here.

Iakon temples everywhere are having very nice interior and sculptures.. they have money and it's been seen there.. otherwise as spiritual point of veiw everyone has their own opinions.. in my opinion I couldn't find any mental peace there.. food served there as prasaad is good but the food available in cafeteria is of low quality.. we had very bad experience. I have visited Bombay iskon also.. food there is just awsm.. here that quality is not there

HARE KRISHNA.
travelling peoples who comes from various states or countries to see Bangalore Must Visit this temple Hare Krishna Hill Isckon because it is a huge temple it is constructed above the hill where you can view the beautiful view from the top & as soon as you enter the main temple of krishna You feel blessed.

I visit this sanctuary frequently and I generally feel the otherworldly holding with this place. It is a staggeringly otherworldly place and to witness the religious exercises is genuinely divine. I have confidence in contemplation and at whatever point I feel discouraged or on edge. I visit Iskcon Temple and ruminate here. The inclination is unearthly and can't be communicated in words. What is extraordinary about this place is that you don't need to be a Hindu or fan of Krishna to experience such otherworldly bliss. There is additionally a pleasant eatery which serves exceptionally top notch sustenance. You can have great verity of veggie lover nourishment served at this eatery keep running by them.
Been many times to ISKCON, best place to get peace mind & nice place for variety of snacks :) deserts are more in option after nice divine.
Must visit place for tourists peaceful, eye catchy and good place to spend time at the spiritual place like Iskcon.

Fed up with city traffic of Bangalore, Iskcon temple have heart peace you looking for.
Connectivity with public and private transportation is good. There are lots of market shops and eatries around.

One of the most popular tourist attractions in Bangalore. Visiting the temple will fill with divinity. The temple is well maintained and clean. You may find a few bits of commercialization here and there, but it is negligible considering the maintenance and service.
It is one of the 3 Iskcon temples in bengalure.Nice place to visit on weekend. People will feel something new having lot of refreshment. surroundings around the temple feels good.

Its an excellent place in Bangalore. Though the place looks commercial but lord Krishna's beautiful attire will make you feel like staying there itself. Every evening special pooja will be performed to the lord and that will be an excellent thing, must watch once in life time awesome pooja then awesome dance by the people. Anybody can join for the dance and the bhajans also.

Temple is awesome if you are interested in praying all the possible Hindu GODS n GODDESSES. Although it has been commercialized but still if faith has power,we can practice Pooja anywhere. The temple is well maintained n clean. The placement is key factor. A must visit place in Bangalore. On Namah Shivaye...

Iskcon temple is a landmark in Bangalore. Must visit place when you are in Bangalore. You must visit the temple to experience the sanctity and architecture of the temple. Kids will enjoy the Prasadam. ISKCON do lot of services to the society, you can learn about it by contacting one of the Iskcon representatives.

Except for the diety and the ambience surrounding Lord Shri Krishna, the place feels more like a shopping mall towards the exit, with all sort of religious books and snacks and savouries that are being sold.
Visit for a Darshan and pay your respects to the life and times of Lord Shri Krishna. If possible, enjoy some mouth-watering snacks post your Darshan. Do remember to click photographs near the exit with the temple in the backdrop.
Also, you can deposit your bags, belongings and shoes near the deposit counter at a nominal fee.
Beautiful Temple especially during night time. I love Prasad of this place. Once you enter the place one tends to forget everything. Better to visit weekdays to avoid rush.
i went there with my grand parents. its excellent feeling being there. No forcing of donating money.

I've been to this place with my family it was great time spent in temple in very peaceful atmosphere and the temple maintenance is very good.

Your mind will refreshed once you visited this temple. Its out of my own experience i saying this you have to visit this place atleast once.

End of the temple you will get great prasadam which will make your stomach full but it looks very small and that prasadam is too tasty yummy

Spiritual place.
Very big premises and beautiful temple for lord Krishna,very well managed huge parking and it had all the arrangements for Prasadam and other pooja activities. This has very nice restaurant also which serves multicusine satvik good. It is connected to all the places with all transport medium like metro, bus.
It is one of the main attraction point in Bangalore. It is also a famous hindu holy place within Karnataka. A must visit place....
Its one of the Best Krishna temple in the heart of the city and best divine place and very near to Metro and Orion mall.
ISKCON TEMPLE is a good place to see the great Lord Shree Krishna with gold statue. It have traditional music and dance at evening.

.. Radha Krishna Temple
.. Calm & Serene Atmosphere
.. Includes highly decorated Balaji (Venkateswara Temple) also
.. Architecturally very beautiful Art piece
.. Free Prasadam after poojas
.. Free Lunch - fresh, hygienic, Hot and very tasty food
.. They also cater to many poor and schools (Anna Daana)
.. Overall EXCELLENT
Beautifully built from outside and inside as well. Calm and peaceful. can buy lots of toys, t-shirts and spiritual books and items, location is very good.
Its heaven on earth, I visited this temple 2 times, very nice architecture. Here worship the Sri Radha Krishn. If you plan to visit temples in Bangalore visit this temple once.
Feels more like a mall than a temple. But it's still worth the visit in Bangalore. Some of the charities they do are really interesting.
The temple is constructed in steps and stages with various deities, hence it climbs to a nice summit at the top to have Darshan of Lord Krishna

There are several levels until you reach the top where there is a large gold sculpture which is very impressive. No bare shoulders or legs are allowed and you have to take your shoes off. Cloth can be provided (at a cost) to cover bare legs if in shorts!

Area wise it's very huge. Arrangements are good for tourists' belongings . Bags are not allowed to carry in the temple . Only very small bags are allowed after security check. It's good . Photography not allowed inside the temple. From outside it's okay. Main hall is very small .
There is restaurant, tourists can have snacks, sweets etc. A very big part of the temple is used for business purpose . Books in different languages related to Lord Krishna n gift items are easily available but little expensive .
It's good to visit the place if you go there .
Awsome place to visit in early morning, parking space available and every thing is well planned.u can have breakfast over there only.there after u can visit nearby malls.

The ISKCON group has there followers and haters. But one must admire the organization for their effort in spreading Hindu tradition at such great level. Bangalore ISKCON temple is well mentained beautiful complex. There is reasonably priced shops within temple complex which have variety of items for sale with the temple's brand. There is no compulsion on any purchase. You can visit with family and have peace of mind for free. If God doesnt bring it shopping may do...
Very nice temple. Nice to see it. Must watch temple. Enjoy your weekend and look for sweets and prasada also good.
Very beautiful place. Everyone should visit this place at least once. Everyone can find peace here.There is even a place to sit just before the Murthy of Lord Krishna.

It's purely business. But the temple inside the painting of Krishna is awesome. which will mesmerize you. And for the people who are interested in holy books, It good to check and buy them. If your first time in Bangalore, Its good to visit once for the painting and books. People will try to get into that group. That's left up to you whether you want to be or not.

Very pleasant place in Bangalore,
Very very clean and silent.
Don't miss prasadam and eggless cakes.

Very pleasant place in Bangalore,
Very very clean and silent.
Don't miss prasadam and eggless cakes.

One of the must see place in Bangalore, for the spiritual side as well for the charity side of it. Note the money you pay for special visit is going for charity and for feeding the needy kids. So a place to feel positive for all.
we had rains here, good for evening view but full of commercialization, the parking is chargable and costly
Beautiful, Peace and relax place in Bangalore. A very nice management and well mannered. Very easy to reach with Metro

The best temple in bangalore and is a tourist attraction on weekends and holidays.
The premises are well maintained and they also do charity work by providing food to schools accross the city through "Akshaya Patra" scheme.

ISCON TEMPLE Bangalore is a very nice place of worship to visit in Bangalore it is nice to see the temlpe on the hill at a very high level with lots of parking space,seperate place to keep your footwear, vegetarian restaurants, Hotel Rooms if you require stay overnight.
Now you have to pass thru many small temples of different deities to reach
the main temple which is very beautiful and very fine architecture and the ceiling is worth seeing.
The Three dancing Krishna Tasha statues are very nicely decorated .
We attended a Pooja and Bhajans.
Then we went thru all the stalls in the temple and had prasadam.

We recommend everyone visiting Bangalore should visit this temple at least once.

Jagmohan Shetty

It is very good temple to visit but you can expect crowd on festival days so plan your visit accordingly. Very organised and the rituals are mesmerising.

there is no compulsion for any donation and it is voluntary basis.

Over all a nice experience with well managed visitor lines and friendly people who manage the crowd.
Nothing extra to tell about this place but for food lovers like me, this place offers some very tasty prasad.
cool and peaceful place, where lord Krishna devotes and the stories of Krishna were shown in sculptures. must visit.

Iskon Temple in Bangalore is huge and beautifully maintained. It takes around 1 hour in the premises for darshan and then visit the many shops selling Gita and decorative items and also food stalls. We had dinner in the veg restaurant within the temple premises, food is tasty though a bit expensive.

Heavy crowd and lack of enough parking place for such a huge temple is actually a bane. When the crowd was huge while planning, the authorities both sanctioning as well as temple authorities failed to provide ample car parking for the temple and hap-hazard queues and parking in toads lead to traffic snarls near the temple should be avoided.

Nice place for Lord Krishna Lovers. Neat and clean palce and nicely located in the centre of bangalore in very small hill.beautiful temple from outside as well as inside and very organized queues to manage crowds. The idols were decorated most elegantly and beautifully. they had restaurants inside the temple which is costly as well as budget
Spiritual atmosphere, chanting "hare Krishna, hare rama" and moving on was quite a different experience. Felt really relaxed after darshan. A must visit place for spiritual peace seekers.
It is one of the best religious places I have seen in my life. Specially the service that they have taken for the Mid day meal for school children
Iskcon temple visit in July and it brings divine moment of worshipping Krishna the ultimate god. The temple is pretty clean and maintained well inspite of big crowd thronging every day

The entire atmosphere at ISKON temple is wonderful and engaging. We have been visiting this temple in the first week of Jan. every year and find that this has been a good routine for us, of seeking blessings from Lord Krishna

Maintained meticulously,
Clean and hygienic place,PUJA etc can be done in an order as stipulated.
Clear cut guidance on all aspects of visit.Hygienic and very tasty food and bakery items which is egg less

The International Society for Krishna Conciousness is a contemporary building which houses the temple complex. It's a phenomenal for Spiritualism and Religious activity. There is peace of mind. Besides praying. Check on the books that are for sale. Combine the visit to the temple by also visiting the Mahalakshmi Temple and the Anjaneya Temple complex about a kilometre away. It's surely worth the time spent.

Queue, staircases to start with. Check lift option for sr citizens. If you have pure spiritual purpose, just take "darshana" of idols and exit.

It's a mini mall there to sell books, artifacts , clothes etc. Plus food counters with huge varieties....But best is to take Prasadam and exit. Go to some restaurant where you can sit peacefully and eat. Inside there is too much crowd to walk, eat, pay, order....

Idols and hall are the best part. Sit there for some time, watch the idols. Meditate if you can.

Little walk to Mahalaxmi metro station, you can also visit small Saibaba temple on same side of main road in Rajaji Nagar Ph1.
The perfect place to enjoy calm and peace. If one can listen to live kirtan as well nothing like it! The hot prasadam is something not to be missed.

If u are looking fr eternal peace ad have faith in Lord Krishna this is the place tugged away in a corner in bangleru the minute u reach the sheer beauty of the temple takes u .after climbing few stairs reach the entry point or the nirvana point u are stumped by the stone work if u look on other side u get birds eye view of the city.the cleanliness of the place ad the order maintained by devotees is admirable when u turn comes u are in front of idol of Krishna the art work the jewellery ad the Lord makes you feel blessed
Strict discipline is maintained awesome food clean loos m add to ur visit

I visited this temple couple of times and every time i am get refreshed. They maintain the temple in a very organised way. it is located on the hill and while going from bottom to top of the hill, we have to move by step by step by chanting "hare krishna hare krishna krishna krishna hare hare" . I liked this way of chanting. Inside the temple also good. It is worth to visit this temple.

Very beautiful temple from outside as well as inside and very organized queues to manage crowds. The idols were decorated most elegantly, in the usual ISKCON style. There were quite a few notices on encouraging donations of different types from the point where the queue starts till you reach inside the main temple; however, you can still go inside and pray even if you do not wish to donate. I bought a lot of useful books from the books counter though.

I personally visited Iskcon Temple quite often during my stay in Bangalore for more than a decade. When I was a student, I used to frequently visit there. Even after I got into service, I'd go to Iskcon Temple whenever I'd have the time or I'd feel upset. This place has something to boost up. Whenever I'd be dull or upset, I'd visit and feel energized. The ambiance is mind-blowing. It'd definitely change your mood and your heart and mind will fill with positive energy. I recommend all tourists and travelers to visit this place once.

I visited this place last year October again when I went to Bangalore for some personal reasons. 9I don't stay in Bangalore anymore)

A beautiful temple and abode to the Lord and his wife. One of the best Iskcon temples in the country. Very clean and well maintained. Make sure to relish the sweets and snacks on your way out of the inner sanctum. Usually gets crowded on evenings during weekends though.
This place is more of a business than considering as a temple. Starting from the entrance till the end of the so called temple premises, you can easily observe the staff there is money minded.
I visited here with my family, its very nice and well maintained and high genic, only thing is they have opened a market inside temple which I didn't like , they are working for money.
It is the great place I have visited ever. The scluptur in this Temple is very nice and I felt very happy

If you believe in God? Do you want to find peace and pray to lord Krishna, Then this is the place you must visit.
To plan a visit for ISCON temple you have to follow the timings as it opens at 7:15 AM to 1:00 PM and 4:15 to 8:15 PM.
Requires at least 1 hour, more if crowed is more.
It is very well managed and maintained. once reached at gate of the temple you have to go through security check and then you have to deposit your slippers and shoes. They charge you for the same a little as Rs 2 per pair. After depositing you can go up stairs to temple and the queue of devotee starts. As there will be continuous chanting of radhe krishna you will not feel the wait and queue you will get to first temple in no time. If you take the stairs and go little more further up you will find the main temple where Radha and Krishna statue are kept which all are made up of gold.
Pray and sit for some time in the temple passage which is huge, You can purchase sweets as prasad from there or books if you like. On exit you will get free prasad and one god picture card with mantra on it.
It's really a good place to visit.
A place where everything about Krishna can be known and the saints are very good and do a special kind of pooja and everyday prasadam will be served to every people in he afternoon

great atmosphere,
standard ambience and auspicious view
must visit and proceed for a sitting idle for 2-3 hrs
ISCKON is a must visit place. The place is very beautiful, well organised and well maintained. I really enjoyed sitting inside and listening to the bajans. Don't miss this place.
ISKON temple is located in Yeshwanthpur area. Premises are really awesome. Weekends you must wait in queue hours together to get god Krishna dharshan. Quality of food is amazing.

Place which is really well maintained with a lot of effort, it's more looks like a place of tourist visit and less spiritual feeling, on a weekend you can visit once to see the art inside the temple...

as we see these pics this temple is something special. It is actually the only ISKCON temple where they do proper worship. ISKCON Bangalore is doing substantial service by distributing 3 million midday meals for school children every day. They also distribute more books than any other ISKCON temple.

A very good temple which runs with motto on Krishna consciousness. One can feel the divine power by looking at beautifully decorated lord Krishna with loads of flowers words aren't enough to describe those moments N feelings... Soothing fragrance of incense sticks makes you feel like that you are at divine presence... Eateries are available and sacred Prasad is distributed to everyone.
It is very good and worth a visit in bangalore. We went there before janmashtami and could see the preparations in full swing.

Visit if you must. Nothing great about this temple - neither in comparison to other ISKCON temples around the world, nor in comparison to other beautiful temples in or around Bangalore. This is not to say it's not nice - it's just not very remarkable in beauty, architecture or ambience.

This is one of my favorite temples in Bangalore. One get a calm and peaceful feeling once inside the temple. But the crowd can be overwhelming at times. The temple also has a wonderful canteen and store that sell Hare Krishna T-shirts.
This temple of lord krishna is located near orion mall in the heart of the city. KSRTC buses ply freqently from majestic to ISKON temple.
Everything is good in hotel. Specially reception staff Mr. Gyan Dutta is good to me.My stay was goof here. I will prefer to dtay nrxt time in this hotel.

The ISKCON Temple is situated nearby Orion Mall and it is really beautiful and well built by architecture. As soon as you enter you will be amazed by the way the authorities manage heavy rush, darshan and beautiful Idols. People worship god, offer prayers, bhajans and sing Krishna Songs. There is small lake with fountain besides the temple where people sit and spend time. There is cafeteria at the exit of temple which have some delicious snacks to eat. One must visit this place in evening if you visit Bangalore.
The temple is very beautifully designed in a very large area. Bus are also available from Majestic to Iskon.
A must-visit for anyone looking to add something spiritual to their Bangalore itinerary. They provide free Yoga classes as well.

Actually I was gone there for my company meeting,nearby there is a international hotel where I wanted to go, but there is a bustop near ISKON temple that is the first time I have seen ISKON,unknowingly I gone Inside the temple before my meeting but it is an in explainable experience,very devotional,i feel very peaceful, then I completed my meeting very successfully with extra energy,ISKON is the very good place to visit with family.
very peaceful and nice temple, a must visit place while in Bangalore. it's very conveniently located near to Yashwantpur.
A nice wonderful place to get closer to God. It is the most wonderful attraction of Bangalore.Must be visited by everyone.

We visited this amazing temple at Rajaji Nagar, Bengaluru. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. If we were made aware that the senior citizens have lift services, it would have saved some bother. But I enjoyed the climb and it was spiritually soothing. You can expect here all the aspects of an ISKCON temple and more.
Another great place in Bangalore for Lord Krishna Devotees, full points for discipline and cleanliness. Must visit if you are in Bangalore.
Its a divine krishns temple continous chatting of hare krishna very beutiful temple for soulful blessing .
The temple of Lord Krishna. It is very nice and good place to visit. It is very big temple. Very holy place...

A Iscon temple of Krishna and as all their temples is super clean giving a very pious feeling.We reached early and saw the aarti around 4.00 am a real grand affair enthralling you,there are many aartis which go on till 10.00 and then free lunch called prasad is served from 12.00 onwards.A real feeling of pure food with the blessings of the lord.

This place of pilgrimage is very popular in Bangalore. The whole place is maintained Spick & Span. The Darshan of the God & Goddess is done in a very orderly manner. They take you round the temple to various places of worship and ensure that you have a good Darshan. The food in the canteen is very good and tasty and Hygienic.There is ample Car parking place. The palce is also very well connected by Metro Train Service.

For older population there is also a direct way, else if u are fit then u need to climb 108 stairs. The place is devoted to Lord krishna and rama. So ull find those shrines.
While climbing down one can buy the sweets or prasadam. Advise u to not buy prasadam once u step out. Climb a few stairs down only then buy it. One may also buy small shrines, bhagwad gita in many languages.
No photography permitted.
We visited the temple on a cool evening, the temple is awesome spiritually, architecturally and from the organisation and management point of view. Keep couple of hours to have a proper experience.
Amazing place .feels like heaven . should have stayed more to this place.felt great day at this place.really memorable journey.
I visited this temple with a friend of my that is a long time member - what an incredible place to learn/see the Indian culture and religious beliefs - it was well worth the trip
This is not temple this is a like shopping mal and hotel restorent..... hare rama hare krishna......
Very beautiful, The building and the ambience is very good. Good place to relax and soak in a multi-cultural atmosphere. You can also seek guidance on Bhagwat Gita and meditation.

Iskon temple is one of the top attraction of Bangalore. it very close to yeswantpur railway station . well connected by BMTC Buses and Bangalore Metro. Nearest Metro railway station is Mahlalaxmi in Green Line Metro. only 400 Meter walk from metro station to Iskon main gate..
Iskon temple is very attractive temple build by Iskon organisation in 90's.

Early morning Aarathi time visit was very pleasing and heart warming that gave much satisfaction of God's grace and blessings. Temple is neat and well presented with best possible arrangement for a positive renewal of our mind and heart. Jai Sri krishna!

It is a great place for devotion and chanting. Visit, relax your mind and seek the blessings of the Almighty.

Huge area, huge campus and a marvellously built temple.
quite crowded on weekends. Try to check the opening timings and arrive there before time to avoid the rush.
Don't miss the laddu of Iskcon.
Very nice temple. However be ready to wait in a queue for one to two hours during weekends. Very nice place to shop many things like cotton clothes, bags, sweets, snacks, mythological books, etc.

When you have your friend's and relatives visiting you in Bangalore this is one place you take them. It is a beautifully constructed temple with great view from the top. Weekends are sometimes very crowded and you might not even get a parking space. The food court serves some tasty snacks. The badam milk is awesome. There are shops where you cab buy key rings, calenders, photos, paintings, bags, statues , artifacts...the list is endless.
It's a good outing... I'd say not worth the traffic..it's OK for One time visit.. But if you're a traveler, not localite then you can skip it
Construction of temple is very beautiful.Feel the peace at the temple.Nearest Metro station is Mahalaxmi.
Was on our trip list, and a beautiful temple to visit. Worth paying extra to go via the special tickets, as bypasses any queues. Have a special blessing from the priests.
located on the chord road, this temple is arguably the most clean and well maintained temples across india. Kudos to the management and the public to keep it like that.

Beautiful & peaceful & well organized temple.
Vast variety of quality snacks available for all at reasonable cost.
the temple is so wll organized you really feel that the best time is your convinient time as the crowd at the teple does not interfer your prayers.

One of the best Iskon in India. It's huge from inside and very fascinating.. the only thing is that we have to walk a lot. This place is peaceful with lots and lots of eating options available and the best part is that everything goes to charity. So really amazing place and religious point of view it's is so peaceful.. beautiful

I visited ISKCON temple multiple times. Evening visits are nothing less than fest to your eyes.

Need to take steps to reach the temple. Older people needs to keep that in mind.
I visited ISKCON temple earlier as well. It just helps you relax and meditate. This continuous chanting of Hare Krishna just mesmerizes your thoughts.
Plesant and good for devotees,,,,so spacious and well maintyanined and neat and clean surroundings....
Nice Views, ISKON temple . Peace place . Awesome Interiors .Also have a Waterfall dat is also a colurful . Amazing place

Don't come to ISKCON Bangalore, if you're looking for spirituality and bhakti. This place has too much distractions, money-making and a maddening rush. I was taken aback by the level of commercialization being practiced by the "prabhu"-s within the temple perimeters. Besides a magnificent architecture and beautiful Radha-Krishna idols and paintings, there is nothing here to inspire a sense of spirituality. It is located bang in the middle of a major commercial region of the city. At ISKCON temples, I feel a sense of peace, tranquility and divine solitude. However, I left from ISKCON Bangalore, disappointed.

.
Its one of the most traditional aaratis done here to lord krishna with chants of hare krishna all contribute to decor of the temple with flower pooja and dhoopa aarati there is total serenity in and around the temple.

When you enter the temple, you are supposed to chant with every step....
N when hundred odd people do that together, the place gives you divine feeling even if you are not in that mentality initially.

But once are done with all this, you do realise how big business the trust has been running

the visit to the temple leaves you with a nice feeling.
the poojas are conducted with a lot of devotion
the temple complex also has a wing that sells useful merchandise - all with sri krishna's pictures.
they also sell prasadam which comprises of a variety of food stuffs. one can easily have his stomach full and compensate for a good regular meal.
facility for parking cars is good.
there are a lot of steps but one could manage even with handicaps as there are lifts. even strollers could be taken.
it totallly is worthwhile to visit and fulfill ones appetite literally and also spiritually
Serene environment and extremely awesome view coupled with the cool weather. Amazing construction of the temple and excellent paintings.

A place that recalls you every time you got stressed.. all day long u can stay hear and not feel bored... good restaurant for food also.. do not miss 8pm pallaki ustasv.
After that a tasty prashad .
So many things to purchase as a gift small theatre also.
Its a very big temple, it has 100 steps but we didnt feel that we are climbing 100 steps as in between there are small temples and everything is nicely arranged and planned.
People are queued to avoid inconvenience. It provides parking and free foods (parasad) to all visitors. It looks very beautiful in golden color in evening.

Iskcon Temple , beautiful place to visit . Let it be a temple ,nothing like seeing a beautiful place lighted up , clean , so systematic step by step . I felt really peaceful.
Right at the top the prayers with krishna songs going on and I saw devotees dancing to their glory . My stress was released , I felt like wanting to dance with them .
Really felt very calm and happy when I was leaving the place . Would like to go back again .

Iskcon is a must place to visit in Bangalore. It is a peaceful & calm with devotional chanting of Hare Rama Hare Krishna mantra continuously, makes you forget all other things and perceive Lord Krishna's name.

Take a good sleep. Take a bath. Be there by 8 am. Don't look at any body. Just pray mentally. Spend at least one hour. Come out. Have a cup of sambar rice given free as Prasad. That's all folks. You will remember for a long time
When you visit the temple during morning Aarti time you will have awesome experience and you will forget all things.
I visited Iskcon temple on the night of Janmashtami. It was a wonderful experience. Only thing which I would recommend the authorities is to provide a better view of the lord idol

One of the finest & well maintained temples.clean.
Visitors & devotees will have a great time in Iskcon.

At the outset,I must confess ,being a little biased ,as I am a Life Member of ISCKON.But,having seen in Delhi,Mumbai,Kolkatta ,Tirupathi, by far ,Bangalore ISCKON gives the visitor a surreal experience. The mere size of the Sanctum Sanctorium and the contrasting silence,inside, punctuated by the chanting of hymns by the devotees during Puja hours is a treat to sore eyes and music,a pleasant experience to our ears. A sense of peace and solitude hits us ,once we are inside. Add to this,the daily Maha Arathy are a grand affair and the Prasadam is something to relish.Altigether a wonderful experience for adults and children alike and a must visit on the tour map of Bangalore.

I went there in 2011. it was a beautiful place to see whole the temple. monuments are very clean & clear.
Prasada was best in taste. It was on top of the Hills looking very attractive from the ground.
you can see the city from the top of the Temple very beautifully. I recommend to visit the place one when you are in Bangalore.

I know ISKON since child hood i have been to ISKON, Mayapur WB and Bangalore. The only thing i saw is how people converted there worship into business and i can see money is floating around the temple campus. You can say ISKON temples are market more than a temple. better you donate 500 rupee to a needy.
Give peace to your mind and come out from Stressed life. Life has become a machine and visiting here will make you feel like a human. For couples You will feel like home far away from home.

Situated in the hubdrub of the city, this oasis of peace calm and cleanliness comes across as a welcome change. The size of the establishment can surprise you, but its very well organised despite huge crowds (specially on specific religious days). Worth admiring is the fact that almost all the people helping out are doing it gratis out of love for the faith and it shows.The structure, idols etc in themselves are nice but what you would expect in any large temple in India.worth a visit!!

i've visited this place few times. if you want less crowd visit during day time. if it's crowded, they've have option for group darshan. this ticket will help reduce the time of darshan. after darshan you can visit all the stalls and prasad counters
A visit to this place in the evening is very beautiful. Its crowded during the weekends so the best time to visit is weekdays.. The prasad is mind blowingly super tasty!!!

This is better than all the temples of Iscon I could visit so far. It is even better than Mathura Temple.
Garbh Grih hall with Krishna Radha Idol is mesmerising.
Radhe Radhe
Must visit place for Lord Krishna Devotees. Hare Krishna. Its one of the beautiful hindu temples in bangalore. It is close to Orion Mall.
Krishna temple -Iskon group. Can spend some time here during the day. Enjoy street food and shopping.
Very beautiful and clean temple and temple is pure white marble and prayer is good very deep spiritual place. please note it is very crowd but quiet and peace to mediate.

Prasada was best in taste. It was on top of the Hills looking very attractive from the ground.
you can see the city from the top of the Temple very beautifully. I recommend to visit the place one when you are in Bangalore.

A must visit place. Calm, clean, peaceful place. The main worship hall is beautiful. The temple is located on a small hill. The view is beautiful. Adequate parking. Enough facilities for food and dining.
Homely Atmosphere.Good Staffs.No traffic sound.Good jogging place near hotel.Spacious rooms in whitefield.Good Wi-Fi.Rest assured

Why not visit an amazing temple and observe the continual prayer services? And it's a nice place to meditate. If you're hungry, also a good affordable place to eat. And good views of the city. It's not a must-see, but it offers a good experience

Get to the temple and fill in the names of those you wish to favor with your visit back home. Enter the temple and listen to the chanting and music. Stay for a while, you will feel the vibe of the music. A great start for Bangalore of India! No pictures allowed unfortunately.

ISKON temple is situated in crowded place but there is ample parking space available inside the campus. Once inside you have two options for entry inside the temple either in general queque which is free or in vip queue by paying 400 rupees for whole family.
On a typical religious day there will be lot of rush but even in general queque it doesn't take more than 45 minutes before you reach the main temple.
If you are lucky then you can join Aarti. Inside of temple is really beautiful and well managed. While returning you can grab Gita in many languages.
On ground floor there is food court and exhibition of artifacts. Then finally Prasadam is distributed for everyone.
Overall this temple is a must visit place in Bangalore.

This is what one gets to chant and meditate when visiting this temple. a peaceful and a nice place. the temple architecture is state of the art and the temple is located on the hill top. the chants keep you calm.

Most people will have mixed views of Iskcon temples. I am no different. Which explains why I have taken a week to write. Fortunately, my views haven't changed.

Yes, ISKCON temples have a severe commercialization angle to almost everything tangible or otherwise. Yes, ISKCON temples have changed with the affluent times.

What has not changed? why have I still rated it very high? The answer is that their standards are still very high. They still maintain one of the most important aspects of a temple, cleanliness! Scoring very high on Shaucha is something very critical for devotees and spiritual seekers as they take this unsaid message home. one's mind tends to become clean and so our environment and even our decisions... albeit for a small period of time. But that's why one needs to keep renewing our vows for cleanliness. The satsangs are also still old school and that's a real positive.

Definitely go there once in a month, spend some money there. For they do spend wisely on the AKSHAYA PATRA program. One's own wealth becomes purified. Their goshalas are also very nicely maintained. They are not all Desi cows. But the cows are treated very kindly and that's a real consolation considering what we are doing to get milk from cows nowadays!
A place full of positive vibes. It brings in a lot of positive energy. Must visit if you are in Bangalore. The architecture is great too.

Hare rama - Krishna chant echoes the temple . Peaceful and serene place. you have free darshan and paid darshan. you have a restaurant inside the premises and food court to taste your buds. Plan your visit in the night(after 6.30 pm) where you can view the harathi for the idols . it would be very delightful to view this.
It's really one of best place of god where everyone feel so peace and it's really so nice place where I want to come again and again

A must visit place. Calm, clean, peaceful place. The main worship hall is beautiful. The temple is located on a small hill. The view is beautiful. Adequate parking. Enough facilities for food and dining.
