very nice, neatly maintained. parking could be better organized. good and peaceful place to worship.
very beautiful temple, good architecture, nice idols of god sree krishna, very big temple, must see in benguluru, we spent more than two hours, they also provides lunch at free of cost for piligrims.

Located in the centre of the city, it can be reached comfortably by the newly added metro apart from other conveyance. There is ample parking arrangement made for private vehicles. The shrine though on a small hillock is reachable comfortably. The Lord Srinivasa & Sri Narasimha archa murthis are devine to look at and your bhakthi is sure to be enunciated. The systematic arrangement for darshan of the lord adds to your comfort. The large prayer hall at Sri Krishna shrine makes you feel the presence of the supreme power. Books on Hindu epics and related subjects is available in almost all the major Indian languages & English. Articles & mementos are in plenty for your collection. Apart from the shops selling hygienic snacks two class vegetarian restaurants are also available, The animated shows are a must see, The service of volunteers is exemplary. On Festival days special arrangements are made with at most care for easy flow of the devotees.
A must visit in Bangalore.

A place where you can actually see your soul dancing to the tunes of Hare Krishna hare krishna krishna krishna hare hare.... its amazing to see the feeling of eternal peace dawn on you while chanting the above mantra and your soul and heart just feel the lightness and you feel not ever you should go back to worldly affairs.... a place just for type of people who want peace and serenity in their life at least for some time....

Very well maintained place. Would not be a place of worship but a must visit tourist spot. On top of hill, it gives a splendid view of Bangalore city. Better time to visit is early evening so that one gets time to enjoy the sunset too.

Whenever you visit any ISKCON Temple make sure you'll have organized worshiping experience, I see it as Icon of luxury devotion and reverence. If you are not a believer then perhaps this isn't for you. Marvel floors, granite walls, no long queue, and elevators are some of the USP that keeps ISKCON Temple different from other Temples that you visit in and around India. The 7PM aarti is an awesome experience and you must visit for sure, learn few lines in Sanskrit to make sure you are in the tune, you will feel the connect too. For old age and knee issues, they have an elevator. Prasada and Bhog are also distributed but I feel it should be of better quality. They have a small shopping and eatery outlet but the quality of food/snacks is not good at all, so avoid those outlets within the campus, ie. the food stalls at the ground floor.
Beautiful architecture and personnel. A little surprised about the bare foot policy but I liked it after a few steps inside.
Beautiful temple. Very nice temple to visit in Bangalore. Artwork was excellent. Worthy visit. Hare Krishna Hare Krishna. Very excellent view.

The Iskcon temple is a majestic series of imposing buildings located on a hill, In these clean surroundings, there is no pressure to participate in religious ceremonies. I was interested in visiting their famous kitchens where nutritious vegetarian meals are cooked and despatched for thousands of school children,orphanages, senior citizens and prisoners. One can sample these meals in the various canteens. including delicious cakes and pastries -all egg free. It was a short visit but they also celebrate many festivals with dances in evening performances. Their programme is inspiring and secular. Ask for someone t o show you around

I visited the temple with my parents. This is a great place to visit with family if you have even a slightly religious bent of mind.
The only complain about this place is the degree of commercialisation done in the name of religion. Made me feel like I have entered a mall at times.

Last Year end oktober i visited this big tempel.. witha collegea after work. We were not aware that at that evening The festival of light was starting so we were overwhellemed for me iT was The first time in Bangalore an lot of impressions . Although it might be a bit commercial it give you a bit of India culture to just do it when you are here for a business trip

Go there regularly with the family. The sanctum sanctorum is peaceful and after your Darshan, you can sit down and admire the artwork on the ceiling and take in the grandeur of the temple.

Once the Darshan is complete, you can go to the 3d theatre if you have children.
I had visited the one at Mayapur , West Bengal. Had visited this temple number of times. If we take the commercial part out, two words Peace Inside

This temple is really great to visit late evenings. Easy to access - on Chord Road. View from the temple is excellent as it is on a hill. Temple precinct is extremely clean and well-kept. Very popular and crowded during major festivals, especially Krishnashtami. Food at the restaurant is very good.

Its a nice place to have your peace of mind with your family, we really enjoyed the one day when we went to the place, you can really feel peace from the corner of the heart, as it is little far from the city, its better if you will start in the early of the morning.

Neo Temple with airconditioning and all the modern amenities, a nice place for meditation and lots of yummy prasad on the offering,
one can take home a lot of hindu culture and all.

From a beauty aspect- nil.
In terms of interesting and informative value- nil.
If you have visited anything outside your own culture ever, this will fall short of that.
Just very bland, it's not old, not beautiful, not even clear what it is or why.
I visited this 5-6 times till now with family/friends. Its an awesome place and can visit any number of times. Gold krishna idols are eye catching. Its very near yeswanthapur railway station.
Religious, spiritual and peace of mind; Donate generously for good work; God bless and beneficiaries out of Akshayapatra wishes good for all of us.

Without a doubt, this is one of the biggest temples in Bangalore. Its inside environment makes you fall in love with this place. All kinds of Indian sweets are available inside this temple. A very large conventional hall is availble inside temple premises for all marriage functions. Parking is provided for two wheelers and four wheelers. If you are visiting Bangalore, you should definitely visit this place.

The temple is good looking, with proper management of things. The area is clean, but There is a section, which is commercial shopping centers, The shops offers you variety of thing related to ISKON like t shirts, posters, paintings, medicines, religious products etc. Another section of temple is a big canteen providing you with bakery products, drinks, ice creams.
One of the best architecture among country's best temple. So silent and serene.....visit the place for recreation fun and peace of mind
It's more commercial place with wedding halls, mall than temple. It's more north Indian style gods, not as south.
The Temple is a very interesting visit for someone of another faith. It is a beautiful place. Everyone can learn from this experience.
Not suggestible for public holidays as it will be quite crowded. It is a nice temple, but few areas are much commercialized.

Its a good temple, don't forget you use long trouser and cover shoulders, otherwise they make you use a toga, also you have go barefoot.
After a bit of stairs, you can see the temple its great. Afterwards its like a fair, a bit too commercial for me.

The inner part of the temple gives awesome ambience. But just to see that we are supposed to stand in queue and follow the marching orders given by staff around as such to primary kids. Additionally photography is prohibited at those places we feel to take a pic. Aftermath the visit in the temple the later part is occupied by hawkers and vendors who persuade you for purchasing their stuff, giving the place a market effect. Cafeteria is also there . All in all the place is good but rules are strict .

Must go and see this peaceful place in Bangalore very Natural and best temple.
The are was very clean and parking facility was there and inside Prasadam also very nutritious and must eat food here.

No word's to say

Simply Awesome

Me & my friends enjoyed a lot in load Krishna temple.

I'm happy to say

Jai Krishna
Arguably one of the most beautiful of modern Hindu temples. The area is clean, parking is taken care of, arrangements are good & atmosphere is full of piety. Another must visit places in Bangalore.

Best Temple to visit in bangalore!!!!
I have visited this temple 03 time n yet to visit next time also.
I enjoyed the mistic and devotion of all the visitors , I learned a good deal about his religion. I would recommend it
Excellent temple. Must visit. Krishna idol was excellent. Had magnificent fountain also. They also have shops to attain spiritual knowledge.

The hype of standing in queues that resemble Tirupati is avoidable. The gift shops are a hard sell. As a visitor to the temple, you are forced to visit every stall that sells wares and this is not so wonderful!
Keep it reverential and don't make it a money-spinning industry. The look and feel of a ISKCON Temple is missing. The place is clean and the temple area is very nice.
I am not a hindu but than too though to visit and its very well maintained even the enter line lost of people to help good one

If you are a Hindu or interested in Hinduism, this place will definitely not disappoint you. Its peaceful and serene. The minute you enter the main prayer hall on top of the peak, you feel like you are in a different world when you see the gods. Its a must visit place! You also get piping hot prasad every day and lots of sweets, snacks and stuff to buy.

One of ecstatic landmarks in Bengaluru. Have visited multiple times, but first visit years back always is on top of mind.

During visit to Narasimha temple, the first one which comes on the way, there were more than 30-40 steps , which we have to cross, one step at a time, during which we have to chant HARE KRISHNA. Still can feel that positive vibrations, it can bring to mind. Still perplexed from those memories.

Following must
1. Feel free to say Hare Krishna etc loudly along with crowd.
2. Take time to sit down n meditate with silence.
3.Don't miss Prasada/lunch/dinner, which is served at reasonable cost.

Me, may not be a God believer, but won't oppose any religious beliefs. Just take it as concept to bring several People n minds together.

To conclude, several buildings are coming up in and around this landmark, which may lose its shine. Better to visit on weekday, when it's less crowded.

Good place for an evening outing with friends and family.
Kids may also enjoy. Ideals are north india style.

Recently it is been turned into a business place, too many shops, which has to be mandatory passed through.

One veg restaurant is very good. Free prasada is very tasty and good.

I have a long "acquaintance" with the Hare Krishna movement ISKON, which started in the London of the sixties, when I had the chance to meet personally Prabhupad Baktivedanta Swami.
This temple is beautiful, on a hill overlooking the town, kept very clean and beautifully organized, both qualities I don't often find in Indian temples.
Maybe this high level organization is a bit against spirituality, but when I finally was in the central room, with devotees chanting, music, and the lifesize statue of Prabhupad, the beautiful paintings on the ceiling, and the statues of Krishna and Radha, I felt back memories and feelings of high spirituality.
Consider that my spiritual name Manohar is one of the names of Krishna, and you can understand how I felt in a state of bliss...
iskcon followers can not stay away from iskcon followers and temples.this was my first visit to iskcon temple in bangalore.

Fantastic architecture and grand interiors in main Lord Krishna sanctum.If you are Shri Krishna devotee then you should probably visit this place.Spend some time in main sanctum of Lord Krishna to attain inner peace .Place is well maintained by management . Very clean and tidy. Hare Krishna Hare Rama ! Long live Hindutva

I visited in Sep 2016. The Place is very clean and calm. Nice huge campus and activities are well managed with clear markings and workers guiding you. Only thing that looked odd was it is too much commerciallized. Vendors selling books /CDs etc...right inside the temple was a bit odd. After you exit the main hall, again lots of shops await you right in side the campus only , where you have to shell out big money for everything you buy. Even for Prasadam, you have to buy it from the shop. Only free thing that you get there is a small portion of Khichri ! I think inside a religious place, they should provide free meals.

I visit this place quite often as an escort to my relatives who come to visit Bangalore. Now this place looks to me more of a commercial place than a temple with money coming at every point. I prefer a small temple with quietness rather than a big one with lots of noise and where you are just shoved around or where you have to pay extra for special darshan. You get varieties of things to eat and buy here which you may like but otherwise, it remains as just another place of visit in Bangalore

ISKCON is a society earning lots of money with spirituality.
The ISKCON Temple is open for visits, that's true. Visitors - not members - are forced through a path leading to a few highlights of the temple but much more through all the selling places. They make you to pass their book-selling places, they make you walk through the selling places for touristic stuff, they make you walk through the shops were they sell everything from their own books to all the stuff, tourists might like. You are not allowed to take pictures, you are not allowed to spend some time away from these paths, you are not allowed to use short cuts to avoid their shops. They ask you to pay, pay pay or to become a member (at least, if you are willing to pay again).
In normal temples you are free to visit - sometimes you are not allowed to the inner, holy parts, which is ok, but generally you can just go there and move freely, go here and there, have a look, take part in a puja if you like, do not so, if you don't want. In normal temples, you can visit the shops situated there, if you don*t want, leave them out.
In ISKCON Temple you are forced especially into the stores, the religion, the spiritual parts are not important, they don't really want you there, but they want you wherever they can get your money.
If you can visit other temples in Bangalore or in the surroundings of Bangalore, do so and do not waste your time in this mall called 'temple'.
If you are there, make sure to have some time to visit the washing place next to the temple where you can see the Indian reality of poeple do the washing for hotels, private people, Offices etc, which lies direct next to the temple. A visit is free and the people over there are happy if you look around, spend some time, speak to them, take a few pictures with the children over there. Nobody asks for your money, you feel welcomed, even if the people there are poor.
In the temple we felt reduced to our money, in the washing place next door we felt real people.
Perfect place to go when visiting India and have to show something to colleagues. Loud, crowdy (mostly), colorful and looks exactly as we in Europe expect a temple to be

It is one of the famous Krishna temple in bangalore which is situated in West of Chord road. It is located on a small Hill. The place is well maintained by the temple management.First we have Darsham of Lord Narasimha then of Lord Venkateshwara (Balaji) & finally the main sanctum of Lord Krishna with Lord Bala ramesh & with goddesses radha & rukmini devi.

Ohh what a pleasant experience to see this mesmerising ISKCON temple. Fantastic architecture and grand interiors of the main hall.

Never miss to visit ISKCON Temple when visiting Bangalore.
Very nice place , Place is well maintained.Very clean,very pleasant specially in the evening.Too good Darshan

ISKCON temples are known for their rich and beautiful designs and this one does complete justice to this. Perched at a decent height, it gives a magnificent view of Bengaluru skyline. Enter the temple through the massive yet beautiful door and you have entered a beautiful land with golden chariots and a gorgeous ceiling painted with Krishna's life stages. Beware, the temple is crowded at all times and closes its door at specific times(which I don't remember currently).

A Few years back, we visited ISKCON temple in the evening - spent more than an hour in the Q! Our Second visit was abandoned as there was too much of Crowd as it was on a Janmashtami.

This time we visited the temple at 07.30 AM and there was hardly any crowd and no Q! We had Darshan in less than 10 minutes. We could sit there for some time and pray peacefully. We also had darshan of Laxmi Narasimha swami, Balaji and Hanuman.

The premises are well maintained with hardly any dust.
Worth visiting any number of times!

This is a magnificent structure devoted to Lord Krishna. The atmosphere is spiritual and peaceful.In case you are not religious,you should still see this place for the elegance,efficiency,professionalism and the clock work precision with which they do things.

They have a food court and sort of a mall area,where you get literature on Lord Krishna and Indian Mythology/Religion.The food here is very tasty and very reasonably priced
They also run a meal scheme for government school students named"Akshay Patra" and strongly recommend that you make contribution for this noble service
Even if you are not religious this is a must place to see, so clean, so systematic and perfect. You will forget where you are and will dissolve in the bliss of devotion to the Supreme Lord.

Though this is a gigantic construction, maintained excellently there is no speciality to this temple or place as per mythology. But daily several prayers, pinas etc rituals are being done here systematically, the place/temple gets power. Though the darshanam is free to all, there is a sewa ticket also costs 300 for 6 persons by which we can have a closer darshanam of lord narasimha, lord tirupati balaji and lord sri krishna and At krishna mandir sankalpam, puja, aarti will be given . The ticket holders gets prasadam and books of choice language also freely. Animation show at cost is also available. Several puja items and food items are also available for sale . Worth seeing .
A temple should not be profit oriented. It should be peaceful and should let the devotees concentrate more on prayer.
A very nice place for Lord Krishna devotees. Marvelous architecture. You can buy awesome souvenirs & spiritual books from the temple
If one is very religious than worth the visit, quite famous though, you' can find lots of activity there
Iskon temple in Bangalore is very nice place to visit for the tourist, don't miss when you are in Bangalore

We found the temple beautiful and felt spiritual visiting!

Had the chance of participating in a blessing service but changed our mind and got up to go. This felt a bit like an international incident as we had to wait to be allowed out.

Not sure what ticket we were sold but we were given a bag with some items and food inside.

Then as you exit the selling part for their books takes place rather interesting experiencing this but I guess they rely on generating funds for this beautiful building which has a lot of gold to upkeep

Then you finally exit through a number of stalls in a gift shop!

It's worth a visit even though the traffic to go anywhere is so busy. We were given clothing to cover our ankles and also shoulders need covered, you get money back that you leave to borrow these items
ISKCON temple is built in an ornate architectural style.It is a temple which is a blend of modern technology and spiritual harmony.It is always full of devotees.
Very Beautiful Temple and great view. The temple is generally very crowded during weekends. The Prasad given to each bhakt is very tasty.
A beautiful structure which has a very positive environment. A good place to get some time out of the city hustle bustle.
It is one of famous places of Bangalore. It is located in middle of the city and easily accessible by metro or bus. Temple is very clean and we can spend almost 2 hours there.

Very good place to see who have faith in god.
Radhe krishna and lord venkateswara temple in upstairs were good. Shopping area inside the temple will give you affordable price for buying spiritual things.

Canteen and sweets are very neat and good taste. Prasadham near exit is awesome.
A must visit in Bengaluru and best place for lord Krishna devotees.This temple is really beautiful. Specially in evening when all the lights are put on!
Visit even if you aren't a religious person. One of the most peaceful places to visit in Bangalore. Do try to visit during the last maha mangalarthi in the evening. Best spiritual experience ever.
Excellent Temple in Bangalore. Went with Family members so many times. We can Spend more time in temple for peaceful mind.
I always visit Bangalore Iskcon whenever m in bangalore... if u r krishna bhakt then a must place to visit for some peace of mind in city full of traffic

Definitely, it's the best ISKON. Located near Yashwantpur. The nearest metro station is Yashwantpur metro station. The best attraction is the programmes which are offered here. Lord Krishna devotees this is the best spot !!
It is one of the must visit place in Bangalore. This temple is really beautiful. Specially in evening when all the lighths are put on!
Nice place to hang out been there during last year 31st eve.. Was much fun nd more entertain... A good place to hangout with friends
Temple is very supprrrr and good location in bangalore,it is one of the best temple in Bangalore,in this lord krishna is very good and supprr
This is one of the various iskcon temple being found in india. Lots of people visits this temple frequently and worship for peace.
ISKCON Temple Bangalore will redefine your traditional concepts of Hindu Temples. This is quite modern, quiet and clean. You will start liking this temple if you are Krishna devotee.

We went last week. I didn't expect to see so much people.
It was very peaceful and divine visit.It is easily reachable through metro.

It had good collection of books in all languages.

For Local people best and worth time to visit on regular days Early Morning and late evening i.e Last aarthi time. I would Recommend don visit on festival times, its very rush and you feel irritate.
Many people complains about commercial sections while in exist because of more out side travelers.

Situated at vantage point giving a fair birds eye view increasingly being blocked by multistory buildings coming up in the vicinity. Three entrance's Main one is grand but, during the day majestic flight of stairs turn so hot... Second one is covered but, one has to pass through Zig-Zag market per force... Third one is a lift that lands directly to Temple floor but, no one will tell you and even if you discover they make various excuses to...

The Idols of the presiding Deity are Grand so are other graffiti, beyond doubt an unique experience in one's own perspective.

Decent place but expensive to visit considering this is a Temple, not sure why we was charged so much, the temple itself is nice but i wasnt keen on the fact we was forced upon to watch certain ceremonies, i think this should be based on the persons own interested. Otherwise still worth the visit.

Visit this Radhe-Krishna temple with your spouse and spend good time inside being silent and looking around..

Avoid going single or with a group. Then, you'll not understand the significance of the temple.

We used to go there and sit for long times during college days. But now, it looks more like a shop and there's no difference between this temple and other temples in the vicinity. Everyone is trying to sell something! Didn't like!

We are regular visitors to ISKCON and this time it was a special occasion - starting of Damodara month on 16th Oct '16. We offered 'deepa' (ghee lamp) to the Lord.

It's one of the very beautiful ISKCON temples built around the world and it is a 'must visit' place of worship. Even non-believers of God will get attracted once you are there! One can visit anytime of the year and visiting timings can be checked from their web site. This place can be of 'half day trip' since it has so much to offer to the visitor - shopping area with variety of pooja items, quick food restaurant and also an excellent & luxurious 'The Higher Taste' restaurant.

The location, ambience and the devotional fervour of devotees make this place very unique in bangalore. The pallaki utsav is a wonderful event conducted on a daily basis. This is a must participate event in iskcon. The prasad that is served to the devotees after this utsav is very tasty. In short iskcon visit in the evening post 6 pm is a treat for the soul and stomach and to the eyes

Very very superb place to start in the weekend. Such a great and huge size temple in Bangalore, our legs will cry to walk inside the temple.Very very beautiful and calm @barea to watch this temple. All should have a visit at least once in our lives. So marvelous and excellent place to see in our life.
I visited here with my family. Very nice temple and have darshan of lord shi radhakrishna. I really love this place.

The Bangalore ISKCON temple is truly a piece of peace amidst the Silicon Valley .. The hectic lifestyle of the young generation weather working or studying in Bangalore, desperately need the serenity and austere surrounding of such temple within the city, cause all other famous temples are at least one night journey out of town.. At the same time the beautiful architecture and view is a definite crowd puller for both tourists and locals alike.. Don't forget to dine at The Higher Taste Multicuisine restaurant, where they serve Bhog Prasad, which is not only Higher in taste but the decor and ambience can give 5 star hotels and restaurants a run for their money! My humble request, if you're in Bangalore, a visit to Iskcon temple is a must..

We visited it during our city tour of Bangaluru. It is at good location. As it is at some height, we loved to indulge in cool breeze. We felt relaxed in the divine atmosphere.
The Prasad of Khichadi was awesome! Don't miss.
Very nice temple I just visit one time only but I loved.very large temple very clean I love to come with my office friends

Nice place to visit and have Darshan of lord Sri Sri Radhakrishna. Must see and praise the Lord.
Please chant..
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna Hare Hare!
Hare Rama Hare Rama, Rama Rama Hare Hare!!
...and be happy üòä

The temple is nicely maintained with lots of parking places. Yes you have to go through a big queue but once you reach the main temple once will definitely like the place. The only thing is that while returning they make you pass through lots of shopping area and with the ladies with you, one ends up spending some amount there on shopping. The food etc available there is really good.

Iskon Temple is fabulously maintained. Built in the 90's, it's pretty new as far as temples go. It gets full marks on cleanliness and the structure is quite imposing.
ISKON in general, with it's new-age take on Krishna has a fairly thought out commercial element to it too, with a cafeteria and shopping section. The food is great though!

Love this place, worth visiting. I admire the support programs offered by the temple management to the under privileged children.
Visiting the temple and praying and meditating was a better experience when there wasnt much traffic around the locality.
I only wish the temple made sure the people who visit are quiet and respect the time and space of other devotees.
Temples are meant to be a non-chaotic peaceful place for an individual to find himself and God. Respecting their time and space is important.
Overall a good temple and quiet place to visit. Must visit at least once if going to nearby area in Bangalore. I like it !!

Very very superb place to start in the weekend. Such a great and huge size temple in Bangalore, our legs will cry to walk inside the temple.Very very beautiful and calm @barea to watch this temple. All should have a visit at least once in our lives. So marvelous and excellent place to see in our life.
I visited here with my family. Very nice temple and have darshan of lord shi radhakrishna. I really love this place.

The only thing is that while returning they make you pass through lots of shopping area and with the ladies with you, one ends up spending some amount there on shopping. The food etc available there is really good.

Overall a good temple and quiet place to visit. Must visit at least once if going to nearby area in Bangalore. I like it !!

This place is very fresh and clean. The idols of Gods are beautiful and provide a very devotional experience. The evening Aarti is real attraction and i highly recommend it to even non-hindus as it provides a new kind of experience. Hindus would find this aarti very devotional as it is accompanied by music and dance. Plus there is a very cool vegetarian restaurant in the campus which provides an excellent buffet spread.

I feel charged once i visit this holy temple.
Very powerful Lord Krishna temple,recommended for mind relaxation.

Iskcon is an well maintained, clean temple which caters to varied type of people like adults, children, senior citizens and cultures. It has a good satvik restaurant Higher Taste which shows the culinary skills of making a variety of tasty foods whithout onion and garlic. The only issue is the access to Iskcon is crowed and during festivals, it is really difficult to get a parking space.

Find tranquility in chaos. Living in Bangalore is equals living in a state of constant chaos. ISKCON is not just a place of worship, its a lifestyle. If you are looking for a place where you can find your sanctuary of spirituality along with a certain level of acceptance to a certain lifestyle, head here. u wont be disappointed.
It is a beautiful in Blore situated in the heart of the city with 1000of people visiting there will be nu\ice bajans in the evening the idols are great a must visit in Bangalore well maintained.

A very peaceful & scenic place.
Good for a 2 hours visit, when not crowded.
It has a nice restaurant as well, which is totally vegetarian, with non onion-garlic preparations.
On specific days free prasad is served.
Maybe difficult for Sr. Citizens who may have to climb stairs to reach the main shrine.
Compared to other places in Bangalore its worth to spend our time in this temple....as mentioned in the title it is commercial one.
The view from this temple in and around the city in night time is wonderful experience. simply it is WOW experience.

If you wish to spend time happily, visit ISKCON temple in the heart of the city. Temple is on the hillock and connected by bus and metro route. One can appreciate clean beautiful architecture and murmuring chanting of Hare Rama Hare Krishna. One should follow disciple (line) and have darshan and prasadam. You taste variety of foods ( all vegetarian dishes) and free prasadam. You can also take token for lunch and have full meals. Enjoy gift shop items, which are worth buying.
Its all about happiness. You can dance in joy all the way around. Nirtha Bhajan is the main attraction i personally like... Nothing much go ..enjoy

You taste variety of foods ( all vegetarian dishes) and free prasadam. You can also take token for lunch and have full meals. Enjoy gift shop items, which are worth buying.
Its all about happiness. You can dance in joy all the way around. Nirtha Bhajan is the main attraction i personally like... Nothing much go ..enjoy

You will like the temple for its grandeur, neatness and at the same time has the charm of the right hindu temple. You will also wonder why so many IITans, IIMs (Ex- now) are volunteers there. The temple needs little bit of climbing, as some people have pointed out, its not so friendly for differently able people/senior citizens.
Now as a temple, the place is a must visit, you will definitely be absorbed into the prayer rituals, bhajans, etc.,
You will also be able to get lot of literature on lord Krishna in particular and of course the Bhagawat Gita in almost all languages.
A must visit in Bangalore.
This is not a temple actually this would be called as shopping mall very very beautiful design of temple and while entering the Venkateshwara statue highlight of the temple
Good to visit with Family and in the evening time. Its a bit crowded so you reach the place by 5 P.M. to be able to get in easily.

I have visited the IsKCON temple in seversl cities including Bangalore. However, our last experience was disappointing. We were not allowed to enter the temple as we were wearing sleeveless tops.. They offered to rent us a shawl for a price. But then, I was told my attire was not appropriate as my tights were above the ankle. That caught us off guard. I have never had this experience before.. As we wen
Re waiting to retrieve our shoes, we saw other womn in sleeveless (without shawls) coming out of the temple. When we confronte the staff, they dilly dallied and became rude..

Being an international traveller, I have no issues with respecting the local cultures, provided the same rules apply to all. we left ISKCON without visiting the temple.. Totally frustrated about the ad-hoc rules and the siper-aura of power and control exhited by the team at the security.. Hope they can be trained!!

It is a temple built probably after 1990s... Nicely planned one. With small lawn and garden. Deity is Krsna. Radha Krishna & Gauranga-Nitai . You have temples of Narasimha & Balaji on way to Main temple.

You have ample parking space also very spacious shoes/chappal stand is there.
The philanthropic initiatives of the Temple, "AKSHAYA PATHRA" scheme through which the temple feeds poor children in 100s of schools in and around Bangalore.

You have a small museum also inside.
Temple is very organized and once you enter you will follow a queue for darshan of all deities and museum, then comes a stall where they sell souvenirs, photos etc,.

There is also 108 steps where you chant "Hare Rama Hare Krishna..." each step and enter the temple. But this is not compulsory.

DO NOT MISS THE VERY BIG PAINTINGS OF KRISHNA & HUGE CHANDELIERS ON THE ROOF OF MAIN DEITY HALL OF THE TEMPLE

Strangely you can find a prasadam stall where you find all sorts of eatables including bakery and other snacks..

For all devotees, the temple gives a cup of prasad (like pongal,curd rice etc).
For any one visiting Bangalore ISKCON is a must visit pilgirimage and good place.
Prefer evenings to fully enjoy the beauty.

It is well connected by Metro from Majestic (City Railway Station) and also plenty of city buses.

As most iskcon it is beautiful .. you njoi the ambience .. also it is nt a temple only temple.. with restaurant and bakery of sorts inside even kids enjoy going their

Must visit if at Bangalore and into religious beliefs
Temple is situated in a small hillock and the architecture is excellent. Well maintained and its a great place to visit by everyone and especially for Lord Krishna devotees.
Its great place to visit when you are in the city.Though little far from main city.Clean and very good peaceful environment.
Everyone in Bangalore should visit iskon temple at least once with family and friend. Well maintained also gives immense pleasure and peace of mind.

I had visited the ISCON temple on a hillock in Bangalore with my family on a weekend evening. The aarti which is performed from 7 & 8 pm in evening gives a wonderful experience to complete spiritual enjoyment. Everyone who visit Bangalore should must visit this temple.

You will like the temple for its grandeur, neatness and at the same time has the charm of the right hindu temple. You will also wonder why so many IITans, IIMs (Ex- now) are volunteers there. Its great place to visit when you are in the city.Though little far from main city.Clean and very good peaceful environment.
Everyone in Bangalore should visit iskon temple at least once with family and friend. Well maintained also gives immense pleasure and peace of mind.

I had visited the ISCON temple on a hillock in Bangalore with my family on a weekend evening. The aarti which is performed from 7 & 8 pm in evening gives a wonderful experience to complete spiritual enjoyment. Everyone who visit Bangalore should must visit this temple.
Great place to visit - quiet sentence and great for meditation great ambience. Market was dirty though

1. Temple Approach: Good. No hassles.
2. Parking: good / adequate/ organised.
3. Access for darshan: very good. In terms of broad approach , leads, sign boards, friendly to senior citizen/ disabled: lift available.
4. Lighting: excellent.
5. Housekeeping: excellent.
6. Ambience: excellent.
7. Administration: excellent.
8. Overall darshan / visit truly full-filling.

It is a place full of mysticism place, much peace, and since the arrival you connect with the most basic things like feeling the contaco your feet with the ground, the atmosphere is full of peace and at the end there are places to buy souvenirs at affordable rates.

I will not recommend this temple for foreigners,it's all for business,they forced me to buy a ticket 300 Rupees when you passed you will get 2 pieces of sweet and one book that I don't want them. my clothes were a long skirt and long blouse,and the lady wanted me to go and pay for their clothes again and you have to pay for keeping your shoes. I really disappointed.

I like the temple but did not like the access to the temple. I was with senior citizens and there was no way they could reach to the main temple skipping stairs. For people who have difficulty walking or climbing stairs, visiting this place may not be a great idea. There aren't enough sign boards to indicate the ways and lot of times we felt lost. In terms of idol and temple it's indeed a nice one. Free Prasad is served on Sundays but for that also you have to take stairs and you will have to keep on asking directions.
It's a grand temple as such, but you can find much more interesting ones in Bangalore. Also, it feels a bit odd that after visiting a place of worship you're taken into a large souvenir shop.

The temple complex is very big with ample parking space. Very beautiful temple with lot of amenities. Indeed, one can experience the divine feel with the hymns and chants of Lord Krishna inside the temple. Many shopping stalls and bakery-snack outlets. The complex also houses yatri nivas and a pure sattvic vegetarian restaurant. Highly clean and a nice restaurant with good ambience, yummy food and good service.

ISKCON is for the religious & devoted lot.
A Rich Temple in the form of material used to build the structure & lots of marble used.
Can pay a visit if you are the religious kind. ISKCON is based in many countries around the the world.
Gets very crowded at times & it would be good to choose a convenient time to visit.

The ISKCON temple is located near the city centre with close proximity to the famous Orion mall. Even though it's on a hill, no trek can be carried out as such as it has been barricaded and roads have been paved to accommodate the rush of devotees. This temple is dedicated to lord Krishna and the crowd during the birthday of the lord, i.e., janmasthmi is crazy. I have never been into the temple so I have no idea of what's its inside.
Amazing Place, Neat and Clean, Very Spiritual, Well Maintained Temple and the place really mesmerizes you, want to visit again and again

It's nice place, temple is very well and cleanly maintained.

Must visit place in Bangalore

Entry fee
No parking fee
Temple is one of the best place I never seen in my life ............located at north banglore best place I used to visit

ISCON Bangalore is located on the top of a small hill. It has good connectivity via road and metro. You don't have to worry about your footwear, they have a dedicated and safe place with the token system. You need to climb few stairs and enter via 108 stones on the ground while chanting Hare Krishna mantra. Temple is very huge and pretty, you can sit inside and do Dhyan and feel the beauty of Krishna. Down the temple they have shops where you can buy various spiritual stuff and also the food items. Overall it is an excellent experience. A must visit place for all.
Well maintained place but after darshan you feel like you have entered into some kind of bakery or shop.
It's ok place to visit . Don't pay any ticket for special ticket. It's not worth it. Line moves fast . Go there early . Wear appropriate dress for the temple . Long pants and shirts .
It is next to World Trade Center building, beautiful place. You can sit for hours & chant krishna & can meditate . YOu can reach by metro connectivity too .
This temple was one of the highlights of our trip. We chanted the 108 steps and saw a play outside afterwards. Highly recommended.
This is located in North Bangalore and next to World Trade center and Mariott Hotel . You can access this by Metro route.

A must place to visit in Bangalore. Temple is built for Lord Krishna. All the time we spend in the temple we find the inner peace and so pleasant. The ISKCON tradition and customs are very different and difficult to fellow.
Very Serene, amidst the crowd. Wonderful prasadams and lot of snack options for food. Wonderfully cooked veg delicacies. Soul soothing music. A must visit in Bnglore.

A good place to visit.
You can sit inside the temple and u will feel comforting 4 sure. Good place.
A well organised system for shoes..can visit anytime...
It a fantastic architecture and a place of worship for peace lovers, the temple has main of shri krishna, Narashimar and Balaji

We often visit this temple and get inspired by the Deeparathi during evening everyday.
This temple is located near metro station and can be easily reached from bus station. This place is covered by Daily tourist attractions. You can see this by buying KSTDC ticket for Bengaluru sight seeing also.
This place is abled friendly and can be visited by one and all.
The temple runs two canteens which cater to devotees requirements. Purely vegetarian.
One among ten top places to visit in Bengaluru.
Lord Krishna is the God here and very peace full place with lot scope for mediation architecture is very good

ISKCON is a fantastic abode on top of the hill on west of chord road, near Rajajinagar, Bangalore. It's a nice place to remove the baggage of nonsense we carry in our head. Sing and dance in the glory of the tune of Hare Krishna and unwind, refresh and regrow the spirituality in yourself. Be there early morning and late evening for the Mahamangalarthi. There are discourses on Srimad Bhagvad Gita, especially on weekends. There is an AV presentation on the greatness and Leelas (pranks) of the beautiful Sri Krishna. If you have a team of people, or corporate team who are looking for refreshing your understanding of our beloved sacred book, The One and Only Bhagvad Gita, then just contact their office. The evening lighting, waterflow, evening prasaad, are all greart feature of this wonderful place. There are upadevathas of Shri Venkateshawara and Shri Nrasimha at different levels of the hill. and the

Visited this temple multiple times, itis very good Krishna temple and all the other smaller temples are also very good. The temple is big enogugh and does not fell crowded.

The negatives is too much commercialization on the way out, too many shops and that beats the temple feel

For the first time goer it looks like a awesome place ...the crowd is more and everywhere and each place is commercialized ...from shoe stand to restaurant..the central dome was awesome and mesmerizing ...the krishna and balaram idols are very attractive..everywhere shops are available throughout the exit path and allure to purchase some items in the name sake of lord krishna..you get the bagadgita in all languages...the only free item at the end is hot kitchidi...they serve u only one cup ..after losing your energy..you feel like having one...they does not serve you more than one..in other iskon temples around the world they provide you the decent lunch..here is not the case.
Old temple set in a metro city. Well laid out, parking available, great prasad and gift shop. Inside the temple is well maintained.

I read that I should have a couple of hours, but during a Saturday afternoon, did not find the temple to be busy at all, was therefore able to use the extra hour saved by visiting the Orion mall nearby.
ISKON bengaluru, is a beautiful temple located on a small hill. The view from temple is beautiful and the inside is amazing. Nothing much to write about a temple. A definitely go place.

If you visit one place in Bangalore this has to be your choice. The cultural experience is unlike any other. If you only went for the food you will be more than satisfied. Also, best prices on local souvenirs you will find!

We were western visitors and were charged a higher entry fee - something not uncommon in India and honestly, we respect that we have the means to pay a little more. It was worth it! The higher fee also afforded us an escort by one of their volunteers and the ability to take photos. Please do visit and use the opportuntiy to reflect and pray.

The architecture of the temple is really impressive. The place is well organised but most often found to be crowded. But worth the visit. They have strict security checks and no photography allowed inside. Stores and food items are also available.

Very beautiful temple, worth a visit. Its very clean and maintained nicely. Though gets crowded during evenings.

The quality of food available there is not that great. Isckon Mumbai is way better for food options.

Good temple to visit . Very near to Yeswantpur railway station. Easily accelerated from majestic.
Temple well constructed and maintained . Krishna is main god. Lots of social activities carried ISKCON organisation . You can visit their kitchen Akshaya pathra which helps in feeding many poor .

Do visit when you visit Bangalore.

The center of the temple is beautiful but there is a 20 minute process (assuming no line) for you to get in, between the multiple turnstiles, shoe drop, bag drop, etc. It felt a bit like going to an amusement park.
Excellent place to visit . This is my 5th ISKON temple visit. This is absolutely great place. Fabulous place.
It is best place to keep you in full mediating stage and feel the presence of Krishna bhagwan and his life and also to attract with such a wonderful artistic.
Very calm & peaceful place right in middle of the busy bebgaluru city. Must visit while you are in Bangalore

Great place to visit in Bangalore, Temple located in hill (small hill), temple architecture is really superb. Evening is the best time to visit the temple. Lord Krishna attracts you. Here before you entering to Lord Krishna you visit Lord "BALAJI", "NARASIMHA". But only thing is the food rates are very costly like hotels apart from that superb place.

Honestly, I have never been able to relate myself to the ISKCON ideologies. Traditional places of worship attract me more. Nevertheless, I am rating it high for the way its run and has been maintained..do not miss the Prasad

Beautiful temple to visit and its worth seen place, beauty of the temple attract lots of people here, I visited this place on Janamastmi on august and got impress with its notified infrastructure, arrangement done by authority, feeling great inner peace and satisfaction. jai Shree Krishna.
its worth going to this temple,i went around 4pm and it was so crowded,peoplecome here to worship,its beautiful

This place is more like a mini shopping mall rather than a temple. You simply cannot get a spiritual feel inside ISKCON that you would get inside other temples.

It has been built beautifully with all the granite and marble and yes it does have a beautiful architecture. But after visiting the deity, when you come down you can literally see a restaurant/bakery inside. Following that you have stalls that sell you different items. I think this is exploitation of faith and this definitely is not indicative of the sanctity of a temple.

Simply put, Its more a man-made hybrid of a temple and mall where people would be going more in curiosity to see what all the noise is about rather than to actually pray.

Its definitely worth a one-time visit but this is simply not the place for spirituality or to find your calling.

Temple is quite big ...the main hall is really big and beautiful. Can see people dancing and singing bhajan in centre of the hall... The darsan of all the god in temple good .... Darsan in such an environment make us feel happy about the visit.... After darsan we have option of buying lot many religious stuff including prasad and food items made as per the temple custom..... Pricing is not too high.... At the end before exit temple provide prasad to all the visitors.... camera are not allowed inside the temple all footwear had to be deposited at the entrance.....also if hold membership card then get special entry in the temple....
Beautiful place, very nice to see the rituals. Really a pleasure to visit when you are in Bangalore. Best temple I visited so far
By stepping in the foothills of ISKCON, you are in the abode of the Divine. Lord Venkateshwara & Krishna bestows the blessings to each one of the devotee visiting the Temple.

They have done a great job maintaining this place right in the heart of city. Be prepared to walk and climb as this is built on a hill. The temple sanctum is very serene and well maintained. Great place to pray. At the end of darshan you get prasad to eat. They have a book store, which is very good. They make sure you cannot exit till you walk through a quarter mile of hawkers selling every conceivable thing you can imagine and food. Be patient, this is all part of getting you to heaven smiling all the way. No photography allowed.

This beautiful building is dedicated to Hare Krishna. As with the other temples, shoes are taken off and left at a shoe stand for 2 rupees (or in your bag). After going through security (photos not allowed inside), you are guided through the temple by following the posted signs.

The staff are very helpful and will talk with you about Hare Krishna and suggest books based on your curiosities or questions. The staff also serve a simple free lunch for visitors in the late morning.

It's worth a visit if you're interested in learning about Hare Krishna and seeing this impressive structure.
The temple inside is interesting but to get out is a maze of shops and all of them carry the same items. By the 5 or 6th time you've seen something, you're likely to give in.

Very well maintained overall

You will get peace of mind if you spend about half an hour there.

Location wise also very good( very near to Orion mall,yeshwanthpur)

A bit too much of religious shopping points though

Recently visited ISKCON temple in Bangalore on Balram Jayanti and it was so beautiful to see the decorations. Musicians were present and a huge amount of crowd had turned up for the event. Extremely amazing scenes.

One of the biggest and good temple in the city. Most visiting temple for learning and for peace of mind. My request. Please visit the temple and seek blessings of lord krishna.
Hare rama hare krishna

For only about $6, the paid entry whizzes you through to the key parts of the temple, and includes free gifts. It's a really interesting building, stacked in stages, leading up to a main temple buzzing with chants, noise and colour.

Leave your big cameras at home as they are not allowed in - it will be taken off you at the gate (although the facilities to leave items seems a bit ropey, I received mine back with no issues)
I got a bunch of blessings here and liked the food but there's something odd about the laddu. Very beautiful modern temple!
Its more of a tourist attraction than a temple. Priests will ask you money for almost everything. Food is good since they have something restaurant kind of there .

Attended evening aarti (7:00 PM) at ISKCON temple Bangalore, I think it is the best time to visit temple, it is a very beautiful temple, great piece of architecture, motivational. There is one canteen in the campus which servers delicious dishes.

Good place to visit temple in Bangalore.
Take note of timings while visiting the temple.
I came earlier to this place, however as Orion Mall was 5 mins walk did some shopping in the meantime.
Temple atmosphere is lively always.

Best Krishna Janamastami ever .This temple is located in Malleshwaram ,near to Orion Mall.Must visit .
#BeingSpritiual

The ISKON temple at Bengaluru is located in large spacious grounds . The entire temple complex is maintained very well. We had been in the evening and hence were able to participate in the evening Aarti. Overall a nice and peaceful place of worship to visit in Bengaluru.

As it's little far from my home took almost 2hours to reach there. Place is well organised and you want see long queues and stamped. Just little rush when you enter into the main temple Dom. But would be great If you visit in non festival time. You will enjoy more. No need of paying for VIP darshan. If you want you can make it in one hour . don't stop for buying from stalls unless you wanna buy something.
The temple is really beautiful and we have been there during the evening time along with family had a great time being there.

Other than Religious point of you , the temple can be visited to admire the architecture.
Just go there and let yourself float in the waves of devotion.

Hare raam hare raam, raam raam hare hare
Hare krishna hare krishna , krishna krishna hare hare.

:)
I felt very nice visiting the temple. The interiors are very beautiful and the overall feeling is very pristine

Iskcon Temple, Bangalore is spread across 7 acres of land and it is the one of largest Iskcon temples in the world. It The International Society for Krishna Consciousness is a devotional tradition based on the teachings of Bhagavadgita and the Bhagavat Purana (Srimad Bhagavatam). You can find 4 large gopurams for the temple each of them are connected through a glass canopy. The entire temple forms the ‚ÄúHari Naam Kirthan‚Äù, you can find gold plated Dwajastambha which is 17m high and also gold plated Kalash Shikara which is 8.5m high. Free tasty prasada is offered from morning till evening in the temple premises.

There are many different shrines inside and it is well organized and you are automatically guided through. The key is that you can also enter without buying a ticket for 1000 Rupies. Be aware that you need long shorts and women cover their shoulders. Everything is bare foot.
Towards the end there are many options to donate and buy stuff, however, people are friendly even if you decline.
I liked to observe the worshippers and how they celebrated in the temple. It was worth the visit.

The temple is bigger than Mumbai Iskcon and thankfully has plenty of paid parking space available. Temple is very clean and the evening Aarti would be a great treat for all Krishna followers. Plenty of eating options available to choose from. All in all, a nice place to visit with family
Iskcon temple is a huge the,male complex in west off chord road. It not only has a temple but also a huge shopping centre as well. Very clean and well maintained.

Beautiful temple to visit. The place is quiet and clean.

Beware of cheap quality products sold in the temple.

ISKON is always very peaceful to visit. Goo time is to vista's around noon as the at 12.30pm you get to see the aarti also. The crowd is very well managed by volunteers wich makes the visit tension free. Elderly can go up in wheelchair using a lift.
Inside the mandir you get laddos as snacks like samosa, kachoree, gila jamun, bhajee etc followed by piping hot prasad at the exit.
Outside you have a cafe and find dining- Higher Taste. Food at both the place is good.
On the whole a great experience.
A very good temple but on height,so either ask your target, xiwala to drop at final point or make sure you have strong legs!!
Very big temple. With lots of lights and one would go amazed to see that colorful monuments. Very near to metro as well.

A very serene, peaceful & spiritual place. The moment u enter the temple's complex, there's a security check, no photography is allowed inside the temple. U will start chanting the Hare Krishna mantra before entering the main sanctum to pay respects to the beautiful Krishna, chanting is not compulsary however but u observe total silence and unconsciously u wld have chanted the mantra 108 times!
Free prasad is given towards the end of your visit before you exit the temple. Lots of savoury and sweet snacks on sale too. Lots of souvenirs are also on sale. A beautiful temple to visit.

Came in here unintentionally and was pleasantly surprised. The complex is quite huge and very clean and well maintained. It is free to enter and walk around. A popular temple and site of devotion it was stunning and nice to visit especially since it is right in the middle of the bustling city. Overall i really enjoyed the visit and even got into a little discussion with the priest who was trying quite desperately to convince us to buy a book on Krishna but don't let it put you off. At the end of the visit you can indulge in some of the local delicacies.
A great experience visiting this temple. A Rs 300 ticket per family enables you a great darshan, aarti and a few quiet moments in the sanctum. Certainly worth a visit

A nice and peaceful place in Bangalore. Awesome architecture. Came here with family and we felt good.

One suggestion: don't miss this place if you visit Bangalore.

Imaging temple with statues of Lord Krishna and other gods.Remains crowdy on Sundays. Avoid to visit on Sunday.
Nice spiritual place.

Just like all the ISKCON temples, this one is also a classic structure,
well built
well laid out
Quite spaceous
the pooja/aarti is a must go. try the evening one.
if you are if you lucky enough, you can get a chance to join along with the temple clan singing the bhajans/praises of lord krishna.

Overall its a good experience for exploring the cultural side of the city.
Try the food here, its different than usual but feels organic.
Temple built on a hill with beautiful interiors and great views near Chord road, the evening Puja is a spectacle,

Iskcon temple...is a famous Center for Krishna devotes throughout world..so is in Bangalore.

You can have darshan free or paid..which facilitates you for move fast n comfortably for darshans.

Temple has almost all facilities and a shoos for buying gifts for children n all age group ppl.
You can also find food stall serving food from bakery items to snacks like samosa kachori puffs and many more.

Sweets r also available.

You can have paid meals at restaurants below the main temple building.

You have parking facilities too.
Yatri niwas is also available.
A very good temple but on height,so either ask your target, xiwala to drop at final point or make sure you have strong legs!!
Very big temple. With lots of lights and one would go amazed to see that colorful monuments. Very near to metro as well.

A popular temple and site of devotion it was stunning and nice to visit especially since it is right in the middle of the bustling city. Overall i really enjoyed the visit and even got into a little discussion with the priest who was trying quite desperately to convince us to buy a book on Krishna but don't let it put you off. At the end of the visit you can indulge in some of the local delicacies.
A great experience visiting this temple. A Rs 300 ticket per family enables you a great darshan, aarti and a few quiet moments in the sanctum. Certainly worth a visit

A nice and peaceful place in Bangalore. Awesome architecture. Came here with family and we felt good.

One suggestion: don't miss this place if you visit Bangalore.
