Keeping the humans aside the place is good with nice amount of architecture and splendid domes, chandelier..
Very elaborate and gives complete feeling f devotion. The deities are very atractive and give you feeling of being near to almighty.

A very good practice followed here is the chanting of the Hare Krishna Maha mantra
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna,
Krishna Krishna Hare Hare,
Hare Rama Hare Rama,
Rama Rama Hare Hare
They make you chant this 108 times while you are going in line to see the Narasimha swamy in the temple at the beginning, there are 108 pedestals raised around the Narasimha swamy Garba gudi and for each chant, you need to increase your pedestal count, thereby making you keep track of your chant 108 times.
Hare Krishna!!

One of the large ISKCON temples around and one of the busy temple too. Modern Traditional temple, clean and built with amenities which lags in most of the temples. No wonder more popular among the foreigners. Large place and be prepared to walk up and down the stairs in a line. Choose non holiday day to visit where you can enjoy the temple better. Nice value added souvenir shops and excellent food items sold. It can be easily a family event for 2 to 3 hours well spent!

One of the best temple in Bangalore, beautiful architecture and peaceful. Visit this place in evening. It is beautiful with evening lights. Radha Krishna gods are the main attraction of the temple. Very clean and peaceful temple.

The temple of Radha Krishna is worth seeing. The precious stone studded idols are amazing. The gold plated sides of the main altar with its intricate carvings is eye catching. The very high ceilings with paintings conveying the story of Lord Krishna is superb. One can buy the Bhagawad Gita by Swami Prabhupada translated into various regional languages.

There is very tight security. The place is very cleanly maintained. Cameras are not allowed - but there are cloak rooms to leave your camera and collect them on the way out.

A large number of steps need to be taken to reach the sanctum sanctorum - elderly people could find it difficult - but I think there are special darshan passes to avoid the steps (not sure - saw some signages about special darshan at extra cost).

The bhajans are very soothing and captivates everyone who is around.
The ISKON temple is very beautiful especially because its fully white inside...the walls and the floor...its pretty far from the city so was quite a ride to reach here...but it was worth it...
This place is good for religious people and people who love traditional architecture and paintings and designs. Its a must destination in one day bangalore tour

Most ISKCON temples around the world are aesthetically designed & they have excellent architecture. I recommend that one sit in meditation in the prayer hall. It leaves a good feeling.
One can also contribute to "Akshya Pathra" the initiative that the temple has taken to feed 1.5 lakh poor kids.

This is not the traditional temple that once usually visits. It has been built keeping in mind the modern visitors. The area across which is spans is huge. Once you climb the stairs of teh temple, you can see the Bangalore city - as its located on a hilltop.

The animated movie sections is greatly recommended for kids. Besides, once can actually visit the handicraft section for purchase of worship related metal containers and mythology related paintings.The normal food & general itemsale counters wil also take much of your time.

Overall, i say this place requires time, as it can comfortably take half of your day.
One of the most beautiful ISKCON Temple. I visited early morning on Sunday and had great experience. Claim and peacefull dharanam.
Its not a traditional ancient hindu temple, its a modern temple. We joined the prayer dance in the main hall, it was a new experience for us.

ideal visit time would be during the maha Aarthi time in the eveinings; with the temples lights and the serene and blissfull mood is set...

well synchronized and I could say choreographed Arthi along with the chants and dances...provides true spiritual culmination to a great evening...

Must visit place in bangalore!!! I often visit this place with my friends. One had to struggle a bit in queue with sun making it miserably tough but once you are inside, you feel amazed the quietness of this place in the middle of city. This place is also next to metro station and many malls. So if you want to tour bangalore, this place is best as you can reach this spot easily and can visit malls as a bonus!!!

The Iskcon temple in Bangalore is beautiful! From the moment you step in, you can feel the divinity of the place. It has been commercialized with tickets for darshan which allow you to skip the line and I personally feel buying them is worth it! The murals on the ceiling are stunning and its difficult to get your eyes off the deity.
If you're a believer, go for the experience, and if not, go for the art :)

Temple is constructed on top of a hill. Its view from bottom is amazing... The floral decoration that they do for Idols is just mind blowing. You cant even find a misalignment. We have Lord Venkateswara Idol also in the same temple, which is another big blessing for everyone... The architecture and paintings inside the temple will make you WOW... After Darshan, You will be directed to their private shopping area where you will find good traditional Indian sweets and ethnic wear... You can spend 2-3 hours spiritually and happily. Orion mall is just behind this temple, You can visit that too...

I visited with family, this temple is quite silent and you will feel very different inside.
I had this wonderful experience which I want to share.

Very neat and well maintained temple situated on Hare Krishna Hill. It provides a wholesome experience of faith & spirituality. Visit with family, do Pooja, sit in quiet atmosphere, de stress yourself in the serence and blessed surrounding of Lord Krishna's temple !

There is free distribution of Prasadam to all visitors during the darshana hours

You visit this place several times and yet you feel a new way everytime you come back !

Keep a few hours handy before entering. You never know how much time, it will take for the darshan. The temple is well connected. There is some space for parking but it gets filled easily on weekends and evenings. So, be prepared for that.
very good place to see in bangalore. Temple architecture very different . Lord Venkateswara swamy and Lord Narasimha swamy temples are good to see.

Visited this temple with some colleagues from abroad. It was the right place to give a taste of Indian Temples and Indian Culture. The Temple being a privately managed is well maintained and disciplined.

A wonderful location combining devotion, food, luxury, shopping etc., This is a spot you will not hesitate to visit often too. Please do not forget to visit the theatre shows that run short films. Architecture of the temple is amazing and the best among all the ISKCON temples I think. This is one of the top most locations in Bangalore, one should not miss.

right from entrance, you begin chanting the mantra with each step you take (if you are in a queue). Weekdays are easier as there is not much crowd. The temple is so clean and well kept. the food is very tasty and the shopping for satvik items is excellant.
one of the tourist attraction in Bangalore.beautiful temple where a true devote would enjoy the calmness

So I visited this temple wid my grandmother.she was surprised looking at this temple.looking at it from outside ,she thought it looks like an office with all the glasses .once we entered the temple ,we observed a few people fully busy in meditation.but it wad when we were coming out of this temple we saw there were many shops in temple premises.they were selling cd's and clothes and a lot of other things.honestly it doesn't gives a feeling of genuine indian temple.it seems like a business venture created to entertain and confuse the foreigners .

the beauty of the sparkling gold inside the temple is amazing.
the whole temple lights up due the gold idols.
the management system is also great.
and the path is also not tiring.
the best part is the beauty of the temple

The must visit place in Bangalore presents most beautiful god idols of lord Krishna, lord Venkateshwara etc.
The place is too calm,clean. Food and shopping facilities are also there.
One of the beautiful temple in bangalore city, must visit if you are in bangalore, in bangalore there are many places but the iscon temple is beautiful place to see in bangalore.

just be there to be with the lord. very nice temple on a hill. rare feat in a city. lord venkateshwara also adorns this temple-looks like balaji from tirupati specially when aarati is performed with lights off
Every one must go and pray, you will feel the power of almighty God. Advice to take special entry ticket to avoid the long Q.
Visit only if you are really religious. The paintings on the inside of the ceiling are the only good part in the temple.

Though I have visited here multiple times, but got to know from their website and few of my friends that early morning puja called Mangala aarati is awesome. So planned one.

Reached temple at 4:00 O'clock in morning.. There was no special dharsan or ticket. Entered into main temple very quickly and the sequence of puja started that enclosed multiple aarti and puja. The entire puja was almost an hour.

It was one of the best morning I had in my life. I was feeling awesome and charged. I would suggest everyone once in a lifetime should take that experience.

The Temple was very good, neatly maintained and is very disciplined. The Location was easily accessible and is very near to Yeswanthapur Railway Station and Satellite Bus Station. I went there with my Fiance and had a very good and peaceful time until i finished my darshan. Then the Business starts , you are forced to a series of shops and stalls for a very long duration that by the time you reach the end you would have forgot that you were here for Lord Krishna. All the items were highly priced that most of them can be bought at 1/4 just outside the temple premises.Except of this the temple can be visited once in a while.

The ISCKON should start treating temples as is and should start building shopping complexes if they are very much interested in Business.

This is a must watch for all...
One of the best temples I have ever seen so clean so well maintained... Food too is awesome...

The temple is famous for its grandeur, sculpture, exceptional and consistent tradituonal devotional service to the Lord amidst modern equipments and gadgets. Nice prasadams too of many varieties and devotional shopping.
Must visit in Bangalore.
Very nice temple built up a hill. Peaceful location were foreigners can really blend in and feel the local culture.
Iskcon is a famous temple in India.In India,bangalore iskcon is famous.I enjoyed a lot in this temple.The construction of this temple is super.

ISKON is a combination of devotion, outing and dining probable fine dining too.. The temple is awesome.. Higher Taste is a restaurant, vegetarians love the taste of that food.The outer perimeter is a pleasant time pass for 2 to 3 hours...
Do purchase the pass before entering. it helps in skipping the queues and also a close view of Lord Krishna. View from the top is quite good and parking arrangements are done efficiently.

We visit Iskon Radhe krishna temple very often.its must see place for bangalore visitors.its on the hill,devotees will be offering pooja and bhajans,its breath taking during aarathi time.get all sorts of pooja accessaries and nice snacks,prasadam.
A completely hygienic place with lots of positive energy. A great place to spend time with yourself. The less said better. Trust me it is worth the experience.

i liked the temple the maintained but fairly felt as shopping complex.

good stuff to buy and great place to meditate.
Whether you are a krishna devotee or not does not matter.. If you happen to be in bangalore this is a 'must see' place.

For those interested in Hinduism or Indian culture in general, this is a great place to go when in Bangalore. The place is a modern, 30-year old complex of different temples. The temple interior is not really spectacular, but the atmosphere and the enthusiasm of the people is quite appealing. Its usually quite crowded there.

Get ready to walk up the many steps to see 3 shrines . There are lifts for life members, elderly and pass-holders. Prahlada Narasimha is the first shrine. Srinivasa Govinda is the second. The third is a set of shrines in a huge hall comprising of the idols of Krisna and Balarama, Radha and Krishna and Nitai Gauranga. Remember to look up and observe the lovely paintings on the ceiling. Thereafter you will have to walk through a multitude of shops that sell pictures, books, eateries, apparel -all related to Isckon and the idols therein. You will queue up for relieving Prasadam and then exit. There are shows about Krishna in a small theatre, for a fee. There is a Sattvic restaurant "High Range" in the temple compound, which offers delectable vegetarian food.

ISCON, in many ways is different from a typical south indian temple..The vibe is more cultural than religious.Temple itself is very beautiful and crowd management is good. Ambience is calm and positive , but weekends are crowded.
There is an option of a alternate entry patch with a nominal fee of Re.600 for 6 people which includes a prasadam packet and a book. The option is very good for people who are on a quick visit and are short of time. Once the darshan is over there a well stocked food court and stalls to buy temple memorabilia.

To me,it was a experience which I believe should be how religion needs be interpreted in the coming ages , not preachy or deterring, but imbibing the values and morals into our life and culture.

I had visited The ISKCON temple with family and friends during my visit to Bangalore. It was a divine experience. There are two queues, one general and one special which you can avail with a slightly higher cost. You should visit the temple once whenever you in the city.
Very peaceful place. We went on a weekday so the place was not so crowded. There is a small shopping market at the end of temple. You can buy souvenir from there.
Very beautiful temple. You can feel the ambience, calmness and some kind of energy in this temple. I strongly recommend visiting this temple in Bengaluru.
Nice temple to spend some peaceful time. Don't go during weekend and public holidays as this place will be very crowded.
Very good temple in Heart of Bengaluru. Must visit temple in Bangalore. I visited number of times and all the time I am getting new feeling. It is simply awesome.
Needless to say as all Iskcon temples in the country is serene and peaceful and this one is no exception. Good place to be in if your mind is troubled.

It was a good experience at this place. One can take a metro too to this place as the metro station is at the walking distance. The thing this has commercialised a lot and you can see a large space to buy and eat endless products. But worth a place to visit once.

hare krishna
for all krishna devotees and tourists absolute tranquility
a place of worship worth entering and praying

There would be about 200 stairs to climb I think. The architecture and the statues are very good.

The only reason I gave 4 is the place is too commercialized (just like all iskons), everyone is just trying to sell you something be it spiritual stuff or food.
It's a beautiful temple and spread out over a large area. It's very clean and organised. The temple precincts reverberate with a sound of peace. It's a great spiritual experience!
This is one of the busiest place for religious activities that have witnessed in recent time.any religious person would love to pay visit to

I was lucky enough to be working in Bangalore when they had a holy day and I seized the opportunity to do a temple Tour (and boy there are a LOT of temples in Bangalore ).

The ISKCON however, is at the top of its class. Huge and imposing from its hilltop position, I was awestruck as we strolled, chanted, bowed, prayed and danced our way around.

Free food is given at one point (not for the weak of stomach), and there are endless chances to take photos.

Really worth a visit, even an atheist like me came away feeling uplifted.

Recommended
Mesmerizing experience, So much peace at the temple , you can also buy many souvenirs like books music CD and some other uncommon stuff at reasonable prices.

This place is calm and composed that one will like almost everything in here. Great structure of the building and definitely a place for Lord Krishna worshippers.They serve lunch also, pure veg delicious food here. but you will have to walk through a long queue which will take you to different halls where they sell different stuff and you cannot take any detour.
to get get stress free from work, this place is real good. viisted here many times , as when get breather from schedule

to get get stress free from work, this place is real good. viisted here many times , as when get breather from schedule

Except the huge crowd that we get here all the other aspects are excellent. A nice and calm place to have a visit.
There are many people around to help us which makes us feel comfortable.
This place of worship is worth visiting if you are in Bengaluru. Very well maintained and disciplined crowd.
What a amazing feeling when we reached there you can not go running or hurry you have to go step by step you can not cross or over take any one. Really peaceful on top. We want to visit once again.
It is a beautiful temple. Very well maintained, clean. Calm environment. Well maintained aarathi and darshan timings. Feel blessed.

This is one of the best ISKCON temples I have seen. Beautifully located and very well managed to handle huge crowd.

The interiors, especially the ceiling, of the temple is fabulous. It is a must-visit during your visit to Bengaluru.

Its a huge temple. We visited this temple in evening, there was huge crowd and so we had to wait in queue for almost an hour to get darshan. Compared to other ISKCON temples, this temple was bit more crowded and commercialized.

ISKON is well known, very peaceful and well maintained, also there's a huge collection of beatiful paintings of Krishna, books like Bhagwad Geetha, Krishna's stories and idols, also the prasadam is very famous. Recommended to visit.

This temple is beautiful and located in north bangalore. You can directly reach here by metro and then 500m walk. Temple have good crowd management facilities, at peak you may need to be in queue for a long time to get into central temple. Inside temple artwork is splendid and Radha Krisha idol is divine. You will enjoy the hare rama hare krishna chants throughout your temple visit. Once you are out of the central temple, commercialization starts. They have put stalls of almost everything, prices are high too, They have kept the same item again and again to make sure you dont miss it. You can enjoy free prasadam or can get good food at their restaurant.

really big temple.
Don't forget to where trousers and long sleeves. If you forget you can always rent one arriving in the temple.
INR 500 as a deposit (returned at the end of your visit) and INR 20 for laundry.
the temple visit is free

Must see temple for someone visiting Bangaluru. Beauty and cleanliness are part of ISKCON. Very well maintained premises. You need to climb few stairs. Very beautifully constructed and maintained. The architecture is splendid. Inside the premises you have so many options to have food at very reasonable prices.

Except the huge crowd that we get here all the other aspects are excellent. A nice and calm place to have a visit.
There are many people around to help us which makes us feel comfortable.
This place of worship is worth visiting if you are in Bengaluru. Very well maintained and disciplined crowd.
What a amazing feeling when we reached there you can not go running or hurry you have to go step by step you can not cross or over take any one. Really peaceful on top. We want to visit once again.
It is a beautiful temple. Very well maintained, clean. Calm environment. Well maintained aarathi and darshan timings. Feel blessed.

This is one of the best ISKCON temples I have seen. Beautifully located and very well managed to handle huge crowd.

The interiors, especially the ceiling, of the temple is fabulous. It is a must-visit during your visit to Bengaluru.

Its a huge temple. We visited this temple in evening, there was huge crowd and so we had to wait in queue for almost an hour to get darshan. Compared to other ISKCON temples, this temple was bit more crowded and commercialized.

Must see temple for someone visiting Bangaluru. Beauty and cleanliness are part of ISKCON. Very well maintained premises. You need to climb few stairs. Very beautifully constructed and maintained. The architecture is splendid. Inside the premises you have so many options to have food at very reasonable prices.
This temple is build on a hill and us beautifully made .The architecture is splendid. The premises is very good and well maintained.

It's wonderful place to expand time with friends and family. It's very spiritual place.
And inside their so much food option is also their.

High tech temple !!! is what many of us in Bengaluru refer to ISKCON. It is no where close to traditional south indian temple in look although it does carry its own aura due to its location at higher altitude and concrete jungle surrounding it (Orion mall, Huge residential township coming next to it and Bangalore metro that tuns opposite to temple). Overall its a must see for someone visiting Bengaluru. Also nearby to Iskcon is famous Orion mall and also Prasaana Veeranjeneya Temple (huge monolith carving of Lord Hanuman) which are at walkable distance from the temple.

A very nice temple to visit in Bangalore , Dont miss it when ever you visit bangalore.

Atleast you can spend half day here , it will be crowded during weekends.

Better Plan for weekdays.
Absolutely loved the place. Has got beautiful carvings and has a mix of Indian and wester influence in the construction
lovely place n nice food. one holy place you want to stay to stay blessed. kudos to the creator. carry on the spiritualism.

Creating a lovely atmosphere of Shanthi ...
really awesome temple to visit and get piece of mind.....

A very nice place to hang out with family member.. The temple is very well maintained and clean.. Also there are lots of snacks available inside the temple premises.. The hot kichdi / prasadam served is superb..

I really wanted to visit this temple from the pictures I saw online. This is a super busy temple, and the organisation has everyone queuing like herded cows with metal barriers in between. The temple itself has a gorgeous roof and reveals great views across Bangalore. The only thing that really upset me was the "duty free" two floors of shops and stalls you have to walk through to get to the exit. It somehow feels very inappropriate in a religious building.

Beautiful campus, pretty idols and decoration, tasty food.

But its not as calm as other ISKCON and felt to be too commercial.

Very nice place to visit. What I liked the most is the Hare Rama Hare Krishna chant by stepping through the blocks. It gave me lot of focus and was equivalent to a meditation. One of the best ways to enforce focus which very few temples have. This is much better than Mumbai Iskcon

Very nice attraction in Bengaluru. Family , Friends all can visit but keep in mind the dress code for ladies here. Short dresses\3/4ths or sleeveless tshirts or salwar kameez are not alllowed here.

The morning program starts at 4:15 am and ends at 9:00 am. Darshan is open till 1:00 PM.

It is located in Rajajinagar, Bengaluru and is definately a must visit attraction if you are planning on a day trip within bengaluru itself.

It is one of the largest Iskcon temples in the world.

There is art and handicraft sold within the temple but It is on the very expensive side so if you are able to purchase it then you are indeed lucky.
You can visit this place with your friends family or your love one. It is a very good place to visit and the provid a meal also in afternoon. You will enjoy it.

Let's start with useful advice for visitors from overseas I was directed to a separate entrance and then following the barriers ended up ahead of the devotees which felt a bit awkward. However the 300 rupee entrance seemed to be paying for this and also a bag of Indian sweets/ biscuits and a free devotional book !I was prayed over and made to feel welcome despite being a woman visiting on her own. There are notices saying no photography or cameras and in fact my camera had to be left with security even though I would not have used it. as is normal in Hindu temples no shoes , but it is not clear where to leave them although there is in fact a large cloakroom for them. I f you get lost the ground can be scorching as you find your way - take socks. I accepted the free rice and tried to eat correctly but failed miserably. It felt rude to refuse.
There are lots of things to buy but you do not have todo so and I never felt pressurised. I have seen similar goods in many western cathedrals.
But. The temple itself is spectacular and it is possible to have some time of quiet reflection and I accepted the prayer said over me in the spirit it was intended. This an experience not to be missed.
the best part is their crowd control strategy by asking people to follow the steps one by one during entry ,they have a movie hall to show films and a good food court

The temple is beautiful and well maintained. Very Crowded on weekends, but there was no pushing/jostling, so you just move along the queue without any hassles. Inside we bought a puja ticket which allowed us to view the deity from close and in a peaceful manner. After Darshan we sat for some time and waited for the Aarthi. aarthi time is amazing and a must watch

I have been visiting this temple for last 20 years .it is very well organized and clean place.The poojas are performed in very religious way and devotees are treated with a lot so coutasy .Good quality food is available to suit all . There is ample place for parking expect on holidays where you may find difficult to find parking
It was ok to visit but no way to make a picture in this temple. Why no photography in the temple which I cannot understand. It was more commercial that worship.

Early morning visit to get a glimpse of Arathi of Deities of Lord Venkateshwara ,Sri Narasimha Swamy, Lord krisha in main temple are amazing experiences and blissfull. Very beautiful temple, very friendly and smiling disciples with whom you can join during chanting & dancing Hare Krishna songs. You can get free Prasadams as well.
ISCON also runs free mid day meal program to under privileged school children & you can donate generously to participate in their mission.

The temple premise is beautiful..!! I would love to visit the temple again but on a better day when there is less crowd.

You cannot directly come out of the temple, you have to go through all the shops, food stalls,etc. This was a huge no-no for me, it ended up being more like a picnic place than a place of worship.

Ladies - Sleeveless tee,dresses needs to be covered so kindly prepare yourself beforehand

This temple has great architectural value, built on a hillock, attracts a lot of visitors from within India and foreigners. It's maintained nice and clean. But the only thing I felt is there is something sold at almost every step of the way. Books, CDs even in the main sanctum and as you exit you have to pass through their stalls where they sell almost everything. Minus this I think it is a great place. It is siutated on Chord Road, close to Mahlakshmi Layout Metro station and near Yeshwantpur.

Such peace and tranquility is attained here, difficult to describe. The best time to visit especially in summers is early morning say around 5-5:30 am, one gets a good darshan and also gets time to pray.
Infrastructure Is very good... unfair with common people in entry.. maintenance is very good...helping poor children by serving mid day meal program. .

Very nice and beautiful temple located on top of hills...though you have to climb the stairs to reach the main temple. There are many other small small temple...the only negative thing was when to want to exit the temple - there is to much of twist and turn as they have lot of sellers for books / toys / eatables.

One would have seen a Hindu temple in Nagara or Dravida style built entirely from stone. ISKCON has used glass in the gopuram which makes it 'modern'.
A very beautiful temple in the northern part of the city. Be sure to visit it when in Bengaluru.

Visited temple in second half of the day. When the lights were on the place looks so beautiful. Silent background chants of hare rama hare krisha and soft breeze makes the ambience super awesome. I loved this temple.

Try to visit early morning can have an glimpse of Arathi of Dieties Lord Venkateshwara ,Sri Narasimha swamy, main temple Lord krisha, an amazing and blissfull day to start with, very beautiful and simplistic temple very friendly and smiling deciples,you can join them while chanting & dancing Hare Krishna feels like you are an kid again, Pls feel free to ask for free Prasadam

ISCON also runs free mid day meal program to unprivilaged school children you can donate generously to fulfill your BIG HEARTEDNESS.

The temple complex has a beautiful Guest house, very well furnished, well maintained Rooms with courteous staff equipped with dining facilities catering divine Prasadams . Persons who are life members as well as Dharmadhikari's are provided free accomodation for specific periods. More than all these, the enchanting spiritual environment echoing chanting of "Hare Krisna...Hare Krishna..." takes you very close to the divine feet. Early morning Sacred bath to the deities should not be missed. Devotees will not get this experience any where else. We stay every year at the Guest House to enjoy this blissful environment.
Lovely ambience, no seeking alms, clean environment and lovely sanctum sanctorum. A place every one must visit in Bangalore and one visit would make it memorable.
Neatly maintained as required. It gives peace of mind when visited.Nice place to visit again and again in Bangalore.
Visiting this temple made me relax from all the excursions. Beautiful idols of Shri Radha Krishna were mesmerising.
Well maintained, nice spiritual place. This one hour journey was very nice experience. Items on sale were different and economical. View from Sheraton room attached.
Need to wear full pant or dhoti while entering to Iscon temple... Or else you need to pay 500 RS to purchase a new dhoti..Only for gents.

went there just to look at it. after reaching there it was really peaceful.Stayed there for few hors just sitting in fornt of the space of krishna statues. it really felt peaceful from inside. a totally man ki shanti.!!

The main sanctum is carved beautifully with dazzling gold and the idols of Radha Krishna is just mesmerizing. The continuous chant of the mantra and despite the presence of thousands of people is quietening. One has to walk a huge number of steps but the management staff is empathetic to let people with problems in knee use the lift.
One can sense over merchandising in some parts. But we liked to movie, the walk, the food etc really well.

My experience of ISKCON was coming from Vrindavan, however this one is very disappointing. The entrance itself will make you stand in a queue for an hour atleast and the darshan lasts only for a few minutes before you start retreating into their well coordinated shopping mall, where one can buy all devotional items. Its ok if one really wants to purchase and look around, but for those who just want a darshan are also forced to exit the same way as the shopping mall. Overall if you a real ISKCON experience try Delhi,Vrindavan or even Kolkata.

This is a very pretty temple. I am a Christian but truly enjoyed the art of the Temple. No one forces any of their rituals on you. The only thing I found bad is you have to go barefoot thru them all. Make sure to bring socks that you can throw away after,
temple shopping mall all in one place metro staation mahalakshmi nearby lots of item to purchase books cheaper

A beautifully built temple atop a shall hillock and run by the Hare Rama Hare Krishna trust. The idol is well carved and pretty looking. One can have same snacks or eat something from a host of dishes available there or do some shopping of souvenirs or religious books, CDs etc. The trust also run the free mid day meals for the needy children in various schools run by some NGOs.

Visited this temple when I was in Bangalore. Try to avoid peak days and festivals if you really want to explore this place. Very different from other traditional temples. There are a lot of souvenir shops there but make sure to compare prices before purchasing. Visited the place during November, so it was very cooling.
Had time to kill, so went to the Temple. Resulting in getting late for the next meet. The temple is beautiful. And most peaceful. The aura and the beauty of the idols is simply mesmerising.

This a huge ISKCOn temple but alas very crowded. You may enjoy the architecture but may get hassled with crowd. Also it has become very commercialized with shop selling food clothes and other items at exit

Went there on Saturday evening through heavy traffic near temple area. However luckily temple premises was not at all crowded and it was very peaceful inside.

It is well managed place like depositing footwear and cloak room facilities were good. You have to go through from 2 other temples before you reach the main temple. Main temple is very well constructed with gold and must watch.

One can buy various SEVA of different amounts like 300, 1000, 5000 rupees. I did 300 Rs. Pushpanjali Seva in which we were allowed to do darshan from one row closer than regular row. Additionally we got a special Prasadam.

Finally when you exit the main temple then its little unpleasant to go through the heavyily commercialized path where you are forced to go through various kind of shops like book-shops, sweets shops; followed by big cafeteria having food stalls.

Overall place was one time watch and OK kind of place. Don't expect WOW things to happen when you go there.

systematic q to get inside the temple.in.the first tier we can have darsan of sri narasimmar.in the second tier we have darsan of sri balaji.inthe third tier we have darsan of sri krishna and radha, befor krishnan sannadhi ,there is one big dyana mandapam,where all the devotees sit here for some minutes and chants krishna naamam. on return in every tier we have shops,we can purchase pooja things also prasadams.annadanam is also done here.a place worthseeing.

ISCKON Temple is a Hindu Temple and the one in Bangalore is one of the biggest and the best in India. It's located in Yeswantpur area right next to the Orion Mall. The architecture is modern day but has been designed keeping ancient vedic values. The main sanatorium is just too beautiful and regular prayers are held all the time. There are stay options available inside the temple premises for devotees. I have seen people from all faith and religion visiting here. So it's a must go if you are in Bangalore. Don't forget to munch on the sweets and the prasad before you leave.
My friend suggest me, you should come ISKON Temple, i went there awesome temple i really feel nice, awesome holistic place. so much follower of Lord Krishana.

ISKCON is an ICON of Bangalore and probably the 1st centre of Lord Krishna built in India. Though it's a temple with mythology lots of good music (bhajans) relieve one from stress and fatigue if one listens to it with attention, we read recently London scientists research proved music cures diseases. Children too can enjoy the story of Krishna represented in simple language pictorially. Being on modest Hill top it's serene view of Bangalore, children enjoy a lot. For elderly its true pilgrimage with beautiful temples with great culture. It has good, hygiene food to buy at the end of visit to satisfy taste buds

Suggest you don't rush the visit if you are first time visitor to enjoy thoroughly, budget 2 to 3 hours

It is one of the largest iskcon temples in the world. It is extremely clean and well maintained. The food served is excellent. It is definitely worth a visit to see especially for Lord Krishna devotees

In this busy world, sometimes its hard to find peace, when you require the most. However, to find peace you have let go few things and as you enter this temple you will do forget everything because of its beauty and hence you finally find peace in life.

Thousands of people visit this place everyday. It is difficult to differentiate between this and any other commercial establishment. People throng this place like anything. It is a man made structure and there are so many rules and restrictions. Gods over there look very artificial. It is not like any traditional south indian temple.

In any traditional south indian temple you can feel the presence of energy within the temple. I don't feel that when I visit this place. Many people like the chanting done over there "Hare rama Hare Krishna". If you are not keen on this chanting, you may find it little uncomfortable. Also at times when you are in the queue there is one temple where people keep going round 108 times chanting "hare rama hare krishna". Even if you don't want to chant you may end up being in that circle and you cannot get out of it either. Slowly you will fall in the path. Chanting is good, however if you want silence in the temple you may feel out of place.

One good thing about this place is that it is neatly maintained. There is lot of screening and the security over there are very harsh and rude. Once he started checking my cousin brother's body all over without any reason saying it is their rule. It is little awkward. Once my cousin sister was running into the temple as it was raining. They chased her and said she should be checked. Then we refused to go into the temple and came out. That is the problem with all the commercial establishment. A temple is a place of worship and if they want they can install scanners all over and not do any manual checks. It is really pathetic.

Gods are same as the ISKON gods all over. It is very difficult for South Indians to see god in such a form. Our perception about the way god looks is entirely different. If you are taking elderly people watch out there is huge walking all around especially if you are coming from the bottom. If you are parking upstairs it will reduce the walk a big. Still there is a huge walk path before you get out. There are hundreds of shops lined up to buy anything you want on lord krishna and so many eatables. Can visit if you have ample of time, otherwise can give a skip.

The institution promoted for the cause of bhakti and service stands tall. Iskcon is easily accessibly by rail, metro, buses and taxis.

The architecture is beautiful as we can see the sky through them.

Once inside the temple you would feel the warmth of God, and breeze of his love.

Yes, please chant
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare

You will be leaving the temple premises with a lot of vigour and stress free.

I suggest all to visit ISKCON Bangalore at least once in a life time

located in a very busy area, this temple is big and peaceful.

Huge temple with fountains and lighting,good to visit during cool climate.good to hear Kirtans chant hare Krishna and enter the temple.chant each time on each 108 steps.direct entry also available.deities are excellent to see.paintings on the ceiling Inside temple are excellent work to see. well mmaintained temple.hassle free darsan of Lord radha krishna;Enough parking space.;it would be very nice to visit in the evening around 6PM Pooja time too.
One of the those beautiful ISCKON temples. Enjoy the great service and meditation here. Must visit place!

ISKCON is the International Society for Krishna Consciousness founded by Swami Prabhupada to propogate the teachings of Lord krishna. They are even provided escorts by the temple authority to various areas of temple which are not accessible by Indians or HindusAfter the darshan, there are many things to do in the temple complex - you can view a animation film on Krishna in the theatre or you can visit the innumerable shops to buy the various products on sale - statues, photos, books and many other items. There are many food stalls and also a restaurant. You can even buy cakes (eggless of course). And before leaving you can savour the prasad, which is delicious. Maintenance of the temple is excellent, the place is very clean and everything is well organised.
i visited this temple but some how i fell they are more commercialize now a days. if u enter one time u have to visit on a path direction.

ISKCON temple at Bangalore is one of the city's most beautiful temples. It is situated on a hill. If you are there at the time of Aarti, you will enjoy the chants and bhajans that happen at that time. Must visit place in Bangalore once.

I have visited ISKCON (Hare Krishna) temple in Yeshwantapura, Bengaluru several times over the past 10 years. I have enjoyed all of my visits, especially when I went with family for special admissions to celebrate birthday services. These devotees enjoy front row seating for the Aarti, followed by procession and enjoy a vegetarian meal prepared and served at the temple dining hall.

ISKCON temple is located conveniently to all modes of transportation. It is within walking distance of METRO STATION (Sandal Soap Factory), and near BMTS bus station. If you bring your own vehicle, after a thorough security check, you can find ample parking available at the temple site. I would recommend leaving your foot ware in the car and walking in barefoot, or you can leave it for safe keeping at the temple-run facility.

This is a place of worship like any other, but volunteers and ISKCON employees help the devotees make an orderly progress "up" the path to the main temple. There are several intermediate loci of worship along the way. Handicapped or elderly devotees can navigate the trip with less difficulty; you just need to inform the staff of your needs.

Krishna is traditionally worshiped by chants and singing bhajans, especially since (ISKCON) is one of the recent versions of the Bhakti movement of devotion. So, the main temple is never quiet. There is always some activity going on that involves singing (live or recorded). The Maha Aarti and Procession are lively affairs that encourages active participation by devotees. This temple is not for a devotee to practice quiet meditative prayers or contemplation; there are too many visual and aural distractions around.

Temple bookstore sells a number of books and religious memorabilia, right in the main temple (in my opinion it is a bit gauche, but deadly effective at customer capture during rapture). For those devotees who are coming for the first time, it is best to attend the evening Aarti (around 7-9 PM) to enjoy the total experience. On certain feast days and holy days, the place can get awefully crowded. However, the experience of worshipping at an orderly pace without the heat, the crowds and the rush is a truly marvelous experience.

Of course I would go back tot he ISKCON temple again.

This is one of the largest temple of ISKON society and also one of worth visiting places in Banglore.Just like the others it is also unique and beautiful inside. One can have a pleasant visit to this temple with friends and family . Other places nearby are few malls like orien mall and pvr vaishnavi

a marvelous example of infrastructure in the center of city Bangalore. The best time to visit is definitely not the weekends. They should mention about the dress code on internet because it is very annoying after reaching there you get it know that your dress code it appropriate. rest all other thing is amazing.

I visited the Temple for a numbers of time. Always feel good. The atmosphere is little-bit crowded but pleasure to visit. In the early morning, the atmosphere is quite different and really gives a different feeling. I like and love the place. There is a guest house facility for the family who wishes to stay by paying a small donation. But those who are Life Members, may stay up to three nights in free of cost. Some one, interested, may try and test. Mr. Chatterjee, Manager/Receptionist of the Guest House is very helpful and friendly. He is ready to help and doing his best for the guests.
the visit to iskon on 25th of march was very inspiring fulfilling and really motivating on iscon movement

I haven't imagined that a temple can be so big and so well organized. After entering you just have to move forward and arrangements makes sure you complete your darshan in a very fine way. Just a marvelous example of infrastructure in the center of city Bengaluru. Food Court serves you a variety with no compromise in taste and quality

This is a place where u can fell the peace
Very nice architecture and nice environment for the pray and peace of mind and soul

Recommend for all

A very divine place right at the heart of many corporate offices. The temple is very nicely built. Enough parking area in the campus.

The best time to visit is definitely not the weekends.
We visited there. every thing was smoothly organised. Best thing was special darshan tkt facility. Taste of food at restaurant canteen were very good. You must visit here during your stay.
It is a neat & clean and huge temple in the northern part of city. It is well maintained temple. it has a huge hall &devotees can have darshan easily .
Nice clean place.. a mall in name of temple.. very very commercial place.. design and view is good. The fountains and plants are tastefully done!
Long time ago it was a relatively peaceful place where at least one could sit on the rocks and enjoy the scene. Now it is too touristy, flashy, noisy. Avoid this if you can.

I usually visit the temple during the closing time at around 8:15 pm. The pooja, bhajan and devotees dancing is enchanting!!! The prasad served is also yummy. It is usually less crowded at this time and my kids also enjoy.

the architecture and temple ambience will definitely mesmerize you. it will be like a different world itself..
but after you come down stairs you feel like what in the name of god this is.. it is like a shopping mall down stairs..

Nice Devine place. Being weekend it was too crowded. I guess it would be better to visit on weekday... My parents really liked it a lot. Kids were not that excited however it's important for them to see and experience this.

The ISKCON Temple on Chord Road is a lovely place. The temple and its environs are fairly clean which is a good thing. The temple itself is an amalgamation of several architectural styles and is made of different types of stones and marble. The galleries offer cool place to sit and view of the city. Perhaps the most spectacular is the sanctum which is golden hued and houses beautiful visages of the deities. We loved sitting here and basking in the atmosphere.

The exit takes you through several floors where the visitor runs through a gamut of wares that are for sale. After a nice experience in the main temple, this is a bit jarring. It seems like a tourist trap where the visitor/devotee is presented with so many items in the hope that they buy it. That is a pity for a place that focuses on devotion. These stalls could have been moved somewhere else. Even in all the traditional temples, shops being when the temple ends: below the exit steps.

The temple tends to be crowded. That the premises are clean despite the crowd is worth mentioning.
One of the best place in Bangalore. Good place for elderly peoples. Great place even for children. Also the chat centre situated at the basement is awesome. This is something that u shouldn't miss.

Good place of worship..have to see at least once ...Piece of mind...Devine

Worship lord Krishna.....
Worship with a difference. The iskon service--AArti s like a spectacular celebration of song and dance,quiet different from south indian temples.Unique
Most beautiful and peaceful place...A person has to visit in his life time..Great Devotee job by Mr Nadiya Vihari Dasa..and also Mr Srivas Gaura Dasa...
Pray, Peace, Enjoy, Eat, Shop and Feel the Difference of this Place, The Aroma of Flowers , The Aroma of Sandal Makes you Feel Cool

This is a very good divine place...worth going, rather must going.....inside environment will make you different person......grate peoples/volunteers working.....good services.....food......prasad,,,,,,,
I just love this place....

We had a one and a half hour visit to the temple. Time was spent on queuing, shopping and (maximum a third of the time) on just "being there".
We were offered the " special " tour, meaning it was not free admittance and that we were going on shopping tour inside the temple.
The temple itself is impressive and we spent 15 minutes to just sit down and participate in praying.

The temple is a huge structure with the usual soothing and divine aura that a temple has. However once you have had the darshan, you willl slowly find the temple transforming into a commercial center, with lots of food and shopping items.

The place is highly crowded with long queues. When I went there with my family it was 3:00 in the afternoon and we had to wait till 4:00PM for the gates to open.
my best place to visit in bangalore....the silence ....n the sound of hare krisna hare rama will take you to heaven

Recently on 9th March I visited this temple with my family. Temple area very beautiful. Rooms are quiet clean and well managed. Architecture of the temple was great. It is kocated centerally near Yashwantpur Railway station. prabhu parsadam so aromatic and tasty also.

i heard a lot about this temple so I just went to visit the temple. Its nicely built and beautiful. quite clean and well organized. but i didn't really like the temple in other way. they force you to be part of events, force you to buy books, have to go through all the shops to exit from temple. It gives you feel like fully commercialized.
Must visit place for tourists. In the center of city. Peaceful atmosphere. You have temple run canteen too.

One of the first things that you notice about the temple is its maintenance which is definitely a plus. The architecture of the temple is also very beautiful. Once you enter the main shrine (Lord Krishna), the aura is simply amazing. However, the stalls and the staffs who sell these items rob us of the "authentic temple visit experience" and makes it feel like a bazaar.
The temple visit is very pleasant always unless there is a crowd. The food or prasadam is very good. Must place to see in Bangalore.

it is located near to Mysore soap factory, 1-2 kms from yaswantpur railway station & tumkur haiway,near to Orion mall,mahalaxmi temple one among the famous temples in Bangalore.it is built in mountain type with all marble works,by walk it talks 20-30 minutes from entrance to top,vehicles are allowed on paid charges to go to the end point of the temple.there are multiple temples at each floor like good's balaji,Ganesha,etc.there is a special enters with paid charger of approximate 100- 200 per persons or group entery500 -1000,with special threats at the front of lord Krishna with sakalapam,prasadam & sort baggan,coplmetery books of choice, with group.there are book stalls, cds, snacks bar,sweets,served in the name of prasdams on paid charges.better don't buy as there is free distribution of prasdams at the ending floors which u will have to pass all the stall floors.it is added as a tourist spot in Bangalore.at evenings u can enjoy the lighting & view of city.i recommend to visit this temple to see the great architecture of temple & master piece of lord Krishna but don't encourage other things.(encourage commercial activates ).
Just went to take a lookout unless you are of that religion its not really worth a visit in my opinion.
The temple is absolutely clean,organised and most beautiful.... The walk upto the temple very desirable as teh deities along the way give you energy and joy.
Since i stay at nearby areas during business travel, i try and visit them during evenings for some spiritual time.. A very peaceful place..
The place is located on a hill, very neatly kept, very disciplined crowd. Note only is the place spiritually thrilling, you get excellent vegetarian food at reasonable prices.

This place is has great architecture the idol of Krishna is a treat for your eyes. On a hill top krishna temple is like a crown for the bangalore city. Amazing food served as prasadam.
One think I did not like is the quick darshan you get for a price.
More than a temple it's pure commercial place. Just can visit once. Nothing attached to pilgrimage value.

ISKCON is not like other temples , its scenic feast to eyes when you see how the idols decorated in the best way . Bangalore ISKCON is more or less same as all ISKCON temples in India . Even if you are not a person who goes to temples every day , still you can visit this once and can have good time for sure

The ISKCON Temple is certainly a must-do from my point of view. More than the religious significance, the ambience and the restaurant add charm to any visitor. One would be advised to go there when it is quieter (I do not know when!) and less hot as the heat could singe one's soles!!

The temple is not like the ordinary temples with classic architecture but this is like a modern temple. I like the place for the management and clean environment.
There are lot of stalls inside for different kind of prasad, sweets. You can buy if you wish too. They also have fast food service counter, you can purchase and enjoy the taste of sweets and snacks.
There are lot of galleries for purchasing books, toys, ornaments etc.
Loved the place. Worth the visit and a must visit place.

The place is calm and peaceful, love to spend time chanting lord krishna.
3d movie is available of lord krishna.
I would like to say , don't go there expecting spiritual experience, you will get a commercial one ...

ISKCON temple has added to Bangalore s cultural heritage. Breath taking columns stone work the theme and the natural light in the temple is an example for the traditional architecture in modern times. The mode of worship the hospitality is seen to be believed. The greatest is still the Akshaya patra which is being emulated in other parts of India
Excellent place! Very peaceful place! We had great trip with awesome simple food give with warmth & love! Worth visiting with Family & Friends!
The temple is a structural beauty in the heart of the city. Great views and pleasant visit.One time visit is recommended
went there for the first time and was amazed with the excellent architecture. I would suggest every traveller to visit this place atleast once.

This place is totally worth visiting . Have been there twice and I like the ambience .
the place is situated at a very high altitude and a person can see North Bangalore from this place . The ambience becomes quiet spiritual while chanting " Hare Rama Hare Rame Rama Rama Hare Hare " .

There is also a food court where you can get traditional odia and Bengali sweets and dishes . Must try for food enthusiastic .

I had gone there early morning and was one of the first visitors that day. The art and architecture inside the temple premises is great. A lot of steps need to be climbed and is located above the city level. Great view of the city from the top of the temple.
Located close to the Orion Mall. The temple is well maintained and you would be lost in another world when you enter the main temple. It creates an aura of silence and devotion.

ISKCON is on a mountain. We have been there several times to attend marriages etc.Veg food,authentic South Indian,is good, nice carvings n stonework. But for carvings one could try Hampi kukke Tirupathi etc.from here Orion mall is near.Awesome food cinema n boulevard etc.metro station is near. Surrounded by trashy areas. Tourists should stick to a prefixed cab if they must visit. Otherwise it's not a must visit.
Even if you are not of the temple visiting kinda person when you are on vacation, i would still recommend this place. Great place.
i had VIP tickets so the queue was not a problem. Peaceful place and nicely built. On rainy days and people with problem climbing stairs, just give a second thought to travel.

I had visited this temple last year with my friends.. Am a christian and this is the first temple am entering.. I was really excited to be there... there i could see the idols they worship and the ambience took me to some other world.. we got blessings and a tasty juice as prasadam..there were a lot of sweets available too... good experience
its just like a another Iskon temple, good place to visit for peace. Disappointed a bit with too much of commercialization.

desgiin of temple is really good

when u going inside the temple u have to cross 108 path by chanting

hare ram hare ram
ram ram hare hare
hare krishna hare krishna
krishna krishna hare hare

this make u feel really light and relax

must go with family or friends
A nice place to visit with families. A serene and clean place. Had goid and sumptuous food. Plenty of varieties of food for connoisseurs.
Feels good... right from the entrance - took the steps... short ques on the day i visited, and into the main hall - peace!
Buffet is good. Only vegetarian food. Ambience is also good. Both South indian and North Indian items are available

Beautifully built temple, well organised but it's totally into making revenue. Every thing is on sale and it feels more like a mall of worship. Pooja s are really expensive and there is special preference for people who pay more

Visited the place in Jan 2016, took the regular line for darshan, please make sure you review the timings before you go there, i reached there in the afternoon not knowing and had to wait there, till visiting hours started again at 4.30pm, 3 levels up, it was an interesting experience.
Easily left my bag pack along with laptop with security ( a plus for all fellow travellers ), loved the Prasad you get after the visit, was a tasty treat.

One place in Bangalore where u can find a modern Temple is this hare Krishna hill iskcon Temple. The chanting of hare Krishna mantra keeps Ur soul at peace. Very well maintained Temple premises. A must visit place.
i had VIP tickets so the queue was not a problem. Peaceful place and nicely built. On rainy days and people with problem climbing stairs, just give a second thought to travel.

I was really excited to be there... there i could see the idols they worship and the ambience took me to some other world.. we got blessings and a tasty juice as prasadam..there were a lot of sweets available too... good experience

Buffet is good. Only vegetarian food. Ambience is also good. Both South indian and North Indian items are available

Easily left my bag pack along with laptop with security ( a plus for all fellow travellers ), loved the Prasad you get after the visit, was a tasty treat.

One place in Bangalore where u can find a modern Temple is this hare Krishna hill iskcon Temple. The chanting of hare Krishna mantra keeps Ur soul at peace. Very well maintained Temple premises. A must visit place.

We visited this building with 2 of my groups. The buildings are all new and it seems to be the headquarters of the Hare Krishna movement in Bengaluru. There are some nice parts, but in total it made a very bussineslike impression to me.
Photography is NOT allowed and you have to leave your camera in a locker outside the Temple. You have to wear long throusers when you visit this place.I was not very impressed about the whole thing, but people with a spiritual/religious background may like it.
This is best place to visit in Evening. they organized very well and they have a restaurant inside the temple which offers satvik food at unbelievable rates.
Its near to metro station or you can book ola/uber to get here. Watch little krishna in the theater. Kheer prasadam is a must to have here.

A must visit place if you are in bangalore.
Sit in the main hall and observe the minute attention to the details in the garlands to the lord or the artistic carvings in stone and gold in the temple.
Bhajans in the main hall brings out the spiritual vibe of the place. Don't miss out checking out chaat stalls on the way out of the temple.
Unlike most other places of worship, good crowd managament and cleanliness in this temple is a special mention here.

Excellent experience ! Highly organised ! Blissful and well run ! Plus the cleanliness and surroundings highly impressed ! Prasadam
was divine
The temple is near the downtown area so it allows for some additional viewing of the city. One of many beauties in Bangalore.
one of the best place in Bangalore to visit. gives you peace and you feel like out of the world. beautiful architecture.

I have been to the temple a couple of times now and I have to say the place is well-managed. They have a place where you can buy traditional wear (kurtas etc) and other small souvenirs. The food hall is nice and has a wide variety of sweet treats. The only point which concerned me personally was that so many people seem to visit here to simply have the food and spend time on the weekends, hence in my opinion demeaning the importance of the temple worship itself.
It's a good place to visit and get some peaceful time. It offers good food options at reasonable cost.

This is the most beautiful and well organized temple. Even thought there is lot of visitors. its well strutctured to make the queue keep moving. Especially in the evening time lights will decorate the temple very nicely. And more importantly the shops inside the temple offering very large variety of food items at the Standard rates..

Really holy place.
The temple is located very close to the Yeshwantpur railway station. It is very beautiful, clean and well maintained. Prasadam Hall has very good variety.

This place is right in the middle of a busy place, but once you enter the temple, you will feel that you are in a different world. Very well maintained place and a place for peace loving people. Of course it's spiritual too, A darshan of God will swipe away all your worries and bring you back happiness.
the chanting, the crowds of believers, the architecture, and the meals served to the visitors made this place a must see.

Beautiful temple. Probably the best tourist attraction in Bangalore. Allow for two hours to make it through the passageway of shrines. There's lots of food options at the very end. Be prepared to leave your camera, backpacks and shoes at the entrance.

The place has a blend of everything ranging from spirituality, A great architectural marvel,peaceful and a perfect place for peace of mind in a hectic place like Bangalore.The entrance to the temple and the main temple situated at the top is a fine example of architectural beauty and one would always hear the continuous chanting of Hare Krishna Hare Rama everywhere.Additionally, the basement of the temple while existing, one will be able to find numerous food stalls and shops for shopping and refreshments. photography is strictly prohibited and they conduct a lot of pujas and prayers during janmashtshi (And very crowded during this time). the temple is open during evening hours and its a must visit place in case you happen to be in Bangalore.

An architectural masterpiece. A landmark for the city. A must visit for all people alike. The entire place literally transports you to a different world, full of devotion and reflection. The entire temple complex would need to be consumed through your eyes, mind and spirit, and this would need plenty of time, patience, bhakti and energy. The main prayer hall is huge and is an experience to sit through bhajans and/or pooja performances. Books, trinkets, take aways, and a myriad other Krshna products along with the rosaries and the prasadam can well be very good souvenirs for posterity. There are lots of shops selling t shirts to pens to food and one could pay attention to how they relate to the KRSHNA Consciousness and purchase accordingly. It can be quite annoying if someone is not ready, when volunteers seek donation for their several food schemes. If you have the time, just as you step out, you may seek to visit their Akshaya Patra operations area to see the massive meal scheme they run to feed millions of children. Amazing work! Amazing place! A must visit for everybody.
Great Spiritual ambience! Lovely Palki Poojas, tasty prasad for the devotees. They also conduct Children's cultural camps. Wedding Hall facility.

very nice experience .you can just feel the piece of mind here.
lots of food options.no TV, but for comfortable and spiritual stay this is best.
Very pleasant and organised crowd management! Darshan also happened pretty smooth..just keep in mind the temple closing time.

I have been here a couple of times just because my family and friends wanted to visit this place. You can see all the modern elements coupled with spirituality here, The architecture is fabulous and the temple is well maintained. You could hear people chant holy verses while climbing the stairs of the temple. The interior of the temple is well decorated and it is worth spending sometime in there. You do get a feel of spirituality once you are in. However, when you proceed outside you get to see a mall like atmosphere. If you have never visited an ISKCON temple, then you can start here. Otherwise you can just visit for watching the brilliant structure of the temple.

ISKCON was founded by Prahalad prabhupada, from Calcutta whom decided to spread Krishna's words.
It is a very religious place, with many rules and very little freedom to experiment one's individual spirituality. At the entrance you will find devotees promoting Pooja coupons and trying to sell offerings for Krishna, as well as cloak rooms to leave the camera and other bags. There's a lot of security checking and guards which are quite strict... All this sort of kills the enchantment of the place... But I guess its still interesting to see the shrine.
After the Pooja, visitors and devotees receive 'prasadam' in a leaf cup. And at the exit, you will find plenty of opportunities to buy gadgets, souvenirs, sweets, books.

There are different shrines dedicated to Radha and Krishna. The main temple with the golden shrine has ceiling paintings with Krishna's childhood events.
This is more a place where community religion is practised. In the evening, bhajans are played and devotees dance at the shrine.

Just like other ISKON temples, this one is equally beautiful and enchanting. However, something which distracts is the commercial aspects (of selling products and artifacts), right through the sanctum sanatorium. Business of faith has always flourished, but when it comes this close, it may not go down too well with everyone. Take your call, and be prepared.
It is well managed commercial temple . Lot of car parking facilities are provided . We can see the ancient art forms and culture in new version.

A huge architectural temple of Lord Krishna. It has 3 deities of Lord Krishna, Balarama and Radha.

One can listen to or chant Hare Rama Hare Krishna while climbing the stairs. The inner sanctum is wonderfully decorated. And the Aarti is a serene feeling.

Too commercial it is but a nice place to visit.
Remarkable work with granite and marbles, it speaks volumes! Added with a silent surroundings, it is amazing!

It is nice a temple of Lord Krishna. We have chant matra 108 times before entering into it. The is huge and magnificent. The beauty of architecture is just is just jaw dropping. The followers of Lord Krishna must visit this place. Ya but the things inside the temple are bit costly.

Since it was there in our list for long, had an opportunity as we had a marriage function in the temple. Good temple, but totally commercialized. take you car/taxi/auto and go to the top parking area, otherwise you will have to stand in big ques.
Very nice, clean and big temple. Not to be missed if you are nearby or on a long (even reasonably long) trip to Bangalore. A very peaceful place with the best aarti.
this is a beautiful example of Indian art, culture and Hindu religion. come here to find some inner peace and lovely vegan meals.

Iskcon is a huge temple of Lord Krishna and it has a beautifully blissful main sannidhi to which you've to go to chanting hare rama Hare Krishna on each of the 108 steps before the sannidhi. It is absolutely amazing if u sit there for evening aarti. There are shops here and many things have become commercialised. Wear salwar preferably. Leave your footwear in the car itself. There are two hotels in the property.

Very big and nice temple I visited this place five times such a beautiful place to see and pray u will feel very calmness at this place.
Very special thing is prasadam that is big laddu.

Nice location of the temple on hill
Very calm and peaceful place ...
Dont miss arti of you visit the place in evening ..
Nice food and snacks available at genuine price ...!!

Peaceful. .what I would call a temple...well maintained....beautiful. .able to pray to hearts content....

Please go

ISCKON Temple is Located in Rajaji Nagar Bangalore, I have Visited twice during my visit to the city and one of the Popular Destination to visit
Nearest Metro Station is Mahalaxmi Metro Stn, the temple is located on the Top of Hill approx. 200 stairs to walk
The Temple is Clean and Tidy and very well maintained, Usually Long Queue might be there during the festival and special days
The Temple has its Own Car Parking Premises and Shoe keeping stalls with min charge of Rs.2 per pair
The Temple is Big and Takes approx. 1 hr to complete from start to End without long queue and crowds
The Idols are Mesmerizing and Feels you closer to the God (Divine, calm & peaceful)
Kichadi Prasadam tastes good and must have
The temple also sells ladoos, souvenirs in the form of arts and handicrafts.
It has multiple food outlets with good options
Darshan Timings: 4:15 am to 5:00 am; 7:15 am to 1:00 pm; 4:00 pm to 8:20 pm.
Cameras are not allowed inside( Locker facility available next to the shoe stall)
Clicking photos is allowed outside the temple in the campus but not inside the temple.

Very nicely built temple with different traditional temple architecture of South India Good ambiance, neat & well maintained. Good darshan of lord Sri Krishna & other deities.

Interesting place to shop - clothes, books, toys, photos, idols of sri krishna.

Variety of foods were available.
This is a nice and well managed temple. same as any other Iskon temple where you can buy goodies and nice food court.
Usually very crowded, but it has been maintained clean and tidy. The prasadam I have heard is a hit or miss. But I personally have never had a bad experience.

The ISKCON Temple in Bangalore is one of the city's most famous. It has shrines of Lord Narasimha, Lord Anjaneya, Lord Garuda, Lord Venkateshwara and finally, the sanctum sanctorum featuring 6 idols of Radha - Krishna. Try and stay back for the closing pooja at 2030hrs - it's indeed a spectacle!
The temple also sells souvenirs in the form of arts and handicrafts. It has multiple food outlets. This is one Krishna experience that nourishes the mind, body and soul!

The International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) temple is huge cultural complex that was inaugurated in 1997 to carry out the vision of His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of ISKCON to promote Vedic culture and spiritual learning. The temple is built on huge hilltop.
It is very big and takes time to visit the temple. Have patience to stand in queue to worship god and after that Prasad is provided that's taste good.

Very big and nice temple I visited this place five times such a beautiful place to see and pray u will feel very calmness at this place.
Very special thing is prasadam that is big laddu.

Nice location of the temple on hill
Very calm and peaceful place ...
Dont miss arti of you visit the place in evening ..
Nice food and snacks available at genuine price ...!!

Peaceful. .what I would call a temple...well maintained....beautiful. .able to pray to hearts content....

Please go
