Very good temple, very good vegetarian food made with organic ingredients, I was surprised to see the temple clean and nice
The Iskcon temple in banglore is a lot bigger and grander than the one in Mumbai. There are several stuff you can buy just outside the main temple plus lot of goodies to eat.

Exquisite temple for mind healing and spiritual eternity. One will be pleased to see the God standing exemplary with his consorts. Good food in the mall (Yes, Shopping Mall) underground, you can shop for all goodies, books, DVDs and lot more. We enjoyed our time here. I can Easily spend time for even more than 3-4 hours.
Good place to visit for the beautiful views of the city. But you don't get a religious feeling here. Well maintained although looks very commercial.

Nice surroundings, scenic, has grand idols,, please do spend time understanding Krishna and his teachings, nice structure, ISCON is really funded well.
Please do visit.

Sri Radha Krishna Temple has deities of Radha and Krishna and five other shrines Krishna Balrama, Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and Nityananda, Venkateswara, Prahlada Narasimha, Srila Prabhupada. The temple is located at Rajajinagar, in North Bangalore, Karnataka,India. It is one of the largest ISKCON temples in the world.[3] The temple is a huge cultural complex that was inaugurated in 1997 by Shankar Dayal Sharma. The project was conceived and executed by Madhu Pandit Dasa following the wishes of HDG A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of ISKCON to promote Vedic culture and spiritual learning.
There is a gold-plated dhwaja-stambha (flag post) 17 m (56 ft) high and a gold plated kalash shikara 8.5 m (28 ft) high. Rama Navami , Sri Krishna Janmashtami , Brahmotsava are some of the main festivals that are celebrated within the temple
The temple is open from 4:15 am and remains open till 1:00 pm. In the evening the temple is open from 4:15 pm to 8:20 pm. There is free distribution of Sri Krishna prasadam to all visitors during the darshana hours.
ISKCON Bangalore provides free food to those in need.[7] The Akshaya Patra Foundation is one initiative started by members of the temple, which has received praise from United States President Barack Obama for feeding and educating children across India.

Beautiful temple with devine deities. the mangala aarti, and shayanna aartis are beyond material experience. The temple is well managed , clean and located on a small hillok called harekrishna hill. Can be crowded in weekends and special days. please visit for devine darshan of Radha Krishnachandra
Temples are losing their sanctity. I wish the energies were stronger but this place feels like a modern shopping mall.
I have visited this temple with my family. this is best place for peace of mind. very beautiful temple of lord krishna. very good arrangement of darshana. prasadam were also yummy.

The Temple is well maintained. After visiting the Lord, on your way back you have to mandatorily visit all the Souvenir shops. If you are lucky you will get free prasadham as well... and if you are on time; Lunch also...

Cool and calm in all around the temple. Very tidy and systemic. Main mandir is decorated very nicely and evening praying will give you peace in mind. Spending time sitting in floor gives you internal peace.

The Prasadam is awasome
Had been there two times now... good Q arrangement (no doubt as it is ISKON).. good n yummy prasadam.. pleasant feeling after darshanam :)

Exquisite temple for mind healing and spiritual eternity. One will be pleased to see the God standing exemplary with his consorts. Good food in the mall (Yes, Shopping Mall) underground, you can shop for all goodies, books, DVDs and lot more. We enjoyed our time here. I can Easily spend time for even more than 3-4 hours.
Good place to visit for the beautiful views of the city. But you don't get a religious feeling here. Well maintained although looks very commercial.

Nice surroundings, scenic, has grand idols,, please do spend time understanding Krishna and his teachings, nice structure, ISCON is really funded well.
Please do visit.

Sri Radha Krishna Temple has deities of Radha and Krishna and five other shrines Krishna Balrama, Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and Nityananda, Venkateswara, Prahlada Narasimha, Srila Prabhupada. The temple is located at Rajajinagar, in North Bangalore, Karnataka,India. It is one of the largest ISKCON temples in the world.[3] The temple is a huge cultural complex that was inaugurated in 1997 by Shankar Dayal Sharma. The project was conceived and executed by Madhu Pandit Dasa following the wishes of HDG A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of ISKCON to promote Vedic culture and spiritual learning.
There is a gold-plated dhwaja-stambha (flag post) 17 m (56 ft) high and a gold plated kalash shikara 8.5 m (28 ft) high. Rama Navami , Sri Krishna Janmashtami , Brahmotsava are some of the main festivals that are celebrated within the temple
The temple is open from 4:15 am and remains open till 1:00 pm. In the evening the temple is open from 4:15 pm to 8:20 pm. There is free distribution of Sri Krishna prasadam to all visitors during the darshana hours.
ISKCON Bangalore provides free food to those in need.[7] The Akshaya Patra Foundation is one initiative started by members of the temple, which has received praise from United States President Barack Obama for feeding and educating children across India.

Beautiful temple with devine deities. the mangala aarti, and shayanna aartis are beyond material experience. The temple is well managed , clean and located on a small hillok called harekrishna hill. Can be crowded in weekends and special days. please visit for devine darshan of Radha Krishnachandra
Temples are losing their sanctity. I wish the energies were stronger but this place feels like a modern shopping mall.
I have visited this temple with my family. this is best place for peace of mind. very beautiful temple of lord krishna. very good arrangement of darshana. prasadam were also yummy.

The Temple is well maintained. After visiting the Lord, on your way back you have to mandatorily visit all the Souvenir shops. If you are lucky you will get free prasadham as well... and if you are on time; Lunch also...

Cool and calm in all around the temple. Very tidy and systemic. Main mandir is decorated very nicely and evening praying will give you peace in mind. Spending time sitting in floor gives you internal peace.

Owsome peace full temple. Nice library collection of all kinds of Indian language. some holy book is sell huge discount with calendar type photo....we have purchase gujarati language Bhagvat Gita.
One of the best ISKCON temples I have been to with a peaceful environment. As always, the prasad is something we all look forward to.

Exquisite temple for mind healing and spiritual eternity. You will be pleased to see the God standing exemplary with his consorts. Good food in the mall underground, you can shop for all goodies, etc.... enjoyed our time here. You can Easily spend time for even more than 2.5 hours.... heading music was great to hear. You will only enjoy these if you are a spiritual person with some liking towards goodies, foods, books, etc... we purchased a life wellness book just for Rs. 20/- named IQ, EQ, SQ... I recommend this medium sized book to you as this explains the essence and morality of the world and our life in this world. Almost for all problems in life you could find some solutions in some ways from this book. This is not generally sold in the books section; when you return after seeing the God to the downstairs, near the ramp, a man or woman will be sitting. You have to ask them specifically for this book. There will not be any displays. Hope you get that. Enjoy you time...... :)
Peaceful place to visit and you will enjoy the beauty so i will suggest everybody to visit here nothing much
The temple has some power which just lifts your spirit even if you are tired and exhausted. Visit and feel the power.

This temple is a modern and Majestic temple build by ISKON on a small hillock called Krishna Hills. It has got a mixture of borth south Indian and North Indian culture.. But You get peace when you enter this temple. At the same time some ISON dvotees are chasing us for donations for their various schemes.

This is the perfect example of weatherization our culture.. in short how you can sell god in a mall.. I used to visit lot of places in world.. here I will take an example of universal studio Singapore.. you visit any show in universal world where once show is over then they will direct you to another room where you can purchase toys and other items based on those show themes. In ISKCON also I feel more than god there business empire built around it.. not against building like this but I am not used to see place or worship and business area together.. it worth one time visit ...
I have been visited 3 times , and feel again n again to visit this place , those are coming to Bangalore for any reason should visit this temple.
The place is Spirtually enlightened. Although there is always crowd but still you feel calm an serene inside the temple.

I have visited this temple at least 5 times along with visiters comming to my place as I stay in Bangalore. All the time when I visited the temple was crowded. You can find peace and tranquility inside the temple especially if you search for it
the place is managed very well. Every time I go there I felt that this place is run a bit commercial. God does not need money. God bestows love and kindness to all, it permeate into each and everything in the Universe. This is left to each persons perception. However you will have a good experience of the visit to this temple

Temple is located at Heart of City, good arrangement for Darshan in discipline manner.
When i reached finally at main temple , this was amazing & inner voice force me to stay more time at temple.

You must buy some inventory available for sale ( Books/ Pandel), before exit not forget to take awesome Prasad .
If you believe in spirituality .. This place is ideal for you. one must visit if have time while you are in Bangalore.
The place is beutiful, god's idols nicely decorated. You do get devotion and wants to stay more in this place. Place atop a hill and must visit place.

i went there once with one of my friend and trust me till the time i stayed in Bangalore for over 2 years, i used to visit this place once in every 3 months... amazing place for finding that peace and relaxation away from a busy metro life... loved to be here.. :)
The temple is neat and clean and less crowded. Good place to visit with the family though the whole temple looks a bit commercialised

I've visited this place on quite a few occassions. It is ideal however to go on a weekday when the crowds could be less and you can take your time to move around the tempe. Do go through the 108 chanting steps in your first visit, it gives you that spiritual feel. Also a nice visit for international visitors to bangalore to get a feel of our temples.
The religious and spiritual book collection is extensive at their stores.
Do try their free lunch for the devotees, it is simple yet so satvik and fulfilling.
They also have counters where you can buy various snacks and eats, all vegetarian.

definitely not for south indian devotees...seeing this temple you will not have the feeling of being inside an temple since the entire architecture and their attitude makes you feel as you are inside an mall for shopping...they just try to milk your money as much they can

It's different. It's not the architecture that amazes people - its modern. Don't expect an ashram like atmosphere, its nearly in the middle of the city and can become quite populous. If you have been to south Indian temples (I have been to hundreds of them), you'll notice the difference in culture (or rather methods) of prayer and construction. This is unlike other temples around. It's worth a visit if you haven't been to an ISKON before.

This is not a temple by any standard...its a business institution. Sure it is clean with a nice ambience....those things are also available in decent hotels. Everything in there looks fake to the T. The exit area is a shopping mall. If you want glitz and glamour in a temple in the form of huge deity idols and mechanized dances then this is a sure place. Most people go there to eat free prasads, to enjoy the ambience and walk around like in a shopping mall.
Very peaceful temple with hare rama chanting. the visit to various temples inside the temple is memorable.Inside the temple, the main diety is wonderfull and never forgettable in life.

Temples are really the treasure of India and I felt like this temple is one of the best. I could reconnect with my Divine !

Went to ISKCON with friends first time long back and was awed by their construction and maintenance. Most of it all the music ,decoration and beauty if the idols in this temple leaves you spell bound every time. It had good parking space and good food options too. As we went early in Sunday morning not much crowd was there.

It was really an amazing experience my uncle visited this place and told me not to miss diwali celebration of this temple. I went on diwali nigth. It was amazing experience with excellent cracker show and prayers beautiful decoration and temple...
felling religious.
Don't miss it.
Its better to visit in the early morning or late evenings as you do get parking space inside the temple. If there happens to be a long queue and you have a kid, your request will be well entertained.

This isnt much of a spiritual temple as much it is a commercial hub, but the view of the main hall is totally worth it in the end. The beautiful mandapa with those astounding idols and the breathtaking view of the hall and paintings on the ceiling do make it worth the long lines and numerous stairs. A must visit place with family specially if you have people who love temples and all. Do not worry about the stairs as for elder people they provide an auto service at the gate which will directly drop them off at the doors of the main temple. I wouldn't recommend buying any souvenirs from there as everything is fairly overpriced at the stalls inside the temple. You can get almost everything for a lot cheaper price inside the city or around shops in that area.

This temple has started a noble program to feed under privileged children who used to drop out of the school at a very young age. The attraction of a hot, hygienic and taste mid day meal has made thousands and thousands of children to come back to school. This method of serving the society not only took care of malnutrition but also basic education to the most needy.
Apart from the social cause, the night pooja should not be missed to see the glory of divinity. It will take out all stress, anxiety and negative thoughts from mind even if witnessed once. If your are believer of Lord Krishna and have not visited don't miss out.
Modern Temple and quiet place to spend time in solitude.Several steps to climb. Souveniers to purchase. Nice restaurant at the exit.

I have visited the temple quite a lot of times. Sometimes with friend/s, and at times with family and every time I found it worth place if u desire for a nice, peaceful, relaxing and involving kinda a place. In the evening its even more nice to be there coz of the large open space and since its situated on a little heights. It is a good option if you are religious and also good one if you are not religious as such. The idols of God and the entire architecture inside the main temple is said to be made out of gold. And there are many stalls also inside after darshan. You can either purchase some thing for your dear ones or you can also have some paid snacks. The vendor side can't be said as bad but then nothing too special for eatables they sell and the rates they charge. And the end of it,.. as always prasadh is really good and tasty.

Its a place to get good spiritual experience.
Normally ISKCON is known for its Akshaya Patra program. Where thousands of School Children are fed. They have a very big automised kitchen which is very clean and hygenic. Temple Complex is quite huge.
What we liked more is the Abhisheka Seva on every Friday for Lord Srinivasa and every Saturday for Prahallad Nrisimha. It happens around 05.20 am and lasts for 20-25 minutes. Its a paid Seva limited to 5-6 couples and their family of 4 members. As it is performed very early in the morning members can book accommodation at the Guest House at a reasonable rate. GH is very spacious and can accommodate 6 members in bigger rooms. We have 2 and 3 bed rooms also,
We have participated in this Seva on 4 occasions.
The main event days are -- Annual Brahmotsava, Vaikunta Ekadashi and Kartik Deepotsava.

This is a busy temple and usually crowded, however attending the aarti or the kirtaan gives a sense of inner peace and tranquil. The food one can buy here is excellent (vegetarian without onion and garlic with egg free desserts)!

One of the attraction in bangaloe The propel who Devotes of lord krishan Must visiting place with in 7 Am in the morning afterwords its like pick nick Spots The Main Radha Krishnal and shrinivas temples are very attractive ands whiching in the early morning is very nice if you fell we are in the enchanting moments of Lord Shri Krishana

A worthwhile place to visit with family. The temple is well planned and ambience is very pleasant The place is neat and tidy. It's better to avoid rush hours otherwise it will take a very long time to complete. The location is well situated and its easily accessible now as there is a metro station nearby. It's worth a visit...

While they do take donations, the temple is free and quite beautiful inside. They feed countless school children every day as well with a network of trucks. After the temple tour, you have to walk the gauntlet of commercial sales of religious nick knacks and sweets, however there is a short cut out for frequent visitors and there is no high pressure sales here. The restaurant called Higher Taste next to the temple is pure veg and quite good ( tried a la carte menu but they also have a buffet).

We went to Bangalore Iskcon with my husbands parents. It was quite a spiritual experience. The campus is very serene and clean. There is also a place to eat and have refreshments. Members of Iskcon also have accommodation facility inside the campus.

It's hard to review a religious structure especially when you're not of that religion. So I can only say that- it was much bigger and cleaner than any other Hindu temples I have been to. If you want to be treated like VIP, just be ready to shell out more for the entrance fees. I was surprised there was such a thing. Those who are able to pay more get the best seats in the temple. You'll be guaranteed a seat in front of those who paid less than you did.

Definately a must see but no photos allowed so you can't share with friends, but culturally A must. Probably the most spectacular temple in Bangalore if is located in a very built up area close to one of the main shopping districts.
A beautiful temple. Very nicely built and kept clean. The greenery around is also well maintained. A must visit for all.
Very nice temple - Must visit for the built and architecture of the place - Also very good place for fresh food on the food court of temple - will recommend the place if you are in Bangalore.

I visited this place with my friends. We came as a gang of around 8 people and it was our first outing in bangalore. Since we dint plan for any major outing on the day, we decided to visit ISKCON to spend the day. This place is more of a commercial spot than Spiritual. Of Course, this place is great for those who are in for spirituality. But for all the others who just want to spend a day with friends or family with affordable good food this place is ideal. The temple has huge halls decidated for commercial establishments... As you tour across the building you will find food items at low cast and some beautiful art pieces as well. So, go on and enjoy your evening hangout with friends and families at this wonderful place with two advantages 1. Soak in Spirituality, 2. Also have a Commercial feel with the shops available there and nearby. 2 in 1 at one place.

Week ends& public holidays are pretty crowded.not to worry.good crowd control; order maintened throughout.you can have Darshan at Lord narasimha's temple; then Tirupathi balaji&finally radha /Krishna. Clean,well maintained premises.after Darshan,one can shop for religious books/souvenirs&other gift items. Lots of eateries selling snacks on the way out.definitely worth a visit.

Discipline at every step makes this temple unique from others. They make you chant the krishna mantra which you will start repeating it without your consciousness and I guess thats when you feel the Krishna Consciousness.
Cleanliness is seen every where in the temple which takes it close to godliness.
The view of god from the big doors makes you feel the darshan realistic and decoration of the idol is beyond words.

Avoid visiting on holidays and festivals and plan to visit in the evening so that you can see it when it lights up to make the experience more beautiful.
The ISCON temple located in West of chord road is nice place. it offer spiritual expirience and knowldge. The temple architecture is leasing and ambience is good. The food is tasty and healthy.
Best place to catch up the peace of mind. Its brings a holiness to life and and art of loving people.
Been here 2-3 times with family and friends . Good place to have some peaceful spiritual time . Must visit for visitors who are coming for few days to bangalore

Not a 'traditional' indian temple. But great place to spend some religious/spiritual time.
They tried to achieve the international standard on most of the amenities. The book stall has got a limited but good collection of books (regional languages also). Good shopping place, food court and cinemas.

A local colleague brought us to the temple. Upon arrival purchasing the entrance tickets we were told shorts were not allowed. Thankfully they have a solution for that. At security you can get your 'skirt' on for a minor deposit fee. It is kept very clean, which is nice considering you will be barefooted.
Go with flow, you will get a very good treatment, be carefully of pickpocketing.
At the end, enjoy the market, the food, and you will have enjoyed another Incredible India moment.

The temple is situated up a flight of stairs and is terraced. You can drive up to a certain point and park. I am not sure if two wheelers are allowed in. I have been here by public transport.
The interior is beautiful and you can sit in the temple for a long time and contemplate. The feeling of being in a spiritual place can be felt here.
As you exit the main temple and walk down you will see several shops with gifts and sweets. On some occasions, you will also be invited for lunch as part of some celebrations. The lunch is free, though.
One of the best location and also great place to stay and amazing deities to take Darshan. Must visit if one goes to Bangalore
I stayed two days in iISKCON temple. Morning pooja is very good and night closing bajana's is very good.
A must visit place in Bengaluru. Located near Rajajinagar, this place is pristine and spectacular. A must visit for all spiritual and non spirituals!

This is place we visit quite often with our parents. The big lure is the ability to connect with our spiritual side using Lord Krishna's tales and teaching. Most people chant his name 'Hare Krishna Hare Rama Krishna Krishna Hare Hare' to build their concentration on the present and the glory of the place. If one is lucky to visit during evening one can be part of the Arti as well. The grandeur of the temple is that it overlooks a hill and is away from the humdrum. The peace and tranquility is a welcome break.

The ladoos and the sweets inside the temple complex are good too. The free prasad at the exit is usually a very tasty dish of either khichdi or a sweet deal which round off the good experience. The parking is always full and one needs to be resourceful to find a vacant spot. However, the temple security are helpful.

If one can brave the yeshwantpur traffic to reach here I would say this place is a good pilgrimage spot within the city limits.
Temple is very clean. They promote ISKCON. Lot of free space. Children can enjoy. When you come after darshan there are lot of stalls which gives food, little costly but very good quality.

wow this is beautiful big temple, we went there and it was rainy, as it is marble floor you need to be careful getting if it is wet floor, there was lot of bhajans going on inside and on the way out there were lot of gift shops and yummy food for sale.

It's in mid of the city (so not like the hundreds of years old temples in far away scenic serene place)..neat and clean.. crowd well managed (yes yes, they have a VIP line for quicker entry if you pay the extra fees, and i do not like it: i like the temple where every one is equal)..rich temple with gold plated areas.. then while exiting have to come through the small selling mall.. but i must thank for the free prasad (khichidi) they served to all at exit.. tasty and eatable and well arranged..

It's always interesting to see religious sites. To a foreigner who has never experienced a Krishna temple before, it is quite different. I was not allowed to bring my camera in (gave it to my driver), and I had to take my shoes off early on -- so I walked in socks quite a distance. There were aisles for lines, and the lines were quite long to get in (afternoon), but I was early so I was near the front. There was also a sort of special lane (fast pass), where some got to go first. I was surprised to see that a couple of people at the front of this special lane took photos, as did another person in my line with a smartphone. Meanwhile, there was a loud Krishna chant played over and over that enhanced the experience. It was interesting to see the pujaris (priests) in the temples, and the religious d√©cor was fascinating. As I started the long walk down the hallways to the exit, I was surprised to see numerous long tables with many items (books, etc) for sale, as well as an entire room full of food items. Finally, make sure you remember where you dropped your shoes off.
Temples should not be under rated. Never! But the mall kind of structure that they have created inside makes it look more like a commercial complex than a temple.

The Bangalore ISKCON is a beautiful temple located in Rajajinagar. The ambiance inside is nice and peaceful although large groups of unruly people visiting this temple may sometimes make it chaotic. Visit this temple around the evening for a soothing experience.
Do visit this temple if going to Bengaluru for trip. Nice architecture with peaceful environment and prayers going on to make this place more live. True devotees must visit to gain religious values.
want peace,.,, just visit this shrine & relax for a while... Join bajans, great relief & peace of mind you can attain. Traffic is high as always but must visit

We visited the temple during afternoon time and was less crowded. The Bangalore ISKON temple is huge and very well maintained. This temple was inaugurated by Late Shankar Dayal Sharma, the former president of India. Main features of the temple include gold-plated flag post and gold plated kalash shikara. The main hall where the deities are placed is nicely designed. The environment inside the temple is peaceful and noted devotees including foreigners singing Hare Krishna Hare Rama. There is no entry fee except nominal charges at shoe stand. The exit from the main temple is through a series of shops that sell books on Sri Krishna in several Indian languages and several merchandise as well. There are various shops that sell eatables / snacks. Also well connected with public transport.

The peace and tranquility is a welcome break.

The parking is always full and one needs to be resourceful to find a vacant spot. However, the temple security are helpful.

If one can brave the yeshwantpur traffic to reach here I would say this place is a good pilgrimage spot within the city limits.
Temple is very clean. They promote ISKCON. Lot of free space. Children can enjoy. When you come after darshan there are lot of stalls which gives food, little costly but very good quality.

wow this is beautiful big temple, we went there and it was rainy, as it is marble floor you need to be careful getting if it is wet floor, there was lot of bhajans going on inside and on the way out there were lot of gift shops and yummy food for sale.

We were not informed that we could enter the premises with our car from a different entrance so my mother had a difficult time climbing the never ending steps through security, shoe collection etc. The whole visit has been made so clinical that the spirituality is lost !

This temple is beautifully built.but whenever you go , you need to go through long que as this place is too famous.
You can buy prasad and some god idols, pendants etc for your near and dear ones.Must visit.

ISKCON had always fascinated visitors with a fusion of modern and traditional flavors in their temples and this is no exception. A well-maintained temple that will certainly enthuse people obsessed with cleanliness as most Hindu temples are not as clean and tidy as an ISKCON temple.

This was a nice experience for me to visit this place, this is a most to visit in Bangalore but also you can find ISKCON templetes along India.

The place is good but it is too modernize, but at least is agood place to visit and know about this religion, lunch is provided for free there (it is included on the entrance payment)

You can also get nice souvenirs and religious things there

Temple is excellently built up with idols of deities situated in the step manner. Also the ambiance inside the temple is relaxing and soothing. There are various options available with regards to pooja, darshan, aarti etc with various prices. Also it houses one of the best restaurants of the city i.e. Govindas and along with that it provides various options to shop as well.
It's absolutely worth the visit if you are in Bangalore. It is a tad "commercial" -- bazaar, etc at the end -- but it is a beautiful place.

The temple is just too good. The breeze that flows into the main temple makes it a great experience. There is also a bookstall inside the temple where they sell religious books, hotels are also there but a bit costly, I felt. Over alll, a great place to visit

Very Nice Temple on the Chord Road and run by ISKCON.
Well maintained and a nice place to visit
Food is good in the restaurant.

Excellent International facilities provided But no feeling of Divineness, very mechanical way of Dancing and chanting, lapse of holiness and serenity is missing External lavish maintenance beauty is visible. BUt inner voice is not heard Two Halls are well maintained, Food is excellent and delicious but too commercial also.

Its a beautiful place so is the idols. It was really hard for me to take my site off the idols as they were mesmerising and can make anyone feel that they are in an eternal life.

However hard to get the feeling of being in a temple. Never seen a place where they sell products into the temple, in and around the place where we pray.

Good place for Hindus to visit.It is Krishna's temple.Nice photogenic place.Management may create the stress by making you go through queue etc though its not so good but a good place visit especillay around evening.
ISKCON temple is a landmark in Bangalore. It is a good place to visit to spend some quite time. It is well connected with the metro and buses and easy to locate.
NIce place to visit, I believe its more modernized than spirituality I was expecting. The calmness, purity of holy place is missing.

We visit ISKCON temple quite often as it gives you a very calm and peaceful mind once you start chanting Hare Rama Hare krishna at 108 steps while moving abd climbing steps towards main temple.Ambience is very good and well maintained inside.Especially palaki utsav they perform at 8 pm in the night after Aarti.
A must visit place when you are in Bangalore and if you like to visit temple.
Good Temple in City with all aminities like Theatre, Resaurant, Food Court, Book Stall etc, and for senior citizen there are a facility of wheel chair and lift also.

Must visit while in Bengaluru. To retrospect our inner thoughts and feel the Lord within us. Word are not enough to express the blessing we receive from GOD. One has to feel the spirituality. Simply , WE move towards GOD.
Best ISKCON temple I seen till now. nice place and good food they offer. you need at-least 2 hours for Darshana in weekend.
A very neat & clean temple inspite of the rush of devotees. It felt as if I was spiritually connected to God.If you are in Bangalore then you should certainly visit this temple
good temple in bangalore i liked it radhakrishna temple super i wanted visit again when bangalore comes

Very peaceful place... I make it a point to visit this place during non rush days... The main hall is really superb... Commercial place is optional.. But good to visit if you like something to buy...

Hare Rama-Hare Rama- Rama Rama Hare hare... Hare Krishna hare Krishna ... Krishna Krishna hare hare...... this is the tune that keeps ringing in your mind. There are various temples in step wise ... The various avartar of Lord Vishna.. like Balaji, ram and Krishna and brother Balram, Radha Krishna idols placed in the temple. But once you finish with temple as you exit there are so many shops under the tomb of the temple that sells everything from flowers to food. The temple has free lunch prasad from 12:00 pm to 2 : pm.
Beautiful temple like other Iskcon temples across.. has rush since this is in top 5 places to visit in Bengaluru.. however, I have other even more beautiful temple like that in mumbai.
It has the Pleasent feeling of being in a temple,although it was in prime area still they was so godliness.Chanting n Bhajans are very spiritual...

We went there two days before on Navratri ashtami. Not aware of its height and so much zig zag lines even for shoes . And that's for that morning when there was not a single person to visit.no rush no people. There can be short cut way to enter the temple when there is no one , like in airports when there is rush on a particular day they stretch the lines in a zigzag long way .but when there is no rush they cut short. We are senior citizens and heart patients but not the security told us ,not any sign of lift there.we were so much exhausted in climbing three floors height long long paths .after reaching so much height we asked some one there about any other way to go down then he told yes there is a lift there. We were very much surprised and felt bad of their carelessness for not thinking of devotees. These stairs and long paths should be used only on festivals. I request the management to take care of these comforts to public.
One of the finest architecture in town... You don't feel like a temple until you see the idols.. A temple with modern touch.
Very nice temple. Number of things were admirable, but the siprit of actual service is negligible. That's my observance.
It was wonderfull to darshan radha mandir.i thought it might be similar to juhu temple but i was wrong.such a systemetic n no pandas were behind you

I went there for the morning Darshan Worship at 7 am. It was very interesting to see all these people dancing and singing. I had never seen this kind of Worship and it was quite impressive!
The temple in itself is not as interesting as I thought. It is big but the architecture is not really spectacular, like in an ancient temple. After the ceremony which lasted about 20 minutes there was nothing more to do.
But it was free!
Really maintained well temple. Feel blessed by god after chanting more than 108 times God's Name. Will definitely visit againg.

Was great to be there for prayers. I really feel happy to see the way the temple management handle the situation during the buzy time. Devotees can have a great meditation moments here. Gift shops are plenty and offers best price for the items.
This temple is a grandeur, such peaceful ambience. A must go if you are in Bangalore! Every deity in the temple is a splendour of its own. Calm environment!

Place is just situated at the entrance of Bengaluru. This is an unique place and ISCON is the place where you will see the God after reaching atop after stepping up steps. The temple is beautifully constructed nd there is no other ISCON will beat Bengaluru. You will definitely love the real idols of Radha-Krishna, Chandra, Venkateswara in one unique place and actually feels like visiting GOD which is most memorable in life. Every human being should visit this historic place and get the blessings of God to reach the ultimatum in life. Especially this holy place in world will be loved by every one. Ultimately amazing and excellent. Let God bless every individual to reach this holy centre to get blessings and peace in life.

One of the well maintained temple, with free Prasad and lunch from 11.30 to 2PM. Good for family outing on weekend. Have good eatery like bakery with egg less product, good Sweets, shop for pooja items, very good brass products.

When you are visiting a temple a thought on mind is devotion to god, but as soon as we see the exit which is where all the flea market feeling creeps in, to avoid that I had visited temple in the fist place, But this is more than a food street, I got confused if god was sitting at the right place.

Well its your wish what you think, no doubt the place is clean and holy, but again most of the devotees only visit for eating i suppose.

Well after that i thought did I just say
Hare Raam ..... or Hey Raam....
if you know what I mean....

Visited the temple again after a very very long time and it was a major disappointment. Too commercialised now and has lost its charm. The idols itself within the temple, yes thats the ony charm to the place now.

Want to reflect on many things but still want to have some good lunch after? Want to be in the company of God but buy some gifts for family on the way out? To top all that, want good parking options and cleanliness? ISKCON temple is the place to go!
I enjoyes spending time in iskon, Since the bhajan will be too good, we will get peace of mind, Person willing peace of mind can go and hear the bhajan and enjoy
Visiting the place is really nice experience as this is magnificent temple. Separate entry for foreigners make it easier for people that are not visiting for praying.
An heaven on earth. One of a must-visit place in Bangalore. Has a well relaxed ambiance that anyone would crave. Hare krishna!

This is a must visit temple if one is at Bangalore. It is in a central and convinient area for one to visit. There is ample parking space. Cameras,mobiles etc. are not allowed and need to be deposited at their counters. Chappals are also to be left in the stands. Lift facility is available for senior citizens. It has a que system and depending upon the crowd some times darshan may be little delayed. Very good ambience inside the temple. The main Deities are Sri Radha krishna,
Sri krishna Balaram. Besides Balaji and Narasimha swamy as also that of Anjaneya and Garuda are seen before entering into the main temple. All are quite beautiful. There is chanting of Hare Rama and hare krishna.
Temple timings as per the board displayed : 04.15 am to 1.00 pm and 04.30 pm to 08.30 pm
A good variety of food items are available in their cafetaria at a price on the returning path. Shopping mall is also there .
Free lunch prasad is served from 11.30 to 2.00 pm and one has to take tokens for this. Paid lunch at Rs.40/- is also available same time at their restaurant near parking area.

Iskcon temple is a lovely place to visit, even with the crowds all around, standing in queue and passing by in the first queue in front of the God... the feeling is great and the aarti time is marvelous... you almost transition to a different sphere... After the temple visit, rest comes as a shopping complex, a lot many shops (will definitely some of the market streets of Bangalore) and even more eatery outlets, where you get all kind of snacks... Some are good like the ones with the paintings, artifacts depicting various Gods... Other than that... cleanliness is to be improved a bit in the crowded eatery areas (can't blame the temple staff as people from all walks of life visit the place)...

I really loved the Temple. I went on a Sunday so it was really crowded, but it is really worth it. The inside is beautiful and the environment is incredible.
The only down side is that you can't take cameras inside. But I really doubt I'll be forgetting the experience.

A spiritual visit up on hills.

Warning if you are going during noon, you might get foot burn after stacking your slipper outside the temple.

Recommend running up to the stairs as soon as possible.
It's quiet and you can connect to your inner soul.

On my Banglore business trip after meeting i was at Iskcon temple. That temple built awesome all views from every point was make a new imagination. I recommend all my friends and relative to visit this temple.
HARE KRISHNA HARE KRISHNA,
KRISHNA KRISHNA HARE HARE,
HARE RAMA HARE RAMA,
RAMA RAMA HARE HARE.

Visited with family in July 2015. The family consists of strong believers, not so 'strong' ones, moderately devout and pure touristas! ( as all families consist!) But all of us enjoyed the outing . There are elaborate arrangements for storage of your footwear and an ingenious system for washing the feet of the devotees as you walk in... The architectural marvel is right in the heart of the city. For the devout, there is definitely the "presence" the ambiance of the Supreme Being, amidst all the hustle and bustle of the crowd and the some-what un-subtle commercialization. If you are going because you are a firm devotee, please select a less crowded time like early mornings or afternoons, certainly not evenings in the week end.. There is a separate circuit for the believers, where you move from step to step chanting the prayer, which is moving and thought provoking, if you have the time. Don't get into that loop if you are there for a quick dekko and exit. There is a VIP darshan, which is not fair to the regular devotees, but alas, a fact of life. Also the commercialization could be made a bit more unobtrusive..... Otherwise we really soaked up the atmosphere and the magnificence and opulence of the deities. Please keep up the cleanliness and hygiene....Thanks
There were many pilgrims and we were advised to be careful of pick pockets. Like many tourists spots there seemed to be the never ending souvenir opportunities.

We visited this place on the night of Janmashtami. The atmosphere was electric and the temple was filled with devotees. The entire function was very well managed and it was a really refreshing experience overall.

Aesthetically designed modern temple. Situated atop a hill, this provides a great view of the surrounding areas of Bangalore. You could witness the Akshay Patra Kitchen here, which is humongous in size and caters to the dietary needs of needy children across Bangalore. Unlike other temples, it has a fine dining vegetarian restaurant and many other facilities for visitors.

temple with great view and reituls performing on daily basis
accomidation for members avilabale,food in diffrent levels with veriety in line of hygine and qulity

Truly well managed temple with super luxurious vegetarian restaurant, superb guest house and ample parking space is a must visit for the tourists. Very good ambiance inside the temple. World Trade Centre, Orion Mall, Columbia Asia Hospital, Brigade Apartments, Phoenix West One and posh residential Malleshwaram Area is nearby.

Iskon Temple have number of pujaris who worship the dieties according to vaishnava tradition. Iskon is popular by the name of Sri Sri Radha Parthasarathi Mandir devoted to Lord Krishna and Radharani.The museum inside the mandir is well equipped with complex modern technologhy spreading knowledge about vedic culture.The temple echoes the chanting of maha mantra "Hare Ram, hare ram. ram ram,hare hare, Hare krishna ,hare krishna .Krishna krishna,hare hare " leaving one mind,body and soul pure and tranquil.its a beautiful temple and a must see in the city

Iskcon Bangalore is a beautiful temple, huge and really attractive. The atmosphere is very calm and gives a peace of mind. A must visit in sight seeing places if you're visiting Bangalore. It has a queue to reach the main temple though it doesn't take much time. The queue is organized and maintained really well. The idol of the main deity is beautiful and seems to provide an aura.

Temple is structured, walk through it is organized. Good place to sit and ponder. Great eats in their cafeteria. One gets the feel that it is quite commercial, but, then they are trying to propagate their belief, I guess. It is for you to decide to join the bandwagon or not!

We went on krishan janamshtmi
though it was rush there which was expected but everyone gping in queue. it looks good.
mandir was decorated veey nicely.
Must visit if you go to bangalore.

I had being to this temple several times with family. You feel something different when you visit it. Avoid visiting during peak days as it may not give the feeling of calmness and space to view inside the temple.

Lot of parking space is available and do not park outside premises as it may towed area its kind a busy area since Yeshwant railway station is next to it. Also for shopping Orion mall is near by and if you have Metro wholesale card, is just next to the premises.

You have walk up to the main entrance and there are lots of small temples on the way up. For senior citizens and parents will small babies, there is lift available near the parking area which takes you to the main temple. You can ask to the parking staff about it.

Also good variety of food is available inside the premises which is always tasty :).

To reach ISKCON, should not be headache as anyone can take bus which is on the way to Yeshwantpur from any location of Bangalore city. Note, there are chances no direct buses are available and you can change buses from Majestic or Shivajinagar bus depot if required.

Must visit for people you wish to see in and around Bangalore.

Interesting, a little crowded, but worth the time for a modern Hare Krishna experience, if you happen to be in this part of town. I'm not sure I'd go out of my way, but it's interesting and a good contrast to more historical venues you may visit.
Nice place to see but is very commercial. You could easily spend 3 hours at this temple. the ambience is good.

This is one of the fantastic temple in Bangalore. So beautiful, mind blowing and awesome. I want say all the travelers if you are not visiting here means unsuccessful your trip.
So so good temple
Though it is a spiritual place, it is more like a tourist spot and a shopping mall. Don't understand, this one is for devoting us to Lord Krishna or a business center.

This temple is much different from the other ISKCON temples I have visited. This is a blend of South and regulat ISKCON architecture.
There are many Perumal sannidhis like in any South Indian temples.
But the main Radha Krishna- Chandra idols are like in other ISKCON temples.
There are too many shops inside the main temple.... One is forced to go through all of them.
But over all a great experience

I'm told that Higher Taste, the Sattvic restaurant at Iskcon is hosting a Hare Krishna festival. This restaurant is a personal favourite. Come on, I'm sure you'll agree that the offerings are so innovative & that too within Sattvic standards.
Ok having said that, a warm pumpkin soup arrived at the table. My co-diner commented that Its smooth and flavorful. Agreed. Then a variety of appetizers awaited us. The best ones are the dal kachori, the fluffy casing has a nice moong dal mixture. Yummy I thought.
But actually I liked the mochar chop more. Can't help it. This is a popular Bengali banana flower snack, great taste & texture & of course, very nutritive.
Coming to main course, I saw that there was Shukto, another Bengali dish. Ok, Its made of lauki, so Its low cal.
Even as I wondered about this range of Bengali offerings, I was given to understand that that AC Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, Iskcon's founder was a Bengali & this explains the presence of so many Bengali delicacies. I believe when Swami Prabhupada was in US, he served Indian food & in turn was treated to pizzas & things like that. Ah, I now understand how the festival has such diversity. Too much food, I thought.
No wonder there was gauranga potato, that's baked potato with herbs. But I must say the Shukto & the rich creamy paneer kalia are wonderful with Indian breads. Of course, diners also enjoyed the phul kopi roast, which is a nice marinated skewed cauliflower. South Indian staples like the Idiyappam aka String Hoppers with a subtle stew was lovely. The traditional lot stuck to the rasam rice.
Kids loved the live counter with papdi chaat and pani puri. Kids also relished the dessert counter. Soft cakes and a live counter serving malpua with thick rabdi are attractions. Malai ladoo is gorgeous, soft & somewhat creamy. I'm so used to a blueberry cake, but here I was surprised to find a blueberry halwa, so different from the regular suji halwa.
Thumbs up to this veg meal.
Sony

It was my first visit to any ISKON temple and what impressed me is the maintenance and cleanliness. The constant chant of 'hare rama hare rama- rama rama hare hare, hare krishna hare krishna - krishna krishna hare hare' is something i experienced was first time. There are steps made in the queue for general entry and you are asked to repeat this chant on every step and then only move forward to the next step. I think this is a way to maintain the queue as the VIP Darshan people are not asked to chant. The inside of the temple is beautiful and peaceful. The exit is marred by shops selling food handicrafts etc. Thts not expected of any temple though..pure commercialization

The is on temple is the most important attraction in Bangalore. Located in the heart of city it plays a great role to tourists. The place is neat and clean and highly secure. You need to put chappals outside with no cameras. It is a big place with Lord Krishna in the center. Very well directed and well maintained. Should visit in Bangalore.

mandir was decorated veey nicely.

You need to put chappals outside with no cameras. It is a big place with Lord Krishna in the center. Very well directed and well maintained. Should visit in Bangalore.
I went with my family and it was amazing experience. The temple is closed in afternoon, so please confirm the timings before making any plans.
the located is really in the center of city, the inside of iskon is so beautiful, a lot of local people go there for worship, good place for visiting
Its very cool inside and had a peaceful visit. Better to go in the morning. Nice to sit there for some time.

It's one of the iconic spiritus place build in modern times . Well maintained .

Easily be the identity of Bangalore .

Too much commercialisation after darshan

The temple is awsome. We needed a wheel chair for my mother and it was readily available. The access was easy and darshan was good. Some of the smaller temples are not accessible by wheelchair. The exit route is via shopping area and food stalls. These are always packed and the place gets little messy. Ample parking available.

The colossal temple, located on the Radha Krishna hill overlooking the Bangalore Metro and the city, is a serene place to go away from the din and bustle outside. Went to this place a few times, and the atmosphere instills a calm; there are "aratis" in the evening when lots of loud chanting and dhols are played with the "purohits" performing the arati. There are many idols of Radha and Krishna and a place for meditation.

There are some food stalls towards the exit, where one can get nice sweets at a reasonable price, which are healthy as well. I like this place very much, and go there whenever I need to spend some time with my soul.

Its one of the biggest Krishna temple in Bangalore. There are 2 other temples Venkateshwara temple and Narasimha Temple inside the same premises.
The best thing one would enjoy is the Harinaam Dwar where devotees will chant the mantra Hare Rama Hare Krishna and will reach to the temple. Kids will enjoy the multiplex which hosts movies on Lord Krishna. Good eat out options available inside the temple, I personally liked the samosha. paid parking available inside temple premises. Cameras not allowed inside the temple.
The best time to visit the Deepotsav during Diwali festival.

I went there in July 2015 and was totally mesmerized by the temple.
It's so much positive energy there.
Idols of Lord Krishna are worth giving a look and you feel spiritually energised after spending some time here.

We visited early in the morning to charge our energy. Its like morning walk start from shose off to enter temple and cross different levels to reach almighty..
Stay for long time in front of God finish your prayer sit for while and charge for day energy
This awesome temple of lord Radhe-krishna is situated near to yeshawantpur.The arrangements are awesome and reachable from the bangalore city via bmtc services.
The details of this temple are impressive. The ceilings inside are elaborate murals with idols made with such intricate detail. Beautiful and worth the visit.
This temple gives you so much inner peace, the hare krishna, hare radhe chants, the beautiful pieces of art and the calmness one gets when one is sitting inside the temple.

I had a nice darshan of Shri Radha-Krishna at the ISKON temple situated on a hill in Bangalore. The evening Aarti is a good sight with dancing devotees. However, it does get somewhat crowded on weekends. The also serve vegetarian thali lunch to visitors at the temple complex.

It is an overcrowded place, it was my first visit just to know what it is like. It is a highly commercialized and crowded place now. Will not go to this place second time even though I have great regard for its founder Swami Prabhupada Ji
Its vegetarian food restaurants are OK
Nice commercialize complex with help of god half day can be spent here.hare rama hare ram ram ram hare hare hare krishna hare krishna krishna krishna hare hare
the iskcon is famous krishna temple. and its is decorated very nicely. everyone has to visit this place once. its really nice place. the jaap of hare rama and hare krishna was adorable and touching.
This is no more a temple they have made it commercial outlet with cake shops and toys inside the mandir.
Awesome & must place to visit when you are banglore. Lord Krishna and inside ambience is just wow !!
Must visit when you are in bangaluru. It closed between 12 to 4 pm, so visit accordingly. They have seprate line for VIP visitors for a nominal charge for fast visit.
This is the best temple in Bengaluru. Really nice infrastructure for this temple. Everything systematic inside the premises. We loved this place.

So many temples visited during my trip but this one is so beautiful.
System to handel peoples is quite nice here.
Iskon shop is also quite good
A very well maintained place. I am a religious person and I went here with my family because I had heard so much about this place and it happened to be close to where we were staying.

ISKCON is one of the best place to start your day trip in Bangalore. Very good ambiance and bliss. Good administration and neat & clean. Good restaurants and good facilities. Dont forget to enjoy the Sweet Boli made here. You can have a bot of shopping as well. Laddu prasadam is also a must.

ISCKON temple by its name has always been a tranquil place with beautiful idols of Lord Krishna and serene ambiance. Living upto its name, ISCKON Bangalore is a fully divine place to be. You can spend hours sitting there watching the architecture and decor or you can also delight yourself with delectable delicacies they have towards the exit part of the temple ranging from Gujarati khaman to kulfi and jalebi etc, that too at a very cheap price. They also have a handicraft centre with pretty things to buy and also a store with religious books, CDs etc at a very nominal cost. I would love to visit here during a grand Puja/Bhakti event.

‚ÄúExcellent place‚Äù

You should visit this place if you visit Bangalore. Its located near metro. This place is nice.The top interior is very nice. Prasadam kichadi nice.so many shops on the way inside the temple for business concept.Check the timings before going. Well maintained temple. ladoo is very nice.

I used to love to go to the ISKCON Delhi as a kid but my first and definitely the only experience of ISKCON Bangalore was terrible.
It looked more like a big market than a temple. This is not something you expect when you go for some peace of mind. seeing everything so commercialized made me feel like being used in the name of temple.

A very well maintained place.

I am not a religious person at all and I went here with my family because I had heard so much about this place and it happened to be close to where we were staying and we had a whole day with nothing else to do and so we decided to give this place a try.

And I'm glad that I did.

After a few minutes in this place something started bothering me, something that was not quite what you would expect in a temple and I couldn't put my finger on it.

And then it hit me!

This place is CLEAN! And no SMELL!! No beggars at the entrance!!!

The cleanliness is something that you do not associate with temples usually. There, I have said it. Sad, but true. Let us face the truth....temples are not very clean because you usually see rotting fruits, coconuts and flowers being thrown around and temples usually have a peculiar but unique smell (like our railway stations. You can smell a railway station before you reach it).

ISKCON is squeaky clean and only has a pleasant smell. That is a big plus in my book.

There is a constant, repetitive, droning chant going on over the discreetly placed public address system. You can not escape it. It follows you everywhere like Mary's little lamb. If you like such things, you'll find it quite peaceful and divine. For me it got old in a hurry and started driving me a little crazy after an hour or so.

Well, that's just my opinion. You may find the droning voice quite soothing.

They have a big area selling some nice posters, statuettes, lovely T shirts and other trinkets.

There is a big walk-around restaurant where they sell very good, tasty meal for a very reasonable price. This place was not that clean but I think you should blame it on the people who visit and not the management. Even though there are many dustbins some people were dumping their plates where they stood and not in the bins.

But I think we will learn to keep our public places clean very soon. Like in a million years. I mean, what is the big hurry?

As you leave, they give you prasadam which is quite tasty. They give it in a disposable cup and again our people just eat and dump those cups all over the place except in the dustbins.

Only these two areas are not so clean (even though the employees/volunteers keep picking up the discarded food plates).

Give this place a try.

You will need at least 2-3 hours inside.

Srikanth H R

Shree Krishna Temple created and managed by ISKCON group. Very peaceful and devotional place. While returning from main temple you may fell you are in a plaza. As they make you to go through small market.

A good place to visit for sight seeing. Be aware that you have to be a barefoot to get into the temple. The higher priced ticket is worth it. Just get the middle one. Unless you are interested to get to know more about the Krishna.with videos and songs package.

Its a beautiful place..Inside the temple there are 2 types of queues i.e ordinary and expensive..If you are not ready to wait some time in the queue,you can go for second one..You need to pay some money for that and you can directly go inside the temple..
Inside the temple there are counters for spiritual books,toys etc..Also you wll get snacks at reasonable price..Free Prasada is also available..Photography is prohibited inside the temple..But you will get some good snaps from outside..If you have bags or something,you need to keep it in the respective counters..They will charge some money for that.
highly recommended temple in Bengaluru. very neat and clean place. it is very refreshing place in Bengaluru.

I visited the temple around 15 years back and after that I was fortunate enough to visit in aug 2015. Visited the temple with my sister. The locality around has changed tremendously but the temple remains the same. I have heard that the mornings and evenings rituals are a spiritual experience.

Iscon temples throughout the world are must visit temples.
Mediate and feel peace and get lost in Radha Krishan.
I only dislike one thingh that these places have become eateries also.
Like any ISKCON center, this is clean and peaceful. One can find a quiet corner and rest awhile. Nice when singing is happening
A nice and quiet place for followers of Lord Krishna. There is a free lunch prasadam for devotees otherwise there is a basic restaurant and a hotel next to the temple.
The top of the hill attraction is what makes this temple different from other temples in and around the area. Especially the night aarti and the way it involves everybody is very interesting.
this is a place where people can pray without fear. it is a place where you listen to voice of good and also enjoy the place in very different manner.

It is a decent place to visit. But will not vouch for the quality of the crowd. All staff are very courteous and alll willing to help. Awesome prasadam! ! Very good and well maintained ambience and sanctity. Again visiting crowd does not follow the rules stipulated. Nice statues of deities. Very nice pooja.

I visited the temple with my parents.They liked it.The inner architecture ,paintings are impressive. We had to stand in queue for the darshan.3 stages are there for darshan.Before entering temple we had to remove shoes.They have foodstalls inside.Only problem is you have climb up and down many stairs.In final stage there is place to sit and watch Radha Krishna idols

Ambience was good but people focus on selling and collecting money. I felt as if I m in some local market where people are shouting mam take this book this is for this much take this dress take this CD etc
ISKCON temple is situated in Yashwanthpur and is around 10 kms from the heart of the city. This calm temple offers you a great atmosphere to experience divinity.

Sri Radha Krishna Temple ( Kannada - ‡≤∂‡≥ç‡≤∞‡≥Ä ‡≤∞‡≤æ‡≤ß‡≤æ ‡≤ï‡≥É‡≤∑‡≥ç‡≤£ ‡≤Æ‡≤Ç‡≤¶‡≤ø‡≤∞ ) has deities of Radha and Krishna located at Rajajinagar, in North Bangalore, Karnataka, India. It is one of the largest ISKCON temples in the world.[3] The temple is a huge cultural complex that was inaugurated in 1997 by Shankar Dayal Sharma. The project was conceived and executed by Madhu Pandit Dasa following the wishes of HDG A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of ISKCON to promote Vedic culture and spiritual learning.

The temple as such is beautiful, divine. We really didn't want to miss the temple having come to Bangalore on a short trip. Only thing about the way - too tough for aged people to climb. I took my mom who almost started panting mid way. Too many steps and too long a way to reach the main temple. They should cut short the way for senior citizens and people with disability. The cars can reach till up. But not everyone can afford a car ride.

We enjoy a lot. Vary good temple , peaceful place to visit , good management , awesome place. I think their should be no charges to enter the temple. I saw three row one who pay 300 another 1000 or least one who pay nothing. Who pay more get more chanxe to go near to God
Superb place in Bangalore you will get peace, beauty everything here.if you are going Bangalore you should visit
ISKCON, Bangalore is very peaceful place to have good meditation. ISKON is clean Krishna Radha Temple, must every one see.

one of the landmark of Bangalore the temple was constructed around 20 years back. The temple has 3 temples one dedicated to Lord Prahlada Narasimha, one to Sri Balaji , One to Lord Radha krishna, Sri Krishna Balaram and to Sri Nitai Gauranga. the temple is very well kept and the deity's are very well decorated.

If you get a chance one can also see the operation of the Akshaya patra kitchen which feeds 1.4 million children in India and operates mainly during the mornings. They also have the higher taste restaurant where one can have delicious prasadam. A must visit to one who visits bangalore city. Make some time so visit this place and if you request in advance a devotee can take you around .

The Akshaya patra is a very noble operation of iskcon Bangalore ande certainly needs our support.

The Iskcon temple is located near to the Yeshwantpur station. It can be reached by any of the public transport local train, metro, bus. The place is very well maintained and clean. The inside ambience is amazing. The main temple is spectacular.
Pro TIPs:
* Go early in the morning if you want to see the aarti.
* Free Khichdi can be taken multiple times. Dont feel shy to ask. They do not say NO :)
* Photography inside the main temple is not allowed so do not try to take picture, you may end up getting scolded by the priests who are normally very smiling :)
I visted Iskcon temple for 2 times in my banglore stay. It was pleasant experience and awesome location.
Vibrant, Clean. You can find modern evolving Hindu culture here. It is not typical Hindu temple where Hindu's worship. Good for foreigner to get glimpse of Hindu devotion in modern times.
One of the finest modern day temples. Good design and Architecture. Holy and pleasant environment except for the exist that has merchandise

The ISKCON temple is an amazing experience if you want to emerge into the HARE-KRISHAN culture. I am from Brasil and the cultural impact it was great. The temple offers an insight of the religion along with beautiful architectural details. It's a must see. Be firm with beggars,
Very well maintained. Must visit if you're in Bangalore. Must remember shorts, sleeveless dress, skirts not allowed.

You can literally see how rich these people are. How much money they are spending here.
Anyhow a nice place to visit
Very nice, clean and organized temple. Recommended to go before 5 in the evening (if going on weekend). If you are not from India, you can buy some small gift items at the temple.
Very well maintained place. Clean, neat and tidy. Must visit place. Will feel the warmth and sclience.
Always love going here. The vicinity of god and the peaceful divine blessing is simply superb. you can be rest assured that you will come back rejuvenating your spiritual self.

Though it takes more time to reach the place because of traffic, once you enter the place you feel relaxed and happy. Late evening is the best time to visit the place, chant mantras and immense yourself with divine feelings.

A beautiful place but too much regulated queues....did not feel the spiritual vibes that one expects from such a place...much too commercialized .....but the food sold here is really good and the variety is nice !
Beautiful location and bliss you be at the time of aarti in evening. Enjoy God favourite prasad and forget all worries.
One of the finest modern day temples. Good design and Architecture. Holy and pleasant environment except for the exist that has merchandise

Very well maintained. Must visit if you're in Bangalore. Must remember shorts, sleeveless dress, skirts not allowed.

You can literally see how rich these people are. How much money they are spending here.
Anyhow a nice place to visit

Very well maintained place. Clean, neat and tidy. Must visit place. Will feel the warmth and sclience.

Beautiful location and bliss you be at the time of aarti in evening. Enjoy God favourite prasad and forget all worries.
Visit to this ISKCON temple, which is a great piece of architecture beauty, brings one again and again.

It is a must visit if you are in Bangalore. The grandeur, the style, the space is incredible. Make sure if you not in shorts or a dress which shows your legs if you are a lady, they have a dress code, if you happen to get their in a dress, they will loan you a skirt and stole. Ignore the pandas who ask for donations etc. Try out some food items at the end of the complex.

Beautiful temple...in fact, one of the most beautiful ISKCON temples. Magnificent structure, rich stalls selling varied books, souvenirs etc...luxuriously spread prasadam area selling variety if Indian and Western prasad items.

Very nice and peaceful. They have a dress code for people visiting there. People are not allowed in shorts. For ladies its better if they don't wear sleeveless dresses in temple, if so then you'll have to rent a Dupatta available at the security.

Very good place, people who really want to enchant Hare krishna they shud be thr...
They have great book and audio visual stuff as well to buy...
Best modern temple of the century..... When u enter we will feel peace and silent.... Its not only holy place but also a tourist attractive
Visited the temple on Sunday around 12:30 pm. Main hall was full of engraved structures and huge picture frames of Lord Krishna. Khichdi was really tasty. One advice- Check timings before planning.
Temple of modern spirituality! The restaurant behind (The Higher Taste) serves great vegetarian food! There's quite a lot of parking but can fill up quickly on auspicious days.
Excellent Shri Krishna Temple. I place must visit if you are staying in Bangalore. Very beautiful built and decorated.

brilliant temple complex and serene space in the bustle of the city
must go devotional place and prasadam is amazing
The place force you to forget every thing and loosing yourself in spritual feelings. This place does not require any recommendation. It is a must visit place of bengluru

Very impressive temple and attracts large crowds which does means large queues. The day I went it was raining quite heavily so the floors were wet and very slippery (you have to leave your shoes at the entrance before going in) so you have to be very careful. Also make sure you are dressed appropriately although there is the option of renting items of clothing when you get there. When we got there we were told what the entry fee was and we were sold a ticket that looks like it was a ticket that allowed us to fast track through the temple (avoiding the queues). Whilst we were not intentionally looking for such a ticket it worked for us given it was raining. The main hall was very impressive with the gold ornaments and the gold ornaments were beautiful.
Very big and attractive temple situated on hill.near yashwantpur railway station.very peaceful place.
I found this place very peaceful and beautifully constructed. The colors are very pleasant to eye and the idol of Lord krishna is a beauty, one should never miss to see.
we are not used to with this kind of temple, which looks like a palace, it's so beautiful but also something missing.
I had very bad experience there where don't request but force you or try to be over smart in approaching you for donations/ pooja fee etc. Very sad !
Good temple to visit if you have the time. Large crowds so get there early in the day. Was great to see the services live. Beautiful

This grand temple near to yashwantpur railway station is a must visit for all Shri Krishna devotees.
Even if you are an atheist you can visit this place for awesome vegetarian food within 100rs.

Neat clean and very peaceful filled with all the divine thoughts as you enter to the premises of the temple. Well managed and cooperative staff are always there to help you out with any problem that you might be facing. Food is also hygienic and you can get everything inside there.

This is one place can well compete with Thirupathi for finding business in everything around devotion. But then, Thirupathi has a heritage and archaeological relevance. ISKCON doesn't even have that. Vast buildings of concrete and marble, this place is surrounded with Bose speakers that chant and hum "Om" for that mega serial ambiance and then you will find numerous priests trying to sell you moksha.

Main purpose of the visit should be pray at the various temples within the premises. Membership allows you some benefits for admission and on birthdays. After darshan, visitors are made to pass thorough shopping arcade offering eatables and goods. All the eatables are prepared in the premises. Avoid weekends and festive occasions to avoid crowds. Has an amphitheater projecting films on devotion and the lord.

The ISKCON Temple in the city of Bangalore is worth a visit for it's uniqueness. Visitors have to pass 2 different deities to pay respect before reaching Lord Krishna's abode at the highest level.
Every evening, around 6-7pm, a ceremony is performed, complete with chants to Krishna. Krishna in different forms is in an impressive huge gold pagoda like casing.

Attraction is free, but no shoes,sharp objects, camers or bags allowed inside.
Good to bring umbrella or raincoat as stairs to temple are in the open air

Very peaceful place located in north west of Bangalore. The temple is well maintained and there won't be too much of crowd which means that the place can be visited anytime without spending long hours in the Q. There are opening and closing timings everyday. So call them on their contact num. given in the website before visiting.

I have been here on numerous occasions, compelled by my family who are the regular devotees here, this temple is indeed beautiful, Huge and certainly well done, however the biggest let down is that this is institution is a might commercial model, its always over crowded and it will take hours before you get to the sanctum. *** This is my personal opinion, *** i don't intent to hurt anyone's feeling. I write this though i am ardent devotee myself, the only thing that i cant connect to is where people pay and get the vip easy access / darshan, this is not something i can connect to. but that said, my salute to the cause of Akshaya patra, this is very well conducted.

The best temple I have seen in the city. The moment you step in, your spiritual senses will be taken to a different level. The art and sculpture is spectacular. You'll find an inner peace just by being here.

Excellent construction, amazing experience. Beautifully designed and able to handle huge crowds, nice very big hall so that pilgrims will not get tired while darshan.

Idols are very beautiful, and huge variety of food available after darshan.

Great visit..

It is a peaceful and very clean temple one would see in India. The approach to the main temple is well organized with separate paths for up and down as the temple is located on a small hill top except at few areas where the path is too narrow and may not manage big crowds. On the way to main temple first comes the Srinivasa govinda and then Prahlada narashima sannadhis. The main temple have Srinitai gauranga, Srikrishna balarama and Sriradhakrishna chandra gods. After dharsan one would step down through a large number of stalls including bakeries, which I felt too many in numbers very close to the main temple and looked odd. Then next comes prasada (annadhanam) distribution. After which one can climb down to the temple exit. At least one hour or more than two hours in case of elders is required to cover this temple.
This is one of place where I get real peace of mind. A slow light music in all over the temple is as pure as one want to make their heart to be.

Visiting the ISKON TEmple in Rajajinagar is of course a must for all the devotees of Lord Krishna - it is a showpiece of the Society for Krishna Consciousness.
But even if one is not a devotee this temple is worth a visit. The architecture is interesting, the temple is built at an elevation which can be reached by easily doable steps. There is sufficient parking, which is well handled by the security.
The place is clean and well maintained. I have visited the place on multiple occasions- on one occasion we were fortunate enough to meet one of the priests who showed us the living quarters of the students who study there.
The prayer hall is spacious and on most occasions there is enough space for one to sit in meditation or prayer, unlike in many other temples.
At the exit there are multiple stalls/ shops selling souvenirs and Prasadam. The whole experience of climbing to the temple, praying and visiting he shops makes it a family outing for many!
Inside the temple premises there is a lovely eatery called The Higher Taste serving sumptuous vegetarian fare - on the one occasion that I ate there , a Rajasthani food festival was on , which I thoroughly enjoyed.
Definitely worth a visit if you are in Bangalore

A clean and well organized temple. Even though thousands throng the temple complex on week days and even more on festival days, atmosphere remains serene. Religious activities go on seamlessly with lines of devotees/visitors patiently awaiting their darshans or just able to bypass the throng and carry on to the next leg. A very long walk with some climbing involved. Not all places are wheel chair friendly. From what I could see there are lots of members/volunteers handling the action very efficiently entry till exit. They do serve some wholesome prasadam. Can buy religious artefacts, books, book Poojas, food, handicrafts and few touristy items.

Main purpose of the visit should be pray at the various temples within the premises. Membership allows you some benefits for admission and on birthdays. After darshan, visitors are made to pass thorough shopping arcade offering eatables and goods. All the eatables are prepared in the premises. Avoid weekends and festive occasions to avoid crowds. Has an amphitheater projecting films on devotion and the lord.

Attraction is free, but no shoes,sharp objects, camers or bags allowed inside.
Good to bring umbrella or raincoat as stairs to temple are in the open air
